Skyland's Lodge Logo T-Shirt 50/50 Cotton/Poly.

Bring 6 cups of boiling water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Stir in 1 cup milk. Add 1/2 cup chopped onion and 1 can (10.5 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup. Stir in 3 cups long grain rice and 1/3 cup sliced mushrooms. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Add 1 cup chopped onion and 1 cup diced green pepper. In a large skillet saute 1/2 cup chopped onion in 2 tablespoons butter for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup milk and 1 teaspoon dried thyme. Stir in 1 1/2 cups cooked, cubed chicken. Cook for 5 minutes. Spoon half of chicken mixture over cooked rice mixture. Sprinkle with 1 cup chopped parsley. Spread remaining chicken mixture over parsley. Sprinkle with remaining parsley and 1 cup diced
Combine all ingredients and pour into a deep dish glass or bowl. Garnish with a cherry and serve.
Combine mustard and tabasco in small bowl. Stir in cream cheese and mayonnaise. Serve with crackers. Makes 1 cup.

In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar with the pecans and brandy. Simmer until the liquid is syrupy and the nuts are plumped and coated with the glaze, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heatstir in the brie cheese. Spoon the mixture onto a serving platter or plate. Serve with crackers.
Cook bacon until crisp and drain well on paper towel. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar, and cheddar cheese. Add bacon bits and mix well. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Blend curd and broth with ginger and next 4 ingredients. Stir in flour and cornstarch. Cut chicken into 16 strips. Dip each strip in mixture. Place strips in shallow dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile mix together yogurt and next 2 ingredients. Serve with chicken.

Mix together cheddar cheese, cayenne and 1 1/2 cups milk until well blended. Add in extra sharp cheddar and mix until smooth. Add in the cooked macaroni. Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish. Cut cold butter into small pieces. Mix together with remaining 1/2 cup of milk until crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the casserole. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown on top.

Heat peanut oil to a boiling temperature (it will smoke slightly). Break the eggs into a bowl (one for each person) and stir with a fork to break up the yolks slightly. When the oil is hot, quickly add the eggs to the oil (they should immediately start to set) and turn the eggs over after a few seconds with a spatula or ladle. When the eggs are half done (the whites will be solid but not hard), pour the eggs into the bowl of cooked rice (and green onions) and mix with the fork to distribute the eggs evenly through the rice. Season with sesame oil (optional) and a little salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Mix molasses, oil, vinegar and thyme in a bowl and set aside. Peel potatoes and place in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Roast in oven for about 10 minutes or until tender. Toss with the molasses mixture. Sprinkle with chives and walnuts and serve.
The most popular recipes with Potato
Potato is one of the world's most popular staples, in fact it is the world's fourth largest food crop (after rice, wheat and corn) with an annual production of over 300 million tons. The origin of the potato is unknown. It is believed to be a native plant of South America where it was first cultivated by the Incas 5000 years ago. The Incas called it the "mother plant". It was introduced into Europe by the Spaniards in the 16th century and by the 18th century it was cultivated in most areas of the world.
Potato is a vegetable with an amazing variety of shapes, sizes and colors which make it a very attractive dish to be served to

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add zucchini, toss to coat with oil. Cook until golden brown. Add parsley and toss to combine. Season with salt. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, combine all fruits. In a small bowl combine sugar, lemon juice, orange juice and lime juice. Toss fruit with this dressing. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour.

Cut chicken in half and place in shallow dish. Combine flour with bouillon cube and sprinkle over both sides of chicken. In skillet melt butter and saute onion until tender. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Pour milk in and bring to a boil. Stir in flour mixture and cook until thickened. Stir in ham and cheese and remove from heat. Spoon mixture over chicken and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Carefully remove seeds and ribs from each anaheim pepper (don’t use a knife or you’ll cut into them). Fill each pepper with 1 teaspoon of cheese and a pinch of salt. Beat together egg yolks, heavy cream and salt in a small bowl. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into egg mixture. Spoon a third of egg mixture into a large ovenproof skillet (about 12-inches)spread to form a thin layer over bottom of skillet. Lay peppers on top of egg mixturecover with remaining egg mixture. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until topping is golden browntop with remaining shredded cheese before serving. Makes 4-6 servings.

Place 1-1/2 cups strawberries in the bottom of a baking dish. Drain mangoes and reserve liquid. Coarsely chop strawberries with a knifecut mangoes into bite-size chunks. Spread berries in bottom of dish. Sprinkle with coconut. Combine flour, sugars, ginger, oats, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Drizzle with strawberry-mango liquid and stir until moistened. Fold in buttersprinkle mixture over the berries. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat broiler or grill. Combine soy sauce, sherry wine, garlic clove, ginger, honey and water in a small bowl. Heat through in a saucepan until boiling. Coat the halibut with the sauce. Place on a broiler pan or grill rack about 4 inches from the heat source. Broil or grill for 4 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
name: halibut au gratiningredients: fresh lemon juice, fresh thyme, butter, onion, shallot, potatoes, halibut fillets, cream, bread crumbspreparation:In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over low heat and add the onion and shallot. Cook until softened. Increase heat to medium-high and add the potatoes. Cook for about 3 minutes or until the potatoes begin to brown on the edges. Add the fresh lemon juice and thymeincrease heat to medium-highstir for 1 minute. Stir in
In a pitcher combine the rums and brandy. Add the triple sec and OJ. Pour into tall glasses and garnish each glass with a lime.

Clean out the mushrooms and set aside. In a large saut pan heat olive oil and butter until the butter melts. Add the breadcrumbs and toast them until they turn golden brown. Add the minced garlic, the parmesan cheese and the oregano and mix well. Add the Italian parsley and mix well again. Fill the mushrooms with the stuffing. Place the stuffed mushrooms in a baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until the topping is lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Cut the tomatoes in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and pulp. Arrange the halves cut side up in a shallow baking pan and sprinkle with the sugar and seasonings. Drizzle the oil over the tomatoes and roast for 2 hours in a 250 degree F. oven until the tomatoes have dried and are wrinkled.
Slice zucchini and squash thin. Saut in a skillet with onions and garlic until tender. Stir in sauce. Cook until heated through. Serve over hot pasta. Garnish with cheese and basil.

Combine evaporated milk, sugar & salt in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until it reaches the soft ball stage. Remove from heat and stir in marshmallows and white chocolate chips until melted. Stir in lime rind and juice and pour into buttered 8x8 pan. Let cool for 2 hours and cut into squares.

Stir dry ingredients together. Add liquid, mix well. Divide dough into four parts. Roll each part out into a circle about 6 inches wide. Cut each circle into four triangles. Put on cookie sheet with the tips of the triangles pointing up. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly browned on top.

Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowladd basil and chili powdertoss gently to coat. Preheat oven to 375 F. Place potato mixture in a 2-qt. baking dishsprinkle with flourtoss gently to coat. Bake 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with olives.

Heat oven to 350f. Cut the zucchini into 1/4 inch slices. Place the chicken pieces in a 9x13 inch pan. Mix together the sauce, oregano, salt and pepper. Pour over the chicken. Place the zucchini slices over the chicken. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Meanwhile cook the white rice. When the chicken is done remove from the pan and set aside. Add the cooked rice to the pan with the sauce mixture and mix well. Spoon the mixture over the chicken. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine 2 tsp garlic clove, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tsp soy sauce and 1 tsp hoisin sauce. Pour 1/4 cup water into the sauce and stir until smooth. Set aside in a small bowl. Rinse chicken wings in cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/2 tsp garlic, 1 tsp cayenne and 1/4 tsp sesame seeds. Dip each wing in the sauce and then toss with the cayenne mixture until completely coated. Place in a large baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until wings are done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with 2 tbsp sesame seeds and scallions. Serve warm with rice and broccoli.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add flour and paprika. Stir until smooth. Slowly add soup, stirring. Add broccoli and chicken. Simmer until heated through. Stir in rice. Remove from heat. Spoon into 13x9 pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Serve.
In a small mixing bowl, combine all ingredients and mix well. Refrigerate for a few hours or overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with butter or nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the cabbage, carrots, green onions, milk, egg, parsley, parmesan cheese, and 1 teaspoon salt. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown and the mixture is bubbling, 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Season steaks with garlic, ginger, soy sauce and pepper. Cover in flour and brown in hot pan. Pour off fat. Add lemon juice and water. Bring to a boil. Cook, uncovered for 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Serve over hot rice.

Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add tea bag and let steep for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemonade concentrate and orange juice concentrate. Stir in bourbon. Chill thoroughly in refrigerator. Serve in glasses over ice. Garnish with orange slices. Makes 8 servings.

Bring broth to boil in large saucepan. Stir in chicken. Reduce heatcover and simmer 8 min. Combine orzo and chicken mixture in large bowl. Add lemon peppertoss to coat. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlicsaute 1 min. Stir in bell pepperssaute 2 min. Stir in asparagussaute 3 min. Add to orzo mixturetoss. Garnish, if desired.

Chop 6 to 8 whole potatoes into quarters lengthwise. Wash, then put in a large pot with 1/2 cup of cold water to cover the bottom. Cook until tender. Mash with a little milk and a stick of butter. Season with lemon pepper to taste. Add more seasoning if desired. Serve with chicken, pork chops, or meatloaf.
Potato Salad with Bacon, Potato salad with bacon, Potato Salad with Bacon and Eggs, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo, Potato Salad with Bacon, Potato salad with bacon, Potato Salad with Bacon and Eggs, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo Recipe, Potato Salad with Bacon Recipe, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo Recipe, Potato Salad with Bacon Mayo Recipe.
name: creamy cheddar potatoesingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar

Wash and pit cherries. Pour into a 3 qt. Saucepan. Add 1 1/2 cups of sugar. Cook over medium heat until the mixture begins to bubble and the cherries break down. Add 1/2 cup brandy and stir. Add 1 tablespoon of pectin and cook one minute longer. Ladle hot mixture into hot 2-quart jars. Cap and process in boiling water bath 5 minutes. Makes about 3 pints.

Preheat oven to 350 F. In a small bowl, combine the honey, parsley and Creole seasoning. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce. Line a baking dish with foil. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Dip the shrimp in the soy mixture and then in the honey mixture. Lay the shrimp flat on the baking sheet and bake for 5-8 minutes per side or until the shrimp are pink and opaque. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Serve with a side salad or steamed broccoli.

Grease a loaf pan with margarine or butter. Peel the bananas and mash with a fork or put them into a blender. In a large bowl, cream the butter with the sugar until well blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract. Add the bananas and the applesauce and mix well. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients alternately with the milkmix well after each addition. Pour into prepared pan and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Heat margarine until melted. Beat in eggs and applesauce until creamy. Add applesauce and juice, beat well. Stir in rest of dry ingredients and raisins. Pour into greased and floured 8 inch square pan. Bake at 375 F for 40-45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 10 min. Cut into squares to serve.

Combine first 6 ingredients in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk until smooth. Stir in chocolate candy coatingspread in a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove from pancut into 12 bars. Store in the refrigerator.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add the bell peppers, onions and garlic. Cook until they are tender and golden. Stir in fennel seeds and salt. Add sausage. Cook over medium heat until sausage is browned and cooked through. Place sausage mixture on the focaccia bread slices. Spread with pesto and serve.
1. Cut the bread into small cubes.
3. Heat oil in a pan.
5. Add the chopped onions and cook until they are golden brown.
6. Add the curry leaves and saute for a minute.
7. Add the bread cubes and fry.
8. Add the tomatoes and the salt.
9. Stir and fry until the tomatoes are done.
10. Add the coriander leaves and the lemon juice.
11. Serve hot with rice or chapathi.
1. Cut the pineapple into small pieces.
2. Put all the fruits in a bowl and add sugar.
3. Add lemon juice to taste.
4. Garnish with mint leaves and serve chilled.

Mix seasonings together and sprinkle over ribs in a large ziplock plastic bag or a sealable container with a tight-fitting lid. Marinate in refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours. Remove from marinade and discard marinade. Grill over medium heat 45 minutes to 1 hour turning often until done. Or smoke in a smokehouse for 4 to 6 hours turning every 30 minutes until done.

Cream together the first four ingredients. Mix in the dry ingredients. Fold in the buttermilk. Bake in a greased and floured 12-cup muffin pan at 375f for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 12 cupcakes.

Place 1 1/2 cups orange juice, lemons (4 wedges), rum, sugar and grenadine into a large pitcher. Stir well and refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Add ice to pitcher and stir. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry. Serves 4-6.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add squash and zucchini and cook for about 2 minutes. Stir in alfredo sauce and imitation crabmeat. Remove from heat and stir in parsley and red pepper. Spoon pasta onto a baking dish. Top with squash mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Top with crushed breadcrumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Drain the pineapple, reserving ¼ cup of the syrup. Cut the pineapple into bite-size pieces. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the pineapple, the syrup reserved from the can, the marshmallows, and the mild cheddar cheese. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the flour, the sugar, the reserved syrup, the eggs, the butter, the milk, the vanilla extract and the nutmeg. Cook until thickened. Pour over the pineapple mixture and stir to coat. Chill overnight. Serve with crackers.
Pineapples contain an enzyme called bromelain. Bromelain is a protein-digesting enzyme that helps to break down food. It is also a natural anti-inflammatory that helps to reduce swelling and bruising. Pineapples also contain vitamin C which is known for its ability to boost the immune system.
The flesh of the pineapple is rich in vitamin C, vitamin B6, vitamin B1, folic acid and copper. Pineapp

Brown meat in scallions in vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or stockpot. Add soy sauce and beef broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Add white potatoes. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes or until potatoes are cooked. Serve hot.

Cook rice according to package directions. Combine rice, shrimp, cauliflower, onion and green bell peppers. In a large bowl, whisk together dressing and lemon juice. Add to rice mixture and toss to coat well. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator one hour before serving. Add mayonnaise and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Serves 6.

Crust: preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) Mix flour and almonds together in medium bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat butter and cream cheese together until creamy. Beat in egg yolks and vanilla until smooth. Add flour and almond mixture and beat until well mixed. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour. Press dough into a greased 9 inch pie pan or tart pan and bake until browned and crust is set (about 15 minutes). Cool completely. Filling: Combine 1/4 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 cup water in small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat and stir in cool whip until smooth. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup powdered sugar and spread mixture over cooled crust. Top with sliced strawberries and strawberry glaze.

Combine flour and light brown sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg yolk and mix well. Press into greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 325 degrees for 35 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on wire rack. Melt chocolate and pour over cookie base. Sprinkle with nuts and chocolate chips. Cool completely and cut into bars. Store in covered container at room temperature for up to 4 days.

In a small bowl combine honey and soy sauce. Slice chicken breasts lengthwise into thin strips. Sprinkle with ginger and toss to coat. In another bowl combine cornstarch and egg. In a third bowl combine bread crumbs and sesame seeds. Dip each strip of chicken first into egg, then coat with crumb mixture. In a large skillet heat oil. Fry chicken until crisp and brown on all sides. Drain on paper towels.

Drain pork and beans. Heat oil in skillet. Cook hot dogs and bacon. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Add ketchup and honey mustard. Cook until hot dogs are heated through. Stir in beans and onion. Add brown sugar and heat until mixture thickens. Serve over hot dogs and bacon. Serve over hot dogs and bacon. Serve with chips.

In a zip-top bag, combine lemon pepper, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 3 tablespoons olive oil. Add the tenderloin. Seal bag and turn to coat. Let marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line baking sheet with foil. Remove tenderloin from bag and place on baking sheet. Bake until no longer pink in the middle, about 15 minutes. Slice the tenderloin and place in sandwiches. Spread the top and bottom halves with mayo and mustard. Serve.

Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan. Add onion and saute until soft. Add the chillies and cook until soft. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the sugar and cook until the mixture is the consistency of jam. Add the vinegar and fish sauce. Simmer until the mixture thickens. Cool slightly and then transfer to sterilised jars and store in the fridge. The jam will last for a couple of weeks in the fridge.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Saute the garlic and cumin for 20 seconds or so until fragrant. Add the raw shrimp and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for about 3 minutes, until the shrimp turn pink. Remove the pan from heat and stir in the parsley. Serve immediately and garnish with more parsley if desired.

In a small bowl combine all filling ingredients until well blended. Unfold pastry sheet. Brush edges with water. Spoon about 1 tablespoon filling in each corner. Top filling with a second sheet. Press edges together to seal. Cut each rectangle in half diagonally. Place in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Bake at 375° for 18-20 minutes or until golden. Cool 5 minutes before serving. Store covered in the refrigerator. Makes 24 servings (1 roll each).

In medium bowl, mix first 4 ingredients. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Grill or broil 5 minutes each side or until no longer pink. Top each burger with 1 cheese slice. Serve in split toasted hot dog rolls.
 Chopped BBQ Beef Sandwichingredients: Beef Brisket, Barbecue Sauce, White Onion, Dill Pickle, Jalapeño, Whole Wheat Hamburger Bunspreparation: On cutting board, cut beef into small pieces. Place in saucepan and mix in barbegue sauce until evenly coated and moist. Heat over low-medium until warmed. Spoon onto bun and top with onion & pickle slices. Top with additional barbeque sauce as desired.

Cook the ground beef in a large non-stick skillet with the taco seasoning. Drain off excess fat. Spread the cooked meat over the bottom of a 13×9 inch baking dish. Top with a layer of the chips. Spread the remaining meat over the chips. Cover with a layer of cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Top with the lettuce, tomatoes, olives and sour cream.
Combine all the ingredients except the chicken in a bowl and mix well. Add the chicken and marinate for 1 to 2 hours. Thread the chicken onto skewers and grill. Serve with lettuce leaves and rice.
combine all ingredients in a bowl.

In a sauce pan combine apples, orange juice, flour, sugars, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. In a 9x13 inch pan combine the crumbs and melted butter. Press mixture on the bottom of the pan. Top the crust with the apple mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender but firm enough to be able to handle them. Drain water and cool in ice water until cold. Cube the potatoes. Add the dill pickles and pickle juice, then add the onions and Miracle Whip. Add the mustard and paprika and stir to combine. Add the eggs (boiled or hard boiled) and stir to combine again. Refrigerate until ready to serve. This is great for picnics!
Place all dressing ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Rinse and slice potatoes. Place in bowl. Add dressing. Chill. Add celery and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine flour, rolled oats, sugar, desiccated coconut, ground cinnamon and salt in a bowl. Use fingertips to rub in butter until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Beat egg lightly. Add to mixture with apple and mix well to form a soft dough. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to about 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out with a 3-inch round cookie cutter. Place on baking trays lined with baking paper or nonstick mats. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 12.

Bring the milk to a boil in a pot over high heat. In another pot over medium heat melt the butter and sweat the shallots until translucent. Add the arborio rice and stir until the rice grains are well coated with the butter and shallots. Add the salt. Add the bittersweet chocolate. Add the hazelnuts. Add the milk gradually. Stir constantly until the risotto is soft but not too creamy. Remove from heat. Let the risotto cool down until it is lukewarm. Transfer to a baking dish. Refrigerate until completely cold. Whisk the eggs with the cream and the vanilla beans seeds in a bowl until smooth. Add the mixture to the risotto in the baking dish and stir until it is homogeneous. Add the white chocolate and stir until melted and homogeneous.

Combine all ingredients except for the egg and stir well. Add the beaten egg and mix well. Roll out dough on lightly floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into squares with a knife dipped in flour. Place on greased cookie sheets and bake at 350 degrees for approximately 10 minutes. Makes about 36 cookies.

Hard boil your eggs and let cool. Peel and mash with a fork or pastry blender. In a large bowl combine the eggs, mayo, dijon mustard, sweet pickle relish, steak sauce, paprika and dried dill weed. Stir well. Season with salt & fresh ground pepper to taste and adjust to your liking with cayenne. Chill until ready to serve.

Wash grapes well. Pat dry and add to a large bowl. In another large bowl combine the cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla and milk. Beat until smooth. Pour over the grapes and mix well. Spoon into a 2-quart container or glass bowl. Garnish with chopped nuts if desired. Chill before serving.

Prepare the sardines by removing the heads, tails and bones. Squeeze the juice of 1 lemon over the fish and set aside. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and fry the sardines until crisp and golden. Remove and place the fish onto a serving platter. Cut the tomatoes into quarters and add them to the pan along with the garlic and cumin seeds. Cook for 5 - 7 minutes or until the tomatoes are soft. Sprinkle the parsley over the tomatoes and spoon over the fish. Top with the feta. Serve with the french bread.

In a large bowl combine the egg and Tang. Beat with a hand mixer for 2 minutes. Add the butter and beat until fluffy. Mix in the vanilla and the flour. Drop by teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven. Remove from cookie sheet and let cool on a wire rack. Melt the chips and drizzle over the top of each cookie.

In a bowl combine crab meat, margarine, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add onion and garlic. In a separate bowl mix together bread crumbs and parsley. Place mixture in a well-greased casserole dish. Cover with crumb mixture. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees.

Combine brown sugar, soy sauce and mustard in a small bowl until smooth. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle both sides of salmon with salt and pepper, place in the skillet and cook until golden and opaque throughout, about 5 minutes per side. Place fish in a shallow dish and brush with half of the glaze mixture. Bake until the glaze is bubbling and browned on top and the fish is just cooked through, about 5 minutes more. Brush with the remaining glaze and serve.
Cut each lettuce leaf into 12 triangles. I cut the grape tomatoes in half. Cut the baby carrots into thin strips. Add the turkey and ham, cheese and veggies. I serve with ranch dressing.

Sprinkle salt and pepper on the chicken and sauté in olive oil. When cooked through and no longer pink, remove and cut into 1-inch pieces. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and stir until bubbly and golden. Stir in the broth and milk. Bring to a boil. Boil and stir 1-2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the chicken and heat through. Fill tortilla shells with meat mixture and top with any desired toppings. Serve with lime wedges.

Pour the water into a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the oats and stir. Turn the heat to low and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until the oatmeal is tender but not mushy. Meanwhile, mix the banana and peach together in a bowl. Add the flax seeds, and stir well. Add the rice milk and stir well. Add the cinnamon. Stir well. Spoon the oatmeal into a bowl. Top with the fruit mixture. Sprinkle the nuts on top.

Dissolve lard in boiling water. Pour over flour in a bowl. Mix well. Add salt to taste. Add enough cold water to form a soft dough. Knead dough until smooth. Divide into 4 equal parts. Roll each part into a circle about 1/8 inch thick. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely before cutting or filling.

Chop broccoli into florets. Combine onions and broccoli in a large bowl. Chop bacon into small bits. Combine dressing of mayo, sugar, and vinegar. Pour dressing over broccoli mixture. Add roasted sunflower seeds and raisins. Toss gently. Serve cold.

Cut off the bottom of the stems and trim off any brown outer leaves. In a large saucepan of boiling water cook the sprouts for 5 minutes until they are tender crisp. Drain the water. In a large saute pan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the brussels sprouts and toss to coat. Add the cranberries and walnuts and toss to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and season to taste. Serve immediately.
In food processor pulse together cream cheese, turnips, pepper and salt until smooth. Place in 1/2 gallon plastic baggie or in serving dish. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Scrub 4 large potatoesprick all over with a fork and place in a baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour 30 minutes or until potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork in the center. Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine Catalina dressing, garlic powder, parsley flakes and pepperstir well. Remove potatoes from the ovenhalve lengthwise and scoop out the pulp into a bowlmash with a fork. Stir in the dressing mixturemash until smooth. Place potato halves back in the panspoon potato mixture back into themsprinkle with cheesereturn to the oven for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serves 4.

Cook sausages until browned. Add garlic and cook for one minute. Add vegetables. Cook until tender. Add broth. Cook for another five minutes. Add spinach. Cook for another two minutes. Add cooked chickpeas. Serve with crusty bread.

In a food processor combine ground chicken, breadcrumbs, scallions, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Combine well. Form into 1-inch balls. Place balls into a baking dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until cooked through. While meatballs are cooking mix blue cheese dressing with hot pepper sauce and serve as a dipper for the meatballs. Enjoy.

Combine garlic salt and italian seasoning. Rub onto both sides of each breast. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Brown chicken on both sides. Add milk, cover and simmer until no longer pink inside. Remove from heat. Cut chicken into strips and serve over pasta with chives on top. Serves 4.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Brown chops on both sides, remove and keep warm. Add chili sauce to skillet and cook till thickened and bubbly. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to blend. Return pork to skillet and simmer till heated through. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Prepare 1 pudding mix according to directions on box using only 1 cup of fat-free milk. Stir in 2 tablespoons vanilla extract and allow to thicken. Whisk together 1 package gelatin and 2/3 cup fat-free milk and let stand for 1 minute. Stir into pudding mixture along with 1 cup fat-free whipped topping and pour into prepared crust. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

In a small saucepan combine the first 4 ingredients. Heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the remaining 3 ingredients. Simmer for about 20 minutes until the liquid is reduced by about half and the spices are very aromatic. Strain into a bottle & let cool. Store for up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator. This rum will taste better if you let it sit for 2 or 3 days before using.

Cook mushrooms in butter until tender. Remove from skillet. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain and crumble. Add half the cheese and cook until melted. Remove from heat. Divide filling between two flour tortillas. Top each with half the remaining cheese. Add sliced avocado. Heat in a nonstick skillet over low heat until cheese melts. Cut each quesadilla into wedges and serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

Preheat oven to 450. Cut potato into wedges 1/2-inch thick. Toss wedges with olive oil. Sprinkle with sea salt, chili and garlic. Spread evenly onto a baking pan. Roast for 20 minutes. Turn potato wedges over. Return to oven for an additional 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
name: crispy oven baked sweet potato wedgesingredients: sweet potato, olive oil, sea salt, ground cuminpreparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Cut sweet potatoes into 1/2" wedges. Toss wedges with olive oil. Sprinkle with sea salt. Spread evenly onto a baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes. Turn wedges over. Return to oven for an additional 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
name: homemade potato chipsingredients: russet potatoes, olive or vegetable oil, sea saltpreparation:Wash potatoes. Slice into 1/8-inch-

Whisk egg whites with peanuts until well coated. Add seasoning and mix well. Spread on cookie sheets and bake for 5 minutes at 400f until lightly browned. Remove from oven and sprinkle on sesame seeds and cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Separate crescent roll dough into 8 triangles. Place 1 piece of meat on each triangle. Bring sides of triangle up and over meat to form a triangle. Press ends of triangle together. Repeat with remaining dough triangles. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden. Meanwhile, prepare barbecue sauce. Combine ketchup with barbecue saucestir well. Pour 1 tablespoon sauce over each beef roll. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serve warm.
name: cheese rolls ups by juneingredients: evaporated milk, onion soup mix, cheese, vinegar, mustard, sandwich breadpreparation:Blend all the above ingredients except bread and melt together over double boiler or in microwave. Roll each slice of bread with rolling pin which makes bread easier to handle. Spread with filling and roll up. Freeze. Take from freezer, sprinkle with cheese and grill until cooked through.
name: southwest chicken and

Cook meat and onion and garlic in large pan until meat is no longer pink. Drain grease and return to pan. Add all other ingredients except cocoa and mix well. Transfer to slow cooker and cook 6-8 hours or until meat is tender. Garnish with shredded cheese and/or sour cream. Serve with salsa if desired.

Microwave onion and bell pepper until tender crisp. Add butter, lemon juice, salt, basil, rice and water to a microwaveable casserole dish. Cook on high for 5 minutesstirring after 3 minutes. Cook for another 10 minutes or until rice is done. Stir in chicken. Cook for another minute or until chicken is done.

Toast rolls in toaster or oven, about 1 minute per side or until golden brown. Meanwhile, combine goat cheese and mustard in a small bowlspread on one side of each toasted roll. Top with ham and roast pork, then stack with 3 dill pickle slices, bottom side up (this will keep the slices from getting soggy). Broil 2 inches from heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut on a diagonal and serve with olive oil drizzled over top.

In a bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Beat in the water and mustard until blended. In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat the sour cream until bubblyremove from heat. Stir in the eggs until well combinedreturn to heatheat through until warm, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the herbsremove from heat. Grease an 8-inch ovenproof skillet or pan with the butter. Pour 1/2 of the egg mixture into the pan. Arrange the salmon on top. Pour the remaining egg mixture on top of the salmongently shake the pan to distribute the egg mixture evenly over the salmon. Sprinkle with the cheeseplace the pan into the oven and bake until the cheese meltsabout 4 minutes. Cut the omelet into wedges. Serve warm, garnished with chives and a dollop of the sauce.

Slice cucumbers and onion thinly. Add garlic clove and vinegar, and let stand for 1 hour. Add sugar, salt and seasonings and bring to a boil. Cook for 3 minutes. Pack into sterilized jars and process for 10 minutes in hot water bath.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook the rice in water and salt until tender. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Slice the mushrooms and saute them in the butter until tender. Season with pepper. Drain the rice and mix it with the mushrooms. Add the flour and mix well. Beat the eggs together with the milk in a bowl. Add the egg mixture to the mushroom and rice mixture. Transfer the mixture to a greased casserole dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown.

Boil water in a pot. Add rice, stir until water is absorbed. Add frozen vegetables and stir until heated through. Add the pork chops to the pot, then add the cream of mushroom soup. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until the meat is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Soak the noodles for at least 15 minutes. Drain the noodles and rinse with cold water. Drain again and set aside. Cook the shrimp in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside. Drain the mango, dice into 1-inch squares and set aside. Combine the rice vinegar with the sugar and salt. Toss the noodles with the mango and shrimp. Add the dressing and toss again. Serve with the scallions and basil.

In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except almonds and black pepper. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Toss again and refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with almonds and pepper just before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. In 12 muffin cups combine 1/2 can biscuit with beef and seasoning in medium bowl, spreading evenly in each cuptop with remaining 1/2 can biscuit, pressing down slightly. Bake 12-15 minutes or until biscuits are golden browntop with 1 tablespoon cheddar cheese if desired. Serve with ketchup for dipping if desired. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add the onions. Cook over a low heat for 10 minutes or until soft. Add the flour to the pan and stir for a few seconds. Gradually add the milk, stirring all the time. Heat over a low heat until boiling. Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheese, stirring continuously until the cheese has melted. Season with mustard. Serve at once.

Slice the top off the apple. Hollow out the inside of the apple and save it for the filling. In a heavy saucepan heat the caramels and milk until the caramels melt. Stir well. Pour the mixture into the hollowed out apples. Place on a plate. Chill until the caramels are hard. In a small saucepan heat the cream and brown sugar until the mixture is very bubbly. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Place the apple on the top of the saucepan. Pour the mixture over the top of the apple. Let cool. Add the chopped nuts and candy bar. Wrap the apples individually in foil. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix egg with milk. Dip pieces of chicken in egg mixturethen roll in corn flakes. Place in a greased 9 by 13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl mix flour, salt, & pepper. Sprinkle over top of chicken. Bake 30 to 40 minutes.

Cook beans according to package directions. In a large bowl, combine pickled jalapeno, spicy mustard, honey, and vegetable oil. Whisk until smooth. Drain beans. Add to jalapeno mixture. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Boil the noodles in a pot with salt water until al dente. Drain water. Add the eggs into the pot, mix well. Add the butter and the sugar, salt and pepper to taste, mix well. Add the sour cream and the cottage cheese, mix well. Grease a baking pan with the melted butter, pour in the mixture and bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes until brown. Serve with sour cream or cream cheese.

Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat until hot. Add pork, onions, carrots, cabbage, potatoes and celery. Cook until pork is browned and vegetables are tender, 8-10 minutes. Stir in beef stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer until vegetables are tender and pork is falling apart, about 1 hour. Add syrup and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add marjoramcook for an additional minute. Serve hot with crackers or bread.

Bring water to the boil in a small saucepan with the tea bags. Cover tightly. Steep for 10 minutes. Strain into a bowl. Cool completely. Pour into a shallow dish with a lid. Place in freezer overnight. Stir mixture well every few hours with a fork to break up lumps of ice. Serve in bowls with additional lemon zest & juice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the rice, season with the salt and cook, stirring frequently, until the grains are opaque throughout and the pan is dry, 20 to 30 minutes. Add the coca-cola and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in the raisins and nuts and serve immediately.

Combine first 3 ingredients in medium saucepanbring to boil. Reduce heatsimmer 1 minute. Stir in pectin. Return to boilboil 1 minute more. Remove from heatskim off foam with metal spoon. Ladle into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Wipe rimscover with lidsprocess in boiling-water bath 15 minutes. Remove from cannercool.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and saute until the flour is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the wine and boil until the wine has evaporated by half, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Add the butter and the chicken. Reduce heat to low and cook for about 10 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Remove the chicken and keep it warm. Add the prosciutto to the pan, stirring to break up the prosciutto as it renders its fat. Season the sauce with the salt and pepper, adding more salt if needed to balance the flavors. Add the cheese to the sauce and stir until the cheese melts. Serve the sauce over the chicken.
Toss kale in olive oil in a large pot. Add leek. Cook on medium low for about 5 minutes or until kale is wilted. Add beans and seasonings. Cook on low until liquid is reduced. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a baking pan with vegetable oil cooking spray. Mix together the instant rice, onion, bell peppers, chili powder, and cumin. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread in the prepared pan. Pour the tomato juice over the top. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the rice is cooked through. Top with the whole tomatoes before serving. Serves 4.

In a saucepan over medium heat, saute onions and garlic in oil until soft. Add the vegetable broth, cover, bring to a boil, reduce to simmer, and cook for 10 minutes. Add broccoli and cook 10 more minutes. Add basil. Puree the soup with a hand blender or food processor. In a small bowl, combine the flour with a little water to form a paste. Add to the soup, stirring constantly. Add soymilk, soy sauce, and season to taste.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Place in a greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until meat is no longer pink. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Cook in boiling water until tender but still firm. Drain and place in large bowl. In a small bowl, stir together sour cream and mustard. Stir in potatoes and remaining ingredients. Serve at room temperature. Yields 8 servings.

Place bulgur in a medium saucepan. Add 1 1/2 cups water, bring to a boil and remove from heat. Cover. Let stand for 20 minutes. Add currants and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Toss to combine. Add pecans. Sprinkle with parsley. Toss to combine. Toss with vinaigrette. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Combine all in a large bowl. Add chicken and marinate for at least an hour. Preheat broiler. Remove from marinade and grill on skewers until done. Serve with baked potatoes and a salad.

Preheat oven to 180C. Place the eggplant slices in a shallow dish. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon oil and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Set aside for 10 minutes. Pat eggplant dry with paper towel. Spray a baking tray with cooking spray. Arrange eggplant slices on the tray. Bake for 15-20 minutes until tender. Combine remaining oil, oregano and basil in a large bowl. Season with 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Add eggplant and toss to combine. Transfer to a platter. Scatter olives and rocket over the top. Top with feta. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon dressing. Serve.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Beat well. Stir in remaining ingredients just until blended. Spread into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve hot with crackers or rye toast.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic to pan and saute for 30 seconds. Add escarole and saute until it wilts. Add bread crumbs and red pepper flakes and toss until mixture is coated with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the noodles with the onion juice and sauce, and mix well. Add the margarine and mix until evenly incorporated. Add salt and pepper to taste. In a 13 x 9-inch baking dish, layer half the mixture in the dish, followed by the swiss cheese and the remainder of the noodles. Mix the sour cream and the breadcrumbs, and spread over the top of the noodles. Bake until lightly browned and bubbly around the edges, about 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Season the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of a slow cooker. Add the garlic and rice. Add the lemon juice to the water and stir. Pour this mixture over the rice and chicken. Stir once to coat. Place the lid on the slow cooker and set on low for 8 hours. To plate, place a serving of the rice on each plate and top with 1 chicken breast. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs.

Preheat oven to 400. In an oven safe dish, toss the potatoes with olive oil and season to taste. Bake for 45 to 60 minutes until the potatoes are tender and the skins are crispy. Once they are cooked, toss the potatoes in the agave and lemon juice and serve.

In a large bowl combine 5 cups cooked broccoli florets, 1 tsp grated lemon zest, 2 tsp grated lemon rind, 1 tsp fresh basil leaves, 1/4 tsp dried basil leaves, 4 crushed garlic cloves, 1 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp crushed red pepper flakes. Toss until well blended. Serve immediately or refrigerate. May be frozen in airtight container for up to 3 months.

Chop the olives into small pieces. Cut the franks into small pieces. Chop the bell peppers. Thread the franks, olives, peppers and tomatoes onto the skewers. Heat the butter in a saucepan until it begins to bubble. Place the skewers in the butter and cook until done.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, whisk together the first four ingredients. In another bowl, whisk the butter, sugar, and vanilla until blended. Beat in the egg whites until blended. Gradually add the flour mixtureblend until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Cool on pans for 2 minutestransfer to wire racks to cool completely.
