Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine cheese with herbs in a bowl and mix well. Place in a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish and top with olive oil and cracked black pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Place the tomatoes in a colander and drain them. In a large mixing bowl, combine the drained tomatoes, beans, and corn. Add the onion and dressing. Mix well. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers. Serves 10-12.

Saute the onions and garlic in the oil until soft and light brown. Add the vegetables and turmeric. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the rice and mix well. Add bean sprouts and stir in light soy sauce. Add the button mushroom and serve.

Bring broth to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the jasmine and ginger and turmeric and bring to a simmerreduce heat to low and simmer until the broth has been absorbed, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, toast the peanuts in a dry skillet over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes, stirring often, until lightly toasted and fragrantset aside. When the rice is done, stir in the green onion, cilantro and the toasted peanuts and season with salt and lime juice to taste. Serve immediately.

Spread the refried beans on the bottom of a platter. Spread the guacamole on top of the beans. Sprinkle the cheese on top of the guacamole. Layer the remaining ingredients on top. Serve with tortilla chips.
This recipe was entered by one of our contributors. Do you have a great recipe? Please click here to submit your recipe.
Comments: This recipe was entered by one of our contributors. Do you have a great recipe? Please click here to submit your recipe.

Melt oil in a skillet. Add in garlic, saute for 1-2 minutes. Add in green curry paste and saute for another 1-2 minutes. Add in cauliflower florets and cook for about 5 minutes. Add in coconut milk. Let it simmer until the florets are tender. Add in cilantro leaves. Stir in chili powder and salt. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat garlic in olive oil in skillet over medium heat 3 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes and spinachcook 2 minutes. Cut chicken into 1/4 inch slices. Stir in chickencook 2 minutes. Add chicken broth to skilletcook until mixture is thickened. Stir in cream cheesecook until melted. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Serve over cooked pasta. Sprinkle with basil.

Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs. Stir in almonds. Blend in flour and amaretto. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 60 to 65 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. Spread with amaretto icing.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Drizzle 1 tablespoon oil in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Place chops in the dish. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons oil and sprinkle with black pepper and onion. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until pork is very tender and can be easily pierced with a fork.

Combine almonds and water in medium saucepan. Cook over low heat until water evaporates. Add butter and continue cooking until mixture turns golden brown. Remove from heat and add chocolate. Stir until melted. Add salt. Quickly drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper covered baking sheet. Let cool. Melt a few drops of water in microwave. Drizzle over treats. Allow to cool and harden. Store in airtight container.

Lightly coat ciabatta rolls with olive oil and garlic cloves, then toast in oven until tops are slightly golden brown. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine yellow mustard and pickles. Slice roast pork into 1/4 inch piecessauté in olive oil until cooked through. Crumble bacon into pieces. Spread mustard on one side of each ciabatta roll, top with roast pork, bacon, swiss cheese, and place other slice of bread on top to make a sandwich. Heat in a panini press until bread is golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Soak over night. Add water to cover by 3 inches. Boil until done. Add water if needed. Drain and rinse. Put back into pot and add ham hock or smoked turkey. Add enough water to cover by 3 inches. Boil until done. Drain and rinse. Add bacon grease and season to taste.
In a medium bowl, combine the strawberries, ice cream topping, maple syrup and orange juice. Refrigerate until serving time. Top with cashew halves.

Beat eggs in medium bowl until combined. Add chives and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat half of butter in 6" nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture. Cook until bottom is set. Sprinkle onions and cheeses on eggs. Cook until bottom is set. Slide onto serving plate. Top with salad leaves and serve.

Season fish fillets with garlic and herb seasoning, and cajun seasoning. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Lay out fish fillet between two pieces of wax paper. Press down firmly. Place fillet in freezer until solid. Slice into bite-sized pieces. Spread light mayonnaise on the inside of the bread slices. Sprinkle white cheese on top. Add lemon juice to taste. Top with fish pieces. Serve with sliced tomatoes.
Name: Onion and Herring Sandwich Smorrebrod
Ingredients: Butter, Pumpernickel Bread, Herring Fillets, Sweet Onion, Tomatoes, Watercress
Preparation:Spread 1 teaspoon butter on each slice of bread, being sure to cover each completely. Cut each buttered slice in half crosswise or into 2 pieces. Top each piece of bread with one-eighth of the herring, placing the fish smooth-side up. Top each with several onion rings and 1 tomato wedge. Garnish with watercress or parsley.

Cook bacon in large skillet until fat is rendered. Add onion to skillet with the bacon drippingsstir in mustardcook over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes or until onions are softened. Add spinachstir gently to blend thoroughly. Remove from heatadd oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Toss well to coat.
 cilantro lime riceingredients: rice, vegetable broth, lime juice, lemon juice, lime zest, ground coriander seeds, ground cumin seeds, garlic clovepreparation:Combine rice and broth in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer, cover, and cook until water has been absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Add lime juice, lemon juice, lime zest, coriander, cumin, garlic, and butterstir to combine. Let cool for 10 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork and serve.

Heat wine and broth in heavy bottomed skillet until simmering. Toss in the carrots. Add in the butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Cut up your carrots in to 1 inch pieces (smaller the better). Place your cut up carrots in a bowl.
Add your vinegar (or lemon juice) and mix it around until the carrots are all well coated.
Add your oil and mix well.
Let sit for 20-30 minutes (or longer if you have the time) in the refrigerator.
Remove from the refrigerator, mix well again, and serve!
Preheat oven to 350 F (175 C). Grease a baking sheet.
Toss the carrots with the oil, spices, and salt.
Place the carrots on the baking sheet in one layer.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the carrots are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife.
I LOVE roasted carrots. They are so easy and

Mix the flour and salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl dissolve the yeast in the warm water with a pinch of sugar and allow to sit until foamy. Beat the liquid into the flour mixture with a wooden spoon until a smooth dough is formed. Knead on a lightly floured surface until the dough is soft and smooth. Place the dough in a greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Set in a warm place to rise until doubled in bulk, about 30-60 minutes. Punch down the dough and divide in half. Shape each half into a round loaf and place in two greased 9×5-inch loaf pans. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk and the loaves have spread to the edges of the pan, 30-60 minutes. Bake in a preheated 375° F oven until the tops are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped, about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place whole cloves of garlic in the center of an aluminum foil square about 12 inches square. Wrap tightly in foil, leaving top open. Bake for 1 hour or until the garlic is golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool. Squeeze the softened garlic from the foil into a medium bowl. Add the onionstir well. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 minute or until the mixture is smooth and bubbling. Gradually add the white winecook until the mixture is smooth, thickened, and reduced by half. Stir in the heavy cream and the roasted garlic mixturecook for 2 minutes or until smooth and thickened. Stir in the salt and pepper until combined. Serve immediately.

Cover the raisins with wine in a large glass jar or crock. Add the figs and a few of the wood chips. Cover with a towel or cloth to keep out dust. Place the jar in a cool place such as a cellar or pantry for a month or longer. Strain the liquid from the raisins through a cheese cloth into a large jar or crock. Add the remaining wine, red wine vinegar and white wine vinegar. The mixture will be sweet and syrupy at firstas it matures it will become clear and aromatic. Store in a cool place for up to a year. Stir before using.

Combine berbere, cayenne, ginger and cardamom in a small saucepan. Add salt and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Strain into a bowl and set aside. Whisk in lemon juice and dry red wine. Add enough water to make 1 cup. Cool to room temperature. Store in sealed containers in refrigerator.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the butter, powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in the cinnamon. Spread over the cake or cupcakes of your choice.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat butter and cream cheese with mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in granulated sugar and vanilla until combined. Beat in egg until well mixed. In small bowl combine flour and nuts. Gradually stir into cream cheese mixture. Divide dough in half and roll each half into 10-inch log. Wrap each log in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours or up to 1 week. On cutting board, cut dough into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Drizzle with glaze and top with berries and mint leaf if desired. Glaze Ingredients: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 1/2 cup powdered sugar 1/3 cup milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1/2 cup confectioners sugar To make glaze, stir all glaze ingredients in small bowl until smooth

In a large saucepan bring milk to a boil. Add sugar and vanilla bean. Cook over medium heat, until sugar dissolves and mixture starts to boil. Stir in dried cherries. Reduce heat to low, simmer 5 minutes or until cherries are heated through. Remove vanilla bean from saucepan. In a bowl combine the cherry mixture, couscous and yogurt. Stir until well combined. Serve immediately or chill at least 2 hours before serving. To serve: Top each serving with a small sprinkling of ground cinnamon.
Cook the oatmeal and stir in the butter and the seasonings. Mix the eggs with the water and pour over the mixture. Cook over medium heat until the eggs are set. Serve hot.
Brown beef. Drain fat. Add soup and salsa. Simmer until heated through. Stir in cheese. Spoon over buns.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place fryer chickens on roasting pan in roasting pan. Mix together 2 tablespoons of water with 2 teaspoons of flour and 1 teaspoon of paprika. Brush mixture on each chicken with a pastry brush. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 30 minutes in preheated oven. Remove from oven and brush with more of the sauce mixture. Continue to brush every 15 minutes until done.

Place crackers in food processorpulse until crackers are coarse crumbs. Beat eggs in shallow dish. In another shallow dish combine crumbs with garlic salt, cayenne, Parmesan cheese. Dip tenders in eggthen coat with cracker mixture. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve with low-fat mayonnaise.
Wow! I am not kidding. I really did not think that I would be able to eat any of this. However, I am proud to report that I ate it all up. It was good.
I think that I will be taking this to my friends house tonight for dinner. It is so easy to make and I know that she will love it. I made it in the morning so that all I have to do is to put it in the oven before I leave.
I like easy meals. The first one sounds really good.
In a medium bowl, stir together the cheeses, mayo, onions, worcestershire sauce and cayenne pepper until well blended. Stir in the diced pimentos. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

In medium saucepan, combine the milk, cocoa and chocolate. Heat over medium heat until the mixture is boiling. Remove from heat and add the whiskey. Stir in the cream. Serve the warm in an Irish Coffee Glass. Garnish with chocolate curls.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spread almonds on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes until lightly toasted. Place garlic cloves on baking sheet. Bake until garlic is browned, about 10 minutes. Place almonds and garlic in a food processor. Process until almonds are finely chopped. Add red peppers packed in oil and vinegar. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Sprinkle with pepper. Cover and chill for 2 to 4 hours.
Place chicken in a crockpot or slow cooker. Add water, vinegar, soy sauce, onion, hot peppers, and garlic powder. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve on rice or hot dog buns.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, then stir in dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in apples and cranberries. Turn into a greased and floured 12-cup fluted tube pan and spread to within 2-inches of the top. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before removing from the pan. Dust with confectioners sugar before serving.

Add vermicelli, raisins, sugar and milk in a cooking vessel. Add cardamom powder. Cook the mixture on a slow flame till the milk dries up. Garnish with almonds, cashews, sunflower seeds and ghee. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare biscuit mix according to package directions. Add thyme, pepper, and milk to batterstir until well combined. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Pour batter into dish. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until top is lightly browned. Serve immediately.
In a bowl combine the first five ingredients. Divide mixture into 6 parts. Wrap each portion in foil. Place over coals to cook for 30-45 minutes. Serve hot.

Place meat in crock pot. Pour water over meat. Cover and cook 6 hours on low or 4 hours on high. Shred meat and mix in barbecue sauce and taco seasoning to taste. Serve on hot buns or over rice. Serves 4-6 people

In a saucepan over low heat stir together the granulated sugar, water, and marshmallow cream until the mixture reaches 240°F on a candy thermometer. Remove from heatbeat in the vanilla until the mixture thickens slightly. Divide the mixture between two 9-inch square baking pans lined with wax paper. Chill until set, about 4 hours. Sprinkle with the pecans and serve.

Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Stir the lentils into the boiling water. Bring to a boil and cook over high heat for about 15 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients and cook for about another five minutes or until the flavors have blended well. Serve hot.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until done but firm. Drain well. Combine basil, milk and flour in saucepan over medium heat until bubbly and thickened. Remove from heatstir in garlic and peas. Toss with cooked pasta. Serve with prosciutto. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired.
These sound yummy! I love that you can make the sauces in advance. That helps make dinner come together fast!
These look like great ideas!
My husband makes some of the best dishes with these. He has made them with sun dried tomatoes, basil, sausage, etc. I am going to try the chili olive one tonight for dinner! Thanks for the great ideas!
These all look so yummy! I think I would like the one with the sun dried tomatoes the best!
These all sound so yummy! I think I would like the one with the sun dried tomatoes the best!
I love how you can use these as a base for so many dishes!
I love all the creative ideas! Thank you!
I

Beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Add cream of tartar and beat for 2 minutes more. Gradually beat in the sugar. Add almond extract and walnuts. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on waxed paper. Yield: about 5 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Layer half the hashbrowns in the bottom of the prepared pan. Spread the melted butter evenly over the top. Sprinkle the cream of chicken soup over the butter. Layer the rest of the hashbrowns. In a large bowl combine the sour cream, the purple onion, the mustard, and the salt and pepper. Spread this mixture evenly over the potatoes. Sprinkle the top with the cheddar cheese and bake for 45 minutes. Serve topped with potato chips.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain. Cool. Combine with broccoli, cucumber and tomatoes. Toss with salad dressing and top with cheese. Chill. Garnish with more parmesan cheese if desired before serving.

Melt butter and olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add gingerroot and garlic and saut for 1 minute. Add flour and saut for 2 minutes. Stir in milk gradually, and stir until thickened and smooth. Add orange juice and zest. Serve over broiled salmon or halibut or vegetables.

In a saucepan, combine milk, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Add cereal and stir until thick. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper to cool.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add cake mix and vegetable oil. Stir in eggs and lemon juice. Pour into greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes or until done. Cool. Drizzle with powdered sugar and sprinkle with lemon juice.

Mix all the ingredients together except the spring onions and the pimento stuffed olive. Chill for at least one hour. Just before serving, arrange the spring onions and stuffed olive on top.
We have a couple of friends who are getting married soon and I wanted to make some bridal shower food to take with me. So I decided to do some searching and came up with this idea.
It's a pretty simple idea -- just make a bunch of recipes for different types of salads that will travel well and then bag them up and freeze them. Then I'll just thaw them out when I'm ready to go to the shower!
I also wanted to make sure that the salads would be easy to eat at the shower since the shower is scheduled for the day after work (on a work day!), so I decided to use only finger foods!
I made some finger sandwiches for the shower as well, but I'll save those recipes for another day!
This recipe was delicious and is perfect for any summertime picnic!
In a large bowl mix the chicken, corn, green peppers
Combine the first 4 ingredients in a bowlstir until the sugar dissolves. Add the remaining ingredientstoss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Yield: 4 servings (about 1/4 cup each)

Place the sparerib racks on the baking pan. Mix the catsup and soy sauce with the hoisin sauce and sherry. Reserve half of this mixture. Cut the ginger into matchsticks. Marinate the sparerib racks for at least two hours. Preheat the oven to 350f. Spray the baking pan with cooking spray. Bake the sparerib racks for at least one hour and up to 2 hours. Baste with the reserved mixture. Cook for another 30 minutes or until the sparerib racks are tender. Brush the honey over the sparerib racks. Turn the oven on to broil. Broil the sparerib racks for two minutes or until the honey is melted and bubbly. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Place the squash, cut side up in a baking dish with an inch of water in the bottom of the pan. Cover the dish and bake for 45 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the orange juice with the remaining ingredients. When squash has been cooked remove from oven. Let cool down for 10 minutes. Carefully scoop out the pulp from the halves and combine with the orange juice mixture. Place the mixture back into the shells and return to the oven and bake for 7 minutes more until hot and bubbly.

In a small saucepan, combine the garlic, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, the vinegar, the honey, the mustard, the thyme, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir often to prevent the mixture from scorching. Pour the mixture into a bowl and let cool to room temperature. Reserve the sauce for serving. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook for 1 minute or until tender. Add the garlic, increase the heat to medium-high, and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove the skillet from the heat and add the sauce. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in punch bowl or pitcher. Serve over ice in hurricane glasses or punch glasses.

Combine peaches, pineapple chunks and frozen strawberries. In large bowl, combine pudding mix and milk. Beat with wire whisk or fork until mixture is thick. Fold into fruit mixture. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour or overnight. Garnish with banana slices and serve.

Combine peanut butter, honey, and lemon juice. Stir in powdered milk and milk. Cook over medium heat until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in cheerios and dried cranberries. Stir until evenly coated. Spread on wax paper. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds. Let stand for 15 minutes. Store in air-tight container.

Heat oil and butter in a medium heavy-bottomed pan. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook for another 30 seconds. Add chili powder and cook for another minute. Add the rice and cook until it turns translucent and begins to toast. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the tomato paste and bring back to a simmer. Add the remaining ingredients and cook until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork.

Combine water, sugar and berries in a saucepan. Bring to boil and simmer until tender. Add pineapple preserves and horseradish. Continue to simmer until mixture thickens. Cool. Add mustard. Mix. Store refrigerated. Makes 2 cups.

In a mortar or spice grinder coarsely grind the fennel seeds. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and the ground fennel seeds. Season with the pepper. Gradually add the olive oil and whisk until the dressing is emulsified. Toss the shredded fennel and apple in the dressing. Season with salt and pepper. Add the onion and thyme and toss gently. Let stand for 15 minutes. Serve.

In olive oil, saute the onion until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until done. Remove from heat and add southern comfort. Add parsley to taste. In a large casserole dish, arrange the chicken pieces on the bottom of the pan. Pour the onion mixture on top of the chicken. Add lemon juice to the pan. Sprinkle with pepper and salt. Bake for 30 minutes or until done.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garliccook 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Add jalapenocook 1 minute. Add cilantro, tomatoes with juice, chilies, salt, oregano and cumincook 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in black beans. Cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with your favorite tortilla chips.

Cut the ends off the eggplants and slice them into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place the rounds in a bowl of water for 30 minutes to remove bitterness. After soaking the eggplant, drain and pat dry. In a large skillet or wok over high heat, heat oil until hot. Add the eggplant rounds and fry until crisp. Remove from skillet and drain. In the same skillet over medium heat, add the remaining ingredients and stir. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the eggplant and cook for 3 minutes. Serve hot.

Saute peppers and onions in oil for 5 minutes. Add seasonings and cook for 10 minutes. Add sausage and cook for 20 minutes. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Serve hot.
It would make it easier if you put the amounts of each ingredient used. I am not sure how much of each I would need for 1 serving.
I'm not sure how to use your recipe either!
If you would like to share your recipes, please post the amounts of each ingredient used in the recipe.
For example if you use 1/2 cup of this and 1/4 cup of that, then we can figure out how much of each we need to make the recipe.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In an ovenproof dish, combine the short-grain rice, half-and-half, butter, sugar, salt, pure vanilla extract and raisins. Stir well and bake uncovered for about 1 hour. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Serves 4
Cut peppers into 1/2" strips. Combine peppers, cooking onion, and chicken. Add seasoning salt. Cook until tender. Serve over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.

Wash and peel the potatoes and place them in a large pot of boiling water. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the potatoes are soft to the touch. Drain the potatoes in a colander and place them back in the hot pot for about 5 minutes to remove all the excess moisture. Remove the hot potatoes from the heat and add the butter while mashing them together with the back of the wooden spoon to prevent lumps from forming. Add the sea salt to taste and the cracked pepper. Add the warm milk one cup at a time while still mashing. Add the sour cream last and beat together.

Combine bread crumbs, tomato paste and water in a large bowl. Dip chicken breasts in this mixture. Fry in butter until golden. Place on baking tray and top with ham. Sprinkle on tomato paste. Grate over mozzarella. Bake until golden. Serve on bread.

Boil potatoes until tender. Melt cream cheese in a saucepan over low heat. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream, cream cheese, paprika, salt and pepper to taste. Fold in boiled potatoes until well mixed. Heat in a double boiler until heated through. Garnish with chopped onion.

Cut steak into bite-sized cubes. In a small bowl combine dressing, soy sauce and brothset aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute steak, stir-fry vegetables, orange segments, onion and rice in dressing mixture until thoroughly heated, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine the gelatin and cold water together and stir to dissolve the gelatin. Add the frozen strawberries, stir to mix well. Pour into mold of your choice or into a small bowl. Let chill until set. Unmold and serve with the sweetener of your choice.

Grease 12x8-inch baking pan with butterset aside. Beat together eggs, milk, powdered sugar, vanilla, cinnamon and nutmegset aside. Arrange 4 slices of the bread in prepared baking panbrush with 1 tablespoon egg mixturetop with 4 more slices of bread. Brush with remaining egg mixturesprinkle with remaining cinnamon-sugar mixture. Bake 350f for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with remaining powdered sugar.

Combine condensed milk and oleo in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar and chocolate chips. Pour into an 8x8 inch pan that has been lined with wax paper. Press in the coconut to the top of the milk mixture. Place in the refrigerator to set up for at least an hour before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Blend in milk and water and vanilla. Sift together dry ingredients and mix into creamed mixture. Pour into greased and floured pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes.
Name: John F Kennedy WafflesIngredients: Butter, Sugar, Egg Yolks, Egg Whites, Buttermilk, Salt, Cake Flour, Baking PowderPreparation:Cream butter and sugar add yolks. Add sifted dry ingredients. Add milk. Fold in whites. Pam iron.Name: Easy Peasy Quick Chocolate Orange CakeIngredients: Caster Sugar, Margarine, Flour, Egg, Baking Powder, Cocoa Powder, Vanilla Essence, Orange, Juice and Zest ofPreparation:Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the egg and the flour and baking powder. Add the orange rind and juice coco powder and vanilla essence.

In a slow cooker combine garlic and onion and cover with water. Add pork and cover. Cook on low 9-10 hours. Add cola. Stir in liquid smoke, brown sugar, ketchup and worcestershire. Cook an additional 2 hours. Serve with hot rolls.

Place raisins & ginger in a saucepan. Add dark rum. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium. Simmer until ginger is tender. Set aside to cool. Whisk together brown sugar, cream & milk in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Stir in vanilla extract & scrape the ginger raisin mixture into the sugar mixture. Remove from heat. Stir in cream. Chill thoroughly in a deep freeze. Puree in a food processor. Prepare ice cream according to your freezer's directions. Stir in rum extract & serve.

Cook sausage and cut into bite size pieces. Heat oil and add onions. Cook until transparent. Add flour and sausage and cook until browned. Add milk and season with salt and pepper. Add cooked pasta and let simmer for a few minutes to combine flavors. Serve with velveeta cheese on top.
Melt the unsweetened chocolate in a double boiler. Remove from heat. Add the boiling water. Stir the mixture until it is smooth. Add the sugar, then the light corn syrup. Stir well. Add the vanilla.

Preheat oven to 375. In small bowl, combine 1/4 cup butter with 2 T flour. Stir in milk until smooth. Add nutmeg and salt. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Cook 2 more minutes or until thick. Add spinach. Let cool. In a large bowl, combine remaining butter with flour. Stir in milk mixture until smooth. Beat in eggs. Stir in cheese. Pour into a 9" pie plate. Bake for 35 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

Grind the mustard seeds to a smooth powder using either an electric spice grinder or a coffee grinder. Transfer the ground seeds to a bowl and add the flour, crushed garlic and salt. Gradually whisk in the ale until it takes on a smooth, creamy consistency. Spoon the mustard into sterilised jam jars and secure with well-fitting lids. Leave to mature for at least 2 weeks in a cool place before tasting.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Combine margarine, flour and saltblend well. Beat eggs and milk until frothy. Add flour mixture and mix well. Stir in frozen corn. Spoon into greased 9-inch square pan. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake for 35-45 minutes. Serve with milk or margarine and brown sugar sprinkled on top.
In a small bowl combine honey and mustard. Set aside. Heat a small amount of oil in a non stick skillet and cook chicken until cooked through and browned. Serve with honey mustard dipping sauce.

Puree the watermelon in a blender until it is smooth. Stir together the puree and the lemonade concentrate in a large pitcher. Place the ice cubes and the mint sprigs in glasses and pour the mixture over the ice. Garnish with mint sprigs and watermelon wedges if desired.

Saute sausage, drain and crumble. Add onion and cook until transparent. Drain well. Add zucchini and mix well. In a bowl combine sausage mixture and egg, salt, oregano, garlic salt and pepper. Add cheddar cheese and mix well. Spread into a 13 x 9 inch pan and sprinkle with cracker crumbs and bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes.

Peel eggs and rinse well. Finely chop whites and mash yolks. Mix in mayonnaise, dill and seasonings. Spread on two slices of bread. Spread butter on remaining two slices of bread. Place buttered slices on top of egg mixture. Place remaining two buttered slices on top. Cut diagonally.

Combine paprika, garlic powder, black pepper and salt in a shallow dishdredge the chicken in the mixture on both sidesplace in a plastic bagadd the milkrefrigerate 1 hourprepare bread crumbs by placing the seasoned bread crumbs and the egg in a shallow dishdredge the chicken first in the seasoned bread crumbs and then in the eggshake off the excess eggplace the chicken on a wire rackplace the rack on a cookie sheetspray with PAM or any nonstick sprayplace the chicken on the rackspray the chicken on both sides with the PAM or nonstick sprayplace in the oven for 15-20 minutesturning once halfway through the baking timeremove the chicken from the oven and place on a serving platteradd 1 cup of melted butter to the pan drippingsstir to combineadd the remaining 1 cup of butter to the pan drippingsstir to combineplace the melted butter on the serving

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper cupcake liners. In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt until blended. In a small bowl whisk together milk, egg and oil. Pour over the dry ingredients and stir until just blended (batter will be lumpy). Stir in the bananas and the walnuts (if using). Fill the muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Soak apricots in the brandy for 24 hours. Remove from liquid. Stir in the sweetened condensed milk. Roll mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Place on waxed paper to dry. Store in an airtight container.

Melt 1 Tablespoon of butter over medium low heat and saute onion until soft. Add carrot and saute about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute. Add broth and simmer 10 minutes. Add turkey and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and basil and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add tortellini and cook 6-8 minutes or until tender. Serve with a sprinkling of cheese on top.

To make the dough, combine the dry ingredients together. Add the water and mix until the dough comes together. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Add the olive oil and knead 1 minute longer. Place the dough into an oiled bowl and turn it so that it is lightly coated with oil. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. The dough can be used immediately after refrigerating, but it will be easier to handle if allowed to come to room temperature for 1 hour before rolling out.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together 2 cups flour, baking powder and salt. In separate bowl, beat together 1 cup melted butter or oil and 3/4 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Add 2 eggs, 1 teaspoon lemon juice and 1/2 cup poppy seeds. Blend in dry ingredients and lemon rind. Fill greased muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Add Cool Whip Lite to strawberries and mix well. Spoon into parfait glasses and top with Honey Bunches of Oats and pecans.

Mix softened butter, brown sugar, cinnamon and egg. Add 2 cups of frozen cinnamon rolls to mixture and cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Spread with melted ice cream and sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve warm.

Bring a small amount of salted water to boil in a large saucepan. Add the asparagus and cook until tender-crisp. Drain well, shaking to remove all water. Transfer to a serving bowl. Lightly toss with butter, tarragon, lemon zest, and sugar to taste.

Crush rosemary and garlic in mortar with pestle to a coarse paste. Add peppercorns and mint leavesadd enough vinegar to make a thick paste. Mix mustard into soy and wineseason with salt and pepper. Marinate roast in mustard mixture for 4 hours or overnight. Remove roast from marinadesprinkle both sides with pepper mixtureplace in a roasting pancook at 400f for 25 minutes per pound or until meat thermometer registers 130f for medium rare. Let stand 15 minutes before carving.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the mustard, garlic powder, salt and peppercook for 1 minute. In a shallow bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, and melted butter mixturemix well. Dip the cutlets in the mustard mixture, then roll in the cracker mixturepress to make sure the coating adheres well. Place the cutlets in a baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven.
Fatty acid composition of the meat of the domestic fowl (Gallus gallus domesticus) during the period from 1 week of age to the 29th week of age was investigated by the method of gas chromatography (GC). The results showed that the content of saturated fatty acids (SFAs) such as palmitic acid (16:0), stearic acid (18:0), and arachidic acid (20:0) increased with age. On the other hand, the content of monounsaturated fatty ac

Preheat oven to 425. Place sliced apples in a baking pan. Stir together equal, cinnamon and salt. Add brown sugar. Spoon mixture over the apples. Add the margarine on top. Sprinkle with rolled oats. Bake for 1 hour until the apples are soft and the top is golden brown. Serve with vanilla ice cream or caramel sauce.

Peel potatoes. Cut into small cubes. Cook in boiling salted water for 20 minutes until tender. While the potatoes cook, in a saucepan combine the lemon juice, lemon zest, and the chives. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the butter 1 tablespoon at a time until the sauce is smooth. Stir in the cooked potatoes and stir to coat well. Serve the potatoes immediately with a sprinkle of fresh chives for garnish.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend well. Pour into a glass and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9×9 pan with cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, cream together the unsalted butter and sugar. Add the flour, baking powder, and salt. Mix in the milk. Spread into the pan and top with the peaches. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until the top is golden brown. While the cobbler is baking, mix together the lemon juice and cinnamon. When the cobbler is done cooking, sprinkle with the lemon mixture. Serve warm.
Preheat oven to 350. Grease cupcake tins. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients. Beat until smooth. Pour into cupcake tin. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

In a large fry pan over med heat, add olive oil, sweet onions, green bell peppers, and red bell peppers. Stir frequently until onions are tender. Remove from heat and add the minced garlic cloves. Add the bay leaves. Let cool slightly. In the meantime, remove the clams from the shell. Add the clams to the pan with the vegetables. Add the dry white wine and stir. Add the hot pepper to taste. Return the clams to their shells. Put the clams in the oven at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve as a side dish.

Melt chocolate squares with butter and stir until blended. Add sugar and beat until mixture is creamy and well blended. Add eggs one at a time and beat after each addition until smooth. Add vanilla. Stir in flour and nuts. Spread in a greased and lightly floured 13x9 baking pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for about 20 minutes or until set. Cool in pan on a wire rack for about 10 minutes. Cut into bars while still hot and place in a plastic bag with the cookies and shake until the bars are coated with cookies. Refrigerate and enjoy later.

Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl, combine garlic and ginger. Rub mixture into pork. In a large skillet or dutch oven, heat 1/4 inch oil. Add ribs and cook until well browned on all sides. Set aside. In a bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Heat to a boil and cook until thickened and bubbly. Pour over ribs in skillet. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Uncover and continue baking until sauce is thick. Serve over hot white rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Place pizza crust onto a lightly greased baking sheet. In a bowl combine beef, dressing, cheese, bacon and dill pickle. Spread onto crust to within 1/2-inch of edge. Bake 5 minutes or until crust is crisp. Top with tomatoes, lettuce and prepared mustard. Makes one pizza.

Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in dates, flour, cinnamon and baking powder until blended. Pour into greased 8x8 inch or 9x9 inch pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 35-45 minutes until golden brown and cake tests done. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Drizzle with lemon glaze if desired.

Bring to a boil with the bacon drippings, the molasses, the salt and the pepper. Cook over low heat for 1 hour or more, adding more bacon drippings if necessary to keep the potatoes from sticking to the pan. Remove from heat and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve hot.
In a bowl toss together the olive oil, garlic, rosemary, edamame and cannellini beans. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Scatter with the parsley, pecorino cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 400. Salt and pepper chops and set aside. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in large saute pan. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add chops and brown on both sides. Add baby carrots and red potatoes. Stir to coat with juice from the chops and saute until chops are done. Stir in parsley flakes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Grease and line a 900g loaf tin. Pre heat the oven to 180C/Gas Mark 4. Sift the flour, nutmeg and bicarbonate of soda into a mixing bowl. Mix the caramel mixture, egg and butter together in a saucepan over a low heat until smooth. Pour the caramel into the dry mixture and mix well. Fold in the mashed banana and dates. Tip the mixture into the prepared tin and spread evenly. Bake for one hour. Leave to cool in the tin. When cold slice and spread with butter icing. Decorate with banana slices.
Brown meat. Add other ingredients and simmer for at least two hours.

Combine the flour and sugar in a large bowl and mix well. In another bowl mix together the melted butter, milk and eggs, then add the vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and stir well. Stir in the cornmeal and mix well. Spray a 13x9x2 inch pan with cooking spray and pour in the batter. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes about 24 servings (1/2 of a piece)

Heat oil in pan. Dust chicken with flour. Shake off excess and brown on both sides. Add stock and paprika. Bring to boil and then reduce heat. Cook 10 min. Whisk together the lemon and brown sugar. Pour over chicken. Serve.

Heat oil and butter in a skillet. Add mushrooms and garlic and saute for about 3 minutes or until tender. Add kale and saute until wilted, about 1 minute. Add wine and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for about 5 minutes or until most of the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt and pepper.
Mix together salad and dressing. Chill before serving.

Cut tomatoes into thin slices. Cut cheese into thin slices. Brush chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic and fresh basil. Combine vinegar with black pepper and salt in a small bowl. Put in a large baking dish. Place cheese slices in dish. Place chicken on top of cheese slices. Place tomato slices in dish. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve with hot cooked rice.

In small bowl combine cilantro, garlic, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread cilantro mixture evenly over salmon fillet. Bake 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately with lemon wedges if desired.

In a small bowl, combine oj and lime juices. Add shrimp and cumin and mix well. In a skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add jalapenos and onions and saute until onions are translucent and jalapenos are soft. Add the shrimp mixture and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook another minute. Serve over rice.

Mix everything except soy sauce and water in large bowl. Make meatballs and add to mixture. Form into loaf pan. Dot with margarine. Bake 350f for 55 minutes. Add soy sauce and water. Stir and bake 30 minutes longer. Remove from oven. Add water if needed. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a loaf pan with coconut oil or butter. In a large bowl combine coconut flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. In a medium bowl combine coconut oil, honey, vanilla and eggs, beat until smooth. Stir into dry mixture with a wooden spoon just until combined. Fold in bananas and pecans. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare potatoesdrain well. Mash with cottage cheese until smoothset aside. Combine sweet potato, cottage cheese, sour cream, milk, sugar, and garlic powder in a saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer until thickened, stirring frequently. Remove from heatstir in green onions and cheddar cheese. Spoon potato mixture into a lightly greased 2-qt casserole dishtop with sweet potato mixture. Bake at 350 f for 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.
Fry onions in butter until soft. Add frankfurters and brown well. Add whole tomatoes and potatoes. Season well with salt and caraway seed to taste. Simmer until potatoes are tender.

Prepare sole as directed below. Melt butter in skillet. Add salt, pepper, dry white wine and cream of mushroom soup. Cook 1 minute. Add slivered almonds. Cook another minute, then pour over prepared fish. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Bake uncovered 12 minutes or until fish is done.
 chicken kievingredients: chicken breasts, salt, pepper, mashed potatoes, egg yolkspreparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Combine the mashed potatoes with egg yolks. Cut the chicken breasts lengthwise in half. Spread the mashed potato mixture inside each half of the breast, then roll up the breasts and secure them with toothpicks. Dip the chicken in the beaten egg whites. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish or pan and pour the broth over them. Bake 25 minutes, or until cooked through.

Pound steaks to 1/4 inch thickness. Combine flour with basil and 1/2 tsp pepper. Coat both sides of the steaks with the flour mixture. Heat oil in skillet. Brown steaks well. Stir in tomatoes, green pepper and 1/2 tsp pepper. Heat through. Serve over pasta.

Mix cottage cheese with sour cream, green onion and garlic clove. Salt to taste. Peel potatoes and cut into quarters lengthwise. Boil in a large quantity of water until tender. Drain and add sour cream mixture. Combine well with potatoes. Place in a buttered casserole. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven about 10 minutes. Uncovered.

Cook chicken fillets in a large pot of boiling water for 20 minutes, remove chicken and cool in cold water. Remove meat from bones, cut in bite size pieces. Combine cabbage, onion, green peppers, chicken bouillon, soy sauce, garlic powder, worcestershire sauce. Heat through on low heat. In a separate frying pan brown noodles in oil. When ready to serve, place meat and vegetable mixture on noodles. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.

Bring soy sauce and sherry to a boil. Add ginger and garlic and boil 3 minutes more. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Cut rump steak into 1-inch cubes. Add to sauce. Heat until warmed through. Slice asparagus diagonally into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat oil until it is very hot but not smoking. Add beef mixture and cook, stirring constantly 2 minutes or until the beef is done and the sauce is thickened. Toss beef mixture with asparagus and serve on warmed plates.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Rub chicken with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place in a shallow roasting pan. Combine sauce, sherry and oregano and pour over chicken. Bake for 1 hour or until no pink is visible. Sprinkle with fresh basil just before serving.

Slice each breast in half horizontally to form two thin pieces. Place a small slice of cream cheese on each piece of chicken. Top each with a slice of ham. Sprinkle lightly with garlic salt. Lay another slice of chicken on top. Press lightly to secure. Put on a baking sheet and bake at 350 for about 15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine the oats, sugar and flour in a bowl. Add the butter, canola oil and mix with fingers. Reserve 1/2 of the topping mixture. Spread the remaining topping mixture over the apple filling and sprinkle with the reserved topping mixture. Bake for 45 minutes. Serves 8.

Spray an 8 x 8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large saucepan, bring water and cornmeal to boil over medium heatreduce heat and cook at a simmer, stirring constantly until mixture is thick and creamy about 40 minutes. Stir in the cooked pumpkin and the sour creamadd the spices and season with pepper and a small amount of additional salt if needed. Sprinkle with the cheese and bake at 350 for about 25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and browning on the edges. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine rice and water in a saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Coolfluff rice with a fork. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chili sauce, shrimp, and almondssaute 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Remove shrimp mixture from skillet. Stir coconut milk and rice into skillet. Cook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with green onion.

Boil potatoes until fork tender. Drain and set aside to cool slightly. In mixing bowl add cream of celery soup, mayonnaise, white vinegar and black pepper. Mix until combined. Add celery ribs, green peppers, green onions, hard-boiled egg and cooled potatoes. Stir gently to combine. Chill overnight.
Mix all ingredients and bake at 350f. for 25 minutes.
Rub mixture of soy sauce, ginger, garlic and worcestershire sauce onto chicken. Heat oil in frying pan. Add chicken and saute until done. Serve over rice.
Mix first 3 ingredients. Heat oil over med-high heat in a grill pan. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add to pan. Cook 4 to 5 min per side. Drizzle with vinegar mixture. Cook 3 more min.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, bring chicken broth and light italian dressing just to a boil. Add chicken breasts and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Add carrots and continue cooking until chicken and carrots are tender and cooked through. Add stewed tomatoes and pasta and cook until pasta is tender and carrots are almost tender. Season with italian seasoning and garlic powder. Serve in bowls garnished with parmesan cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Trim the excess fat from the steak and cut into small pieces. In a heavy-based pot over medium heat fry the steak with the shallots and garlic for about 5 minutes. Add the fish sauce and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil and add the sugar and the black pepper. Lower heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add the spinach and the lemon juice. Season with salt and red pepper. Serve with rice.
