This dish will quickly become a family favorite!
A juicy chicken breast with a tangy sauce

Cook the chicken in water seasoned with salt and pepper. While the chicken is cooking, saute the onions and mushrooms in extra virgin olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the broccoli, the Rotel and the salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile the chicken is ready. Cube it up and add it to the saucepan along with the spaghetti. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir in the velveeta and heat until it is melted. Serve hot.
Peel and core pear and cut into pieces. Place in a blender. Add ice cubes, apple juice and milk. Blend until smooth. Makes 3 servings.
Cube the tofu. In a large bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients. Add the tofu and toss well. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a 13x9x2 inch pan with foil. Arrange the chicken in a single layer in the pan. In a small bowl combine the corn and beans. In a separate bowl combine the tomatoes, sour cream, and seasoning. Spoon 1/2 of the sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with 1/4 of the beans and corn. Add the remaining sauce. Sprinkle with the remaining beans and corn. Bake for 40 minutes. Uncover and bake 5-10 minutes longer or until the juices run clear. Serve warm with the tortillas.

Preheat the oven to 170C/fan 150C/gas mark 3. Butter 6 ramekins or custard cups and dust with 1 teaspoon of the caster sugar. Melt the dark chocolate with the butter and allow to cool slightly. Beat together the egg yolks and the rest of the caster sugar until light and fluffy then beat in the dark chocolate mixture. In a separate bowl beat the egg whites until stiff then fold into the chocolate mixture. Divide the mixture between the ramekins. Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until just set. Serve with creme fraiche or ice-cream.
Combine milk and yogurt in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add instant breakfast drink mix. Blend until well mixed. Add ice cube. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Prepare grill. In a small bowl, combine the mustard, oregano and chili flakes. Place the pork ribs on a rack set in a shallow baking pan. Spread with the mustard mixture. Bake in a 300 oven for 2 hours or until tender. Remove the pork from the oven and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the wine and potatoes. Cook until the potatoes are tender. Pour the cooked potatoes and liquid into a blender and process until smooth. Return the potatoes and liquid to the saucepan over low heat. Stir in the chili, roasted garlic and hot paprika. Brush the pork with the sauce and sprinkle with the sherry. Return the pork to the oven and bake for 10 minutes longer or until the sauce is bubbling.

Combine lentil and water in a large saucepan or stockpot over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until tender, about 20-30 minutes. Add carrot, orange juice concentrate, wasabi powder and gingerroot. Continue to cook for 1-2 more minutes. Mix in soymilk and rice vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate up to 1 day. To reheat, heat in microwave until hot

In heavy 3-quart pan combine first 6 ingredients. Cook over medium heat to 240f. Add butterscotch chips and marshmallow creme. Beat until chips are melted. Pour into buttered 8-inch square pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Cool. Cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Wash the beets. Wrap in foil. Bake until tender. (about 1 hour) Remove from oven and let cool. Peel when cool enough to handle. Cut into wedges. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Toss to combine. Add the beets. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In an iron skillet or 9x13 glass dish, combine dry ingredients. Add liquid and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Pour into skillet or dish and bake for 40 minutes or until done. Cut into 1 inch squares and serve. Makes 8-10 servings.

Spread each bread slice with honey mustard. Arrange tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and sprouts on 6 bread slices. Arrange the remaining bread slices over the top. Cut the sandwiches in half. Drizzle with lemon juice. Makes 6 sandwiches.
Place all ingredients in large bowl. Mix well. Serve with nacho chips. Serves 4.

Wash and drain the berries. Combine the berries and the brown sugar in a large saucepan and cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until the berries begin to break down and release their juices. Add the cinnamon and continue cooking over medium heat until the mixture is thickened. Remove from the heat and cool. Slice the lemons thinly and reserve both the juice and the slices. Place the reserved blueberry mixture in the prepared crust. Blend the lemon juice and cornstarch in a small bowl and add a few drops of the hot blueberry mixture to blend. Pour the mixture over the berries and spread evenly. Arrange the reserved lemon slices in a decorative pattern on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool before serving.

In a bowl, combine cream cheese and milk until smooth. Add egg and water and mix well. Add shrimp and Parmesan and mix lightly. Unroll dough and separate at perforations. Place 2 teaspoons cream cheese mixture at the wide end of each triangle. Gently fold the point of each triangle over cream cheese mixture to form a triangle with a point. Gently press ends together and pinch to seal. Place points down on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, and key lime juice. Beat well with mixer on medium speed until smooth. Stir in key lime zest. Pour into graham cracker pie shell. Chill at least 1 hour before topping with frozen whipped topping. Serve cold.

In a large pot of boiling water, add the salt and the jumbo shrimp and boil until they turn pink (about 2 minutes). Remove the pot from the heat and drain the shrimp, reserving 1 cup of the boiling liquid. In a large frying pan over high heat, add the olive oil and the hot chili peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the Spanish onion and the fennel bulb and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the tomatoes, the wine, the reserved boiling liquid and the salt and pepper to taste and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes. Serve the shrimp on top of the sauce. Serve with steamed rice.

In a small pot over medium heat bring the water to a boil. Add the lemon, sugar and salt. Turn heat to medium low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. Put the brine in a gallon size bag. Add the chicken breasts and put in a zip lock bag. Push out all the air and seal. Let brine over night or as long as 8 hours. Remove from brine. Grill or saute. Can also put the brined chicken in a crock pot with the brine. Cook 5 to 8 hours on low. I serve with a spicy cream sauce.
Mix together first 5 ingrediants. Put tenderloin in bag and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Skewer tenderloin and grill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in Dijon mustard and white wine vinegar. Add honeymix well. Pour over baconcook over low heat for 5 minutes or until bacon is crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Place baby spinach leaves on a large platedrizzle with olive oil, and toss to coat. Arrange spinach leaves in a circle on platetop with crouton. Arrange 2 eggs on top of spinachtop each with a strip of bacon. Drizzle Dijon-honey mixture over eggssprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Place the potato, carrot, and onion in a small bowl and fill with enough water to cover. Microwave for 10 minutes. Drain. Place the potato mixture and beef in a large bowl. Add the egg and mix until thoroughly combined. Stuff the mixture into the cabbage leaves and roll them up. Place them in a baking dish with the tomato sauce and bake for 1 hour. In a medium bowl combine the brown sugar and lemon juice and mix well. Pour the mixture over the cabbage rolls and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate. Spread on top of cooked vegetable salads. Spread on top of vegetable pizza.

In a large bowl combine cereal and powdered sugar. Set aside. In a large saucepan, melt chocolate over low heat until smooth and shiny. Stir in the peanut butter until combined well. Pour chocolate mixture over cereal mixture and stir until well-combined and slightly dry to the touch. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl stir together cake mix, eggs and water until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Spread in prepared dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Meanwhile combine powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of water. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over warm cake. Cool. Spread with cherry pie filling. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13-inch pan. In medium bowl combine cherry pie filling and 1 cup miniature marshmallows. Set aside. In large bowl combine white cake mix, 1 cup water, vegetable oil, 2 eggs and 1 teaspoon vanillamix well. Spoon half of cake batter into 9x13-inch pan. Top with cherry-marshmallow mixturespread evenly. Add remaining white cake batter over cherry mixturespread evenly. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 10 minutesremove from pan. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 325F. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Blend in egg yolks and almond extract. Sift together remaining dry ingredients and add to mixture until dough is formed. Refrigerate dough for 20 minutes. Roll into small balls and place 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until lightly browned. Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Combine confectioners’ sugar, half-and-half and almond extract and blend to form icing. Dip cooled cookies in icing and set aside to dry slightly before serving. Store tightly covered at room temperature.

In a medium saucepan combine the first five ingredients and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly and begins to bubble. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter and vanilla. Pour into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the nuts and refrigerate for several hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).In a large bowl, stir together the rice, carrots, green bell peppers, garlic and turmeric. Stir in water and vegetable broth until rice is tender and mixture is moistened. Spoon rice mixture into each acorn squash half. Top each half with 2 tablespoons sour cream and 1/4 cup chopped parsley. Place acorn squash halves in a baking dish and pour 1 cup water into bottom of pan. Bake in the preheated oven until tops of squash are tender and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.

Cream peanut butter, white sugar, egg, and baking soda until smooth. Add salt. Drop by spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Let cool on sheets for 1 minute. Transfer cookies to wire racks. Makes 1 dozen large or 2 dozen small cookies.
Brown ground beef in skillet with taco seasoning mix. Heat tortilla chips in microwave. Scoop some meat into bag. Add salsa and a few chips. Top with cheese. Serve immediately.

Sift all dry ingredients into large bowl. Mix well with hands. Add egg yolks. Beat well with electric mixer. Add apricot jam. Beat well with electric mixer. Add milk slowly while beating with electric mixer until well blended. Pour into well buttered 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350F for 45 minutes or until set but soft in center. Serve hot with cream or custard. Makes 4 servings.

Combine dry cake mix, water, vegetable oil, and eggs in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer and beat for 2 minutes at medium speed. Stir in mashed banana. Spread into greased and floured 10 inch tube pan or 12 cup bundt pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Prepare a sandwich as above for each person. For two people use 4 slices of bacon, 4 slices of cheese, 2 slices of onion. Cut each onion in half. Place onion slices on 1 slice each of cheese. Top each onion slice with 2 slices bacon. Place other slice cheese on top. Place other slice onion on top of that. Place another slice bacon on top. Top with other slice cheese. Place butter on outside of bread. Place on a cookie sheet in oven. Broil on low 5 min. Remove from oven. Top each slice with 1 teaspoon mayonnaise. Cut in half and serve.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, add water. Bring to a boil. Add spam and onion. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add rice. Cover and simmer until tender and all liquid has been absorbed. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer 5 minutes more. Stir well. Remove bay leaf. Serve over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake according to box directions. Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool. In the meantime prepare the sundae toppings. In a medium bowl, combine ice cream, bananas and pineapple topping. Spread over the cake. Add the cherries and the hot fudge. Refrigerate until serving.
name: cherry cheese cakeingredients: graham crackers, powdered sugar, butter, milk, cherries, sugar, cornstarch, butter, almond extract, eggs, sour cream, sugar, flourpreparation:Put crackers in food processor and process to crumbs. Mix powdered sugar, butter, milk and cornstarch in saucepan. Cook over low heat until mixture thickens. Stir in cherries. Cool. Beat eggs, sour cream and sugar until smooth. Combine flour and almond extract. Add to mixture. Pour into greased and floured 9 inch springform pan. Sp
Whisk together soy sauce, fresh lemon juice and mirin in a small bowl. Stir in cold water until well combined. Store refrigerated in an airtight container for 2 days. Makes 1 cup.

Bring water to a boil, add potatoes. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and place in a large mixing bowl. Mash the potatoes with the butter, onion, sour cream, eggs and cream until smooth. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the fresh herbs to taste. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Wow! This is a great list! I have been looking for some new ideas to try with my potatoes!
I always love lists like this. Thanks for posting this!
Oh my goodness. I wish I had saved the recipe for the mashed potato recipe from the box. It was the best. We couldn't find it anywhere...so I had to give up making them.
Thanks for this post! I love new ideas for making mashed potatoes. We eat them a lot around here because my son is allergic to dairy & eggs & they'

Preheat oven to 450. Spread cauliflower and broccoli in a single layer on a baking sheet. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons oil, kosher salt and the spices. Pour over vegetables. Toss to coat. Arrange in a single layer. Roast for 10 minutes. Sprinkle vegetables with 2 tablespoons Parmesan. Roast for 10 more minutes. Serve.

Using a sieve or a wire strainer, squeeze juice from limes into a medium bowl. Discard seeds and pulp. Slowly add 3 cups of cold water to the juice, stirring with a whisk until sugar is dissolved. Stir in 2 cups of sprite, honey to taste and salt to taste. Serve immediately over ice in tall glasses.

Mix together the milk and sugar in a pan over a medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick. Stir until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Bring the mixture to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer gently for 30 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and leave to cool for 10 minutes. Remove the cinnamon stick. Beat the egg yolks in a bowl. Add the cooled milk mixture and the vanilla. Strain into a jug. Cover the jug with cling film. Leave until it has cooled. Chill for 2 hours or overnight before serving.

Trim woody ends of asparagus spears. Heat oil in skillet over medium-low heat. Add shallots and garlic and cook 1 minute or until shallots are tender. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add asparagus. Reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes or until spears are crisp-tender. Sprinkle with lemon juice and sugar. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook rotini in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add flour and stir constantly until smooth. Cook for 1 minute. Add milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 1 minute. Add cheeses, 1 cup at a time and stir constantly until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in broccoli and cauliflower. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Sift together the flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Add the sugar and cardamom and mix well. Add the oil and mix well again. Knead the mixture into a smooth dough. Divide the dough into 2 parts and keep the remaining part covered with a wet cloth. Roll one part into small balls (diameter about 1cm or less). Roll each ball into a smooth shape between your palms and place it on the baking sheet. Repeat with the second part. Bake the cookies at 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for about 25-30 minutes or till they turn light brown. Cool on wire racks. Sprinkle the pistachios on the top and enjoy these crispy cardamom spiced cookies.

Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop coarsely. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and onion and cook until browned, stirring often. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Add the cream cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Stuff the mixture into the caps of the mushrooms. Sprinkle the caps with the bread crumb mixture and bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the caps are browned.
Fried mushrooms are always a favorite. The recipe is easy, just slice the mushrooms thinly and dip them in a batter made with flour and beer. I use Guinness beer. This recipe is always a hit with my family.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut the mushrooms in half. In a shallow bowl or plate mix the flour and beer together. Dip the mushrooms in the batter and place on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes.

Place all the sauce ingredients except for the chops into the slow cooker. Stir to combine well. Add the chops, cover the pot, and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours. Serve over rice.
I made the sweet and sour pork tonight it was wonderful!
I used boneless skinless chicken breasts instead of the pork chops for the Sweet and Sour Pork recipe. I also used 1/2 cup brown sugar instead of the white sugar. It was really good but I will cut back on the sugar next time I make it.
I made the Tomato Onion Pork Chop recipe tonight for supper. It was very good but next time I think I will cut back on the brown sugar since it was kind of sweet for my taste.
I made the tomato onion pork chop recipe for supper tonight and it was good but I think I will cut back on the brown sugar next time I make it since it was kind of sweet for my taste.
I made the sweet and sour pork recipe tonight. It was so good! My husband said it was

Prepare beef according to package directions. Heat oil in a large wok over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry 1 minute. Add hoisin and five-spice powder. Stir-fry until meat is no longer pink and liquid is almost evaporated. Add honey and stir until blended. Add soy and sherry and stir. Add garlic and stir-fry 15 seconds. Add cornflour mixture, stir until thickened. Serve over rice.
Flavorful and filling. Quick and easy to make. A great meal for when you have no time to cook.

Let dough rise for 30 minutes. Roll out the dough to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Spread pizza sauce over dough. Add mozzarella and parsley. Layer with pepperoni slices. Roll up the dough. Crimp the sides of the dough together. Bake for 30 minutes or until brown.

Cut pears into 1/2-inch dice. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add green onions and saute until softened. Add molasses, mustard, ginger and vinegar. Cook until thickened. Add chicken. Cook until no longer pink. Add pears. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a medium bowl combine the first four ingredients and set aside. In a small bowl combine the dry cracker crumbs with the soy sauce. Stir in the wine and set aside. Clean mushrooms and cut off stems. Fill the cavity with the cheese mixture. Dip mushrooms into the cracker crumb mixture and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes until cheese is bubbling. Serve hot with crackers or toothpicks.
I am an avid fan of all things fungi. I love to learn about fungi and mushroom recipes. I was wondering if there was any information on the edible varieties of fungi that are found in the South West US? I am looking for some edible mushroom recipes that are easy enough for me to make at home.
I'm looking for a list of the best edible mushrooms for cooking.
I am looking for an edible mushroom recipe that is easy to make. I have some mushrooms that I would like to cook with, but I don't

Roll out the sugar cookie dough and cut into 4-inch circles. Bake according to the directions on the package. Cool completely. Spread each circle with 1-1/2 teaspoons of cream cheese. Place 1-1/2 teaspoons of frozen limeade concentrate in the middle of each circle. Garnish with fresh fruit. Serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients. Shape into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Roll in chopped pecans and serve with crackers. Makes about 1 cup.

Saute onion and garlic powder in oil. Add caraway seed. Add ground beef. Brown ground beef. Add cabbage and water. Simmer 2 hours or until cabbage is tender. Add velveeta cheese. Heat until melted. Serve on your favorite roll with ketchup.

In a large bowl combine the crepes, bacon, swiss cheese& flour. Add the egg and milk. Beat well. Pour into a greased 8 inch square baking pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350. Cool slightly before cutting.

Combine cream-style corn and butterstir well. Combine prepared onion dip and eggsbeat well. Combine corn mixture and onion mixturestir well. Stir in celery salt and black pepper. Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes.

Bring 6 cups of water to a boil in a large pot. Add pasta and cook for 12 to 14 minutes. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter and 1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour together in a skillet over medium heat until the mixture begins to brown. Add the milk and saffron threads and stir until the mixture thickens. Remove from the heat and add the prawns and snow peas. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter and the remaining 1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour together in a skillet over medium-high heat until the mixture begins to brown. Add the prawn mixture and the cooked pasta. Toss to combine and serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Cut dough into 48 equal pieces. Place 8 pieces on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 3-4 minutes and flip. Remove from oven and brush with melted butter and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika. Bake for 3 more minutes and repeat with remaining pieces.

Melt chocolate with milk in a small saucepan over low heat until smooth. Stir in cream cheese until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate until set. Decorate top of pie with whipped topping and chocolate shavings if desired.

Slice the leeks thinly. Melt the butter in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the leeks, stirring continuously for 5 minutes. Add the sage. Add the beefsteak tomatoes. Cover and cook over a low heat for 10 minutes. Add the garlic and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook for a further 2 minutes. Serve.

Boil corn until tender (about 20 minutes). Combine with sugar and water and cook until thickened (about 2 more minutes). Season with salt and serve warm or let cool and freeze in ziplock bags. Serve with your favorite meat or vegetable dish.

Combine cream cheese and butter in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat until well blended. Add the flour and salt and mix until incorporated. Onto a floured surface roll the dough into a 12-inch by 8-inch rectangle. Spread with jam and roll up jelly roll style. Cut into 1-inch slices and arrange on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow the cookies to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans and cool completely on wire racks. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and lightly grease a baking sheet with olive oil. Grate the potatoes into a large bowl and add the flour and egg. Add the parsley and mix well. Shape the potato mixture into patties and place them on the baking sheet. Spray the top of each patty with olive oil and bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle the tops of the patties with parsley and then sprinkle on the salt and pepper. Flip the patties over and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve while warm.

Cut head of cauliflower into florets, then pulse in food processor until florets are chopped into 1/4" pieces. Toss florets in a large bowl with 2/3 cup of lime juice and 2/3 cup of vinegar (you can use rice vinegar or apple cider vinegar). Let stand at room temperature for about 2 hours (or overnight), stirring every 30 minutes or so. After 2 hours or so (or overnight), stir in garlic and red chili pepper flakes to taste and add salt to taste. Let sit at room temperature for another hour or so. Remove from bowl and place in colander to strain off liquid (you can reserve the liquid to use later in marinades or other recipes). Place florets in a serving bowl. Toss with remaining lime juice to taste. Top with cilantro leaves and serve immediately.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir honey and seasonings into hot oil until honey dissolves and mixture is bubbling. Stir in almonds and coconut until coated and fragrant. Remove from heat and stir in salt until well coated. Spread on waxed paper to cool completely. Break into pieces and store in an airtight container.
Brew chamomile by steeping it in boiling water for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Add carrots and oranges, blending thoroughly. Add ice cube for chill and serve.

Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Beat in cocoa and milk until well combined. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon filling into crust. Top with whipped topping. Refrigerate until set.
Cut cucumber into thin noodles. Combine remaining ingredients. Add cucumber noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Garnish with scallions and peanuts.

Prepare a baking dish with 1 T butter. Fry the tomatoes in the rest of the butter. When they are done, add the bacon, stirring until it is brown. Pour the tomatoes and bacon into the baking dish. Sprinkle with the flour, salt and pepper and mix well. Pour the milk over the top. Pour the egg over the top and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Serve with cheddar cheese sprinkled over the top.

Melt 1/2 stick unsalted butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the onion, carrot and fresh broccoli florets. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer to a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped. Transfer back to the saucepan. Melt the remaining 1/2 stick unsalted butter. Stir in the all-purpose flour. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Gradually add the low sodium chicken broth. Bring to a simmer. Add the heavy cream. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Season with additional salt and freshly ground black pepper if needed. Serve with a sprinkling of freshly grated Parmesan cheese.

Heat broth in a pot. Using a spoon, make a swirl pattern in broth. Break one egg into the swirl pattern. Do the same for the remaining eggs. Let soup simmer until eggs are cooked. Season to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray an 8-inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Whisk cocoa powder with baking soda and salt in a medium bowlset aside. Combine coffee with corn syrup in a 2-cup glass measuring cup or small bowlset aside. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine applesauce with buttercook until smooth, 3 minutes. Remove from heatcool 5 minutesthen stir in coffee mixture until smooth. In a medium bowl, combine yogurt, eggs, and vanillawhisk until smooth. Stir in applesauce mixturepour into prepared baking pan. Sprinkle cocoa mixture over battersmooth with a spatula or spoon. Bake 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of brownies comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack.

Mix together all the dry ingredients and set aside. In a small bowl combine the water and the ranch dressing. Dip the chicken in the water mixture then roll in the dry mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or till done. Drain on a paper towel and serve with the sauce.
Spread one slice with dijon mustard. Layer with dill pickles and swiss cheese. Top with other slice, spread with butter to melt the cheese.

In large skillet over medium heat cook the seeds and stir constantly until they begin to pop. Then add the butter and oil. Continue to stir until all the seeds are a light golden color. Sprinkle with salt and serve warm or cool.

In a medium saucepan cook orzo according to package directions. Drain the pasta. In a large saucepan melt the butter. Add the garlic, cook for about 1 minute. Whisk in the milk. Add the parmesan cheese. Bring to a simmer. Add the drained orzo. Stir until the cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper. Add the fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat oil until it just starts to smoke. Add sausage to skillet and cook until no longer pink. Remove sausage from pan, reserving drippings. Add garlic to drippings in pan. Stir until garlic turns golden. Add tomatoes. Stir to combine. Add parsley. Season with thyme, salt & pepper. Add hot water. Cover skillet. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer 10-15 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 160c. Lightly oil a baking dish. Cut capsicums into halves and remove seeds. In a bowl mix ricotta with lemon rind, basil, and a little salt and pepper. Divide the mixture between the capsicums and place into the baking dish. Cook for about 20 minutes or until capsicums are tender. In a bowl toss the tomatoes with the oil and salt and pepper. Place over capsicums and cook for a further 20 minutes. Garnish with the onion.

Wash roast. Pat dry. Rub with seasoning salt. Sprinkle with liquid smoke. Place in crockpot. Add onion. Pour in water. Cook on low 6-7 hours. Remove roast. Shred. Add barbecue sauce. Return to crockpot. Heat through. Serve with rice.

Boil potatoes until done then drain. Cut into small pieces and set aside in a bowl. Peel the zucchini and dice into small pieces. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over moderate heat. Add garlic and onion and cook until the onions are soft. Add the zucchini and continue cooking for a few minutes until the zucchini is soft. Add the potatoes, half the water and the soft cheese. Cook until the mixture is heated through. Season to taste. Serve at once garnished with fresh herbs.

Heat the oven to 200C. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Cut the capsicums in half lengthways. Remove the seeds and place capsicums cut side down on the baking tray. Bake for 20 minutes or until capsicums are soft and cooked through. Combine the red capsicum, yellow capsicum and goat cheese in a bowl and mix well. Set aside. Cook the pasta in a saucepan of boiling water according to packet directions. Drain. Add the pasta and the remaining ingredients to the capsicum mixture and stir to combine. Serve at once.

Place sour cherries in bottom of baking dish. Sprinkle with sugar. Cut butter into tablespoon-sized pieces. Distribute over sour cherries. Mix flour and spices. Crumble over butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Sauté onions and green peppers in butter until lightly browned. Add in the eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Add the breadcrumbs and grated cheese on top of the egg mixture and place in the pre-heated oven for approximately 20 minutes or until the top is browned. Serve hot.

Wash and drain berries. Toss berries with sugar. Spread on a baking dish or cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees until just tender. Cool slightly. Spoon berries into dessert dishes. Top with whipped topping and lemon yogurt. Garnish with lemon peel.

combine bisquick mix with water to form dough. roll out thinly. cut out with a biscuit cutter. fry in oil until golden brown. put in a baking dish and pour over dressing. sprinkle with breadcrumbs. bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes
Beat egg whites at medium speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Add cornstarch and beat until combined. Add lemon juice and beat until thick.

Preheat oven to 325f. Cream coffee and sugar in small bowl. Beat eggs and vanilla in large bowl until foamy. Beat in the coffee mixture and then mix in the dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Spread in a buttered 9x13-inch pan. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown and center is set. Cool in pan. Cut into squares.

Cook and drain the pasta. In a bowl combine the pasta and the three bean mix. Mix the miracle whip in the eggs and add to the pasta mixture. Add the pickle relish. Add the sea salt and black pepper to taste. Let stand at room temperature for 3 hours to blend flavors.

Pour the vodka and the lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with crushed ice. Top with the cointreau liqueur and cranberry juice. Garnish with the lime zest and serve.

Wash and peel the turnips and parsnips and cut into 1 1/2 - 2 inch pieces. Steam or boil until soft, about 15 minutes. Drain well. Mash with a potato masher or in an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in margarine, soymilk, mayonnaise and spices until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving. Serves 8.
name: root veggie mash
ingredients: rutabaga, parsnip, carrot, turnip, salt, butter
preparation:Peel and slice all veggies to similar sizes. They will become tender at the same time this way. Add to a pot of salted water, just enough water to cover. Bring to boil, turn down the heat and simmer until tender. Drain off water. Leave in pot. Add butter and mash. Add more salt if desired. Serve immediately.
name: irish carrot parsnip mash
ingredients: carrots, sugar, parsnips, butter, salt, pepper,

Slice garlic into thin rounds and place on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Broil until golden and charred. Slice leeks into thin rounds and saute with garlic in butter until soft and translucent. Add potatoes and stir until coated with butter. Add broth and simmer until soft and tender. Puree in batches using immersion blender. Add tomato paste and spices and cook for another 10 minutes or until thick and rich. Serve with crusty bread and creme fraiche.

Cut cucumbers and onions into 1/4" slices. In a small saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic powder and chile. Stir until fragrant. Stir in vinegar and sugar. Remove from heat. Add cucumbers. Toss to coat. Cool. Salt to taste. Chill. Serve with meats.
name: sweet cucumber and mandarin orange saladingredients: cucumber, mandarin oranges, sweet onion, granulated sugar, white vinegar, fresh tarragon, salt & pepperpreparation:In a serving bowl, combine the cucumbers, oranges, and onion rings. In a small bowl, stir together the sugar and vinegar until the sugar dissolves. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber salad. Toss well. Add chopped tarragon. Season with salt and pepper. Chill 1 hour before serving.
name: oriental marinated cucumber saladingredients: white vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, ground ginger, english

Combine water, yeast, sugar and oil in a large bowllet stand until mixture rises to top of bowl. Combine salt, flour and remaining water in a large measuring cuppour into yeast mixture. Stir well until dough comes together in a ball. Knead dough in bowl for 10 minutesturn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Place dough in a large greased bowlturn to coat dough with grease. Cover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Punch down doughdivide dough into 24 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ballplace in a greased 9 inch square baking dishlet rise in warm place for 1 hour or until dough is 1 inch above edges of pan. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Bake rolls for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from ovenimmediately brush tops with melted butter

Place white chocolate in medium bowlmicrowave 1 minute on high power until melted, stirring frequently. Stir in cranberries and almonds. Spread into a shallow 13x9-inch pan. Sprinkle with pretzel sticks. Refrigerate until set. Cut into pieces. Store in tightly covered container.

In large saucepan over medium heat stir together the sugar and salt. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the evaporated milk and butter. Add the chocolate and stir until melted and smooth. Add the chocolate baking squares and the marshmallow creme and stir until blended. Remove saucepan from heat. Add the vanilla and stir until blended. Spoon the mixture into a lightly greased 15x10x1 inch pan. Let cool slightly, then sprinkle with the pecans. Cool completely and cut into squares to serve. Store in an air tight container for up to 5 days.

Place water and salt in large saucepan. Add green beans. Bring to boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally. Mince garlic clove, and finely chop onion. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally for 5 minutes or until thickened. Add garlic clove and onioncook and stir for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir tomato mixture into cooked beans. Toss until blended. Transfer to serving dishtop evenly with almonds.
Whisk all ingredients together. Serve with your favorite stir fry.

Cook bacon and sausage links until crisp. Remove from pan. Drain off any grease. Add hash browns to pan and sprinkle with onion powder. Cook until browned and crispy. Add eggs and water and continue to cook until firm but not dry. Spoon onto plate and top with bacon and sausage links and gravy. Sprinkle with cheese and serve on bagel.

Peel 3 large baking potatoescut into 1/2-inch wedges. Mix flour, salt and pepper together in a shallow bowl. Mix egg and beer together in a cupplace near flour mixture. Dip each potato wedge in egg mixturethen in flour mixture. Place wedges in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until tender when pierced with a fork. Serve hot with ketchup or any other dipping sauce.

Place kumara in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender when pierced with knife. Drain in colander. Mix oil, pineapple juice, lemon juice, salt, onion salt in small bowl. Toss kumara with mixture in large serving bowl. Add pineapple, celery, and almonds. Chill 8 hours or overnight before serving.

Spread bread slices with peanut butter and jelly. In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of butter. When the butter has melted, add 1 sandwich at a time, cooking for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer the sandwiches to a plate lined with paper towels. Repeat process until all the sandwiches are cooked. Serve warm with a cup of milk for breakfast or as a snack.

Fry a couple of tortillas in butter until golden brown. Spread with a little chili powder. Add a few tablespoons of Mexican blend cheese. Top with baby spinach. Fold over and brown the other side. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.

In a medium bowl, combine the apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and butter. Divide apples in half. On one half of the apple, place the pecans on one side. On the other half of the apple, place the pecans on the other side. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

Slice cucumbers. Put in salt brine overnight (10 percent salt to 90 percent water). Drain and rinse. Pack in jars. Add to each jar 1/2 tsp each mustard seed, celery seed, and ground turmeric. Add 1/2 tsp peppercorns. Add 1/4 tsp ginger, 1/4 tsp ginger root, 1/4 tsp onion powder. Pour in 1 cup vinegar per jar. Cap jars and let stand 6 weeks before eating.

Cream together butter and sugars. Beat in eggs. Combine dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture. Stir in vanilla. Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes. Cool. Melt butterscotch chips in microwave for 30 seconds. Drizzle over cooled cookies. Cool before serving.

Pre heat oven to 350f. Grease 8x8x1-inch pan. In medium bowl beat sugar, egg yolks, oil, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in dry ingredients. Beat egg whites in another bowl until stiff. Fold into batter. Spread into prepared pan. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool in pan. Cut into squares.

Steam spinach and drain. In a small bowl combine chicken stock, soy sauce, and sugar. Set aside. Juice and zest oranges and set aside. In a small frying pan, combine oranges and stock mixture and bring to a boil. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Serve hot or chilled. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and orange slices.
1. Pour espresso into coffee cup. 2. Add half & half. 3. Add 1/2 oz Bailey's Irish Cream. 4. Add 1/2 oz eggnog. 5. Garnish with cinnamon stick and grated nutmeg.

In large bowl, stir together the cornstarch and 1/2 cup water. Stir in the pineapple. Cook over low heat until thick and clear. Cool. In large mixing bowl combine the cream cheese, butter and 2 cups powdered sugar. Beat until creamy. Gradually add the milk and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add 1 can of the cool whip and beat until well blended. Pour into serving dish. Spread the pretzel stick over the top of the cream cheese mixture. Spread the remaining cool whip on top of the pretzel sticks. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine skim milk and chocolate flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix in medium bowl. Beat until well blended. Spoon into 4-cup glass bowl or deep 8-inch pie plate sprayed with cooking spray. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Top with whipped topping and fruit. Garnish with chocolate shavings and a raspberry if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place chicken in a large, shallow baking pan. In a small bowl combine the herbs and 2 tablespoons of the water. Brush the chicken with the oil and sprinkle with the herb mixture. Bake for 40 minutes, or until the juices run clear when the leg is pierced with a knife. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Clean mushrooms and remove and discard stems. Arrange gill side up in a shallow baking pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Crack eggs into centers of mushrooms. Place rosemary and basil over eggs. Bake for 8-10 minutes, until eggs are set. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in pan and brown flour for 1 minute. Gradually add chicken broth to flour mixture. Cook until thick and bubbly. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in pan drippings from turkey and reheat. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl stir together the cream cheese and cheddar cheese until blended. Fold in the bacon and the green onions. Spread the mixture evenly into a 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serves 4.

Butter a flat pan or cast iron skillet over medium heat. Splenda, butter and cream together until the splenda has dissolved completely. Add the egg and whisk until blended. Sift together the coconut flour, baking powder and salt, add to the mixture, and continue whisking until completely mixed. Drop by spoonfuls onto the hot pan and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until the pancake is golden brown and crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Serve immediately with your favorite topping.

Combine water, sugar and lime juice in a pitcher or large bowl. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Chill for 30 minutes or more before serving. Just before serving, stir in fresh orange juice and serve in a glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with lime slices or wedges of fresh oranges.

Preheat oven to 180C/350F. In medium bowl, beat together yolks and 1/2 cup water until smooth. In heavy 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add flour and mustard, stirring until mixture bubbles and forms smooth paste. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth. Add yolk mixture and stir until smooth. Add cheeses, stirring until cheeses melt. Add remaining 1/2 cup water and ham. Mix well. Line 9-inch pie plate with pastrypour filling into pastry-lined plate. Bake until pastry is golden brown, about 30 minutes. Cool on rack 5 minutes. Garnish with hard-boiled eggs.
The ham and cheese sandwich is an easy-to-make sandwich made from white bread, cheese, ham, mayonnaise, and two slices of bread.
The cheese and mayonnaise are first spread on the two slices of bread. Then the cheese is placed on

Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the butter, sugar, corn syrup, vanilla, salt and baking soda. Once the butter is melted, whisk constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Once the mixture boils, cook it for 4-5 minutes until it reaches a dark amber color. Turn the heat off and add the pecans. Stir quickly until all the nuts are covered in the hot mixture. Immediately pour the mixture onto the lined baking sheet. Using a rubber spatula, spread the mixture out into an even layer. Sprinkle the top with more sea salt and let the brittle cool for at least 1 hour or until completely hardened. Break the brittle into pieces with your hands or a knife. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

Cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Add green pepper and onion. Drain bacon. In a large bowl combine potatoes, pepper and onion, eggs, cheese, salt and pepper. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Place bacon on broiler rack and cook about 6 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven and set aside to cool. Slice bread in half. Spread butter over cut side and sprinkle with chutney. Top with bacon and brie and cover cut side with top half of bread. Press down until sandwich is well pressed together. Cut in half and serve immediately.
Cut off the base of the endives. Remove leaves from the center. Slice the base into 1/4-inch rings. Fill each endive ring with 1/2 tsp of the salmon mixture. Serve immediately.

Place apple in microwave-safe bowl. Add enough water to cover apple halfway up. Microwave on high until apple is very soft, about 6 minutes. Remove apple from water and discard water. Mash apple with fork or potato masher until smooth. Add sugar and cinnamon to mashed apple. Microwave on high until hot (about 30 seconds) stirring after 10 seconds. Cool slightly. Serve warm.
Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until fork-tender. Cool slightly. Mash potatoes and add remaining ingredients. Beat just until smooth. Adjust seasonings to taste. Makes 8 servings.

Combine all ingredients except the brandy in a food processor. Pulse until well blended and smooth. Drizzle in the brandy and pulse until the mixture is smooth again. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with your favorite breadsticks or crackers or drizzle over potato chips or popcorn.
I'm not sure I've ever tasted blue cheese that I liked, but I have loved the blue cheese dressing I've had before. I wonder if this could be used as a dip for veggies?
This looks good! I like to cook with blue cheese!
I can just smell it now! I'm going to have to try that recipe!
I've never been crazy about blue cheese either. I would like to try this recipe though!
I'm going to try this! Thanks for posting the recipe!
This sounds really good! I'm definitely going to try this recipe!

In a small bowl combine lemon zest and poppy seed. In another bowl cream together margarine, sugars and yogurt. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into wet ingredients. Stir in poppy seed mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes at 375f. Cool completely.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes, the seasoning and the parsley. Cook over low heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the pepper flakes. Serve over hot pasta. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

In a Dutch oven, fry the meat with the vegetables. Season with the pepper and salt. Dissolve the tomato puree in a cup of hot water. Add to the meat. Simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve hot on cornbread.
Mix all of the ingredients together in a bowl. Season to taste.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute broccoli florets in unsalted butter until tender and lightly browned. Add minced garlic, and cook until fragrant and lightly browned. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add ziti pasta and cook for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. Add chicken tenderloins and cook until heated through. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil to serve.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Cut in shortening and mix well. Add garbanzo bean mixture and mix well. Add liquid. Mix well. Drop by the tablespoon onto a lightly greased baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15-18 minutes. Makes 32 biscuits.

Drain the artichoke hearts. Pat them dry with paper towels and place in a food processor with the egg. Puree until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the breadcrumbs. Add the butter and garlic and blend until well combined. Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Working in small batches, shape the mixture into balls and flatten them slightly in the pan. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until the balls are golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes about 35 2-inch balls.

Brown ground beef in skillet. Add onion and garlic. Cook until beef is no longer pink. Add tomato puree and stir until hot. Add the chili powder and the salt and stir to combine. Add the water. Add the beans and the cumin. Cover and simmer for about 40 minutes. Serve in bowls and top with shredded cheese.

Combine dry ingredients in large bowl. Add eggs, oil and vanilla. Stir in blanched almonds. Turn into 9x5x3 inch loaf pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 1 hour 10 minutes or until done. Cool 10 minutes. Loosen bread from edges of pan. Turn bread out onto wire rack. Cool completely.
 candied almondsingredients: water, sugar, cinnamon, almondspreparation:Bring water, sugar and cinnamon to a boil. Stirring constantly. Add almonds and toss to coat. Remove almonds with slotted spoon. Arrange on greased baking pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, basting twice with reserved syrup. Cool. Store airtight.
Mix all the seasonings in a small bowl and rub onto steaks. Place in a ziploc bag and refrigerate overnight. Grill over hot coals for about 4 minutes per side for medium rare.

In a large heavy-bottomed pot, saute the onions and the butter over medium heat. When the onions are tender and translucent, pour in the stock and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 1 hour. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with croutons.
I've always used my mom's recipe. The only difference I make is I use 1/2 tsp. salt instead of a tsp.
This is a great recipe. I use the canned croutons from the store. They work just fine.
This recipe is easy to make. I'm always looking for new recipes for the crockpot.
I was surprised how good this turned out!
I was very impressed with this recipe. It was easy to make. I would definitely make it again.
This was a great recipe. I didn't have to make it too many times.
I'm not sure this recipe is easy enough for a beginner.
I don't think this recipe was very good.
This recipe was great! I had to make it twice because my

Crumble a handful of doritos in the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish. Layer half of the chicken on top of the crumbs. Then add half of the barbecue sauce and sprinkle half of the cheeses on top of the sauce. Repeat the layers. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until the cheeses are melted and the chicken is hot. Serve with additional barbecue sauce if desired.

Cook penne in boiling water for 8-10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for 30-35 minutes until thick. Add the chili powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the cream and bring to a boil. Add the vodka and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the romano and toss. Add the cilantro and toss again. Add the cooked penne and toss to combine. Serves 4-6.
Mix all ingredients. Put in greased pan and bake in 350 oven for 1 hour.
Place chicken and broth in a slow cooker. Add garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8 hours. Shred chicken with a fork. Stir in pesto. Serve over pasta.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Split pitas in half. Fill with chicken, tomato, lettuce, avocado slices, monterey jack cheese, and lemon juice. Sprinkle with garlic powder and hot sauce. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with extra hot pepper sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400. In a bowl mix together habanero sauce, tabasco, ground red pepper, white vinegar and brown sugar. In a large bowl place your chicken wings and sprinkle garlic powder over top. Add habanero sauce mix and toss to coat well. Arrange in a single layer in a large roasting pan. Bake for about 45 minutes or until cooked through. Cut wings into sections and arrange in a serving dish. Pour over remaining habanero mix. Garnish with blue cheese salad dressing and iceberg lettuce.

Preheat the oven to 170C/325F/Gas 3. Lightly grease 6 muffin moulds or 4 small tins. Beat the ricotta and sugar together in a bowl until smooth. Stir in the honey and the beaten eggs. Add the cinnamon and lemon juice. Spoon into the moulds or tins. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes until golden. Leave to cool slightly and then remove the cakes from the moulds or tins and transfer onto a wire rack. Chill in the fridge for at least 1 hour. To serve, drizzle with honey.

Squeeze the juice from the lemon half into the bowl. Add the zest and the juice from the other half. Add the greens. Stir gently to combine. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the wine. Bring to a boil. Add the chilies and simmer until the shrimp are opaque throughout, about 2 minutes. Add the tamari and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the greens to serving plates. Spoon the shrimp over the greens. Drizzle the sauce over all. Garnish with the remaining lemon half. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375F. Combine the chicken wings, hot sauce, honey, wine and seasonings in a large bowlmix well. Bake the wings in a single layer in a shallow baking dish for 40 minutes or until browned. Yield 4 servings (21/2 pounds).

Preheat oven to 350F. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add buttermilk all at once and stir until smooth. Stir in egg. Beat well. Pour batter into greased and floured 8x8 inch pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Cut into squares and serve warm with butter.

In a medium size skillet brown beef and drain fat. In a 9 x 13 casserole dish place half of the tortilla chips on the bottom. Layer with 1/3 of the beef mixture and half the cheese. Top with 1/2 of the salsa and half of the sour cream. Repeat layers once. Top with remaining sour cream and sprinkle with olives and onions. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until heated through. Serve with the remaining tortilla chips and salsa.

Boil eggs for 8 minutes and cool completely in ice water. Peel and chop the vegetables. In a large saucepan bring the water and sugar to a rolling boil. Stir in the spices and vegetables. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the eggs and simmer for an additional 30 minutes. Pack the hot mixture in a sterilized jar and seal tightly. Let cool completely and refrigerate overnight before serving. This keeps for several days in the fridge.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Brown pork chops on both sides in oil. Combine stuffing mix and apple pie filling. Stuff the pork chops and bake for 1 hour.

Combine popcorn, dried fruit and nuts in a large bowl and set aside. Put dark and white chocolates in separate microwave safe bowls and heat for about one minute at a time. Stir until smooth. Pour white and dark chocolates over the popcorn mixture and stir until evenly coated. Refrigerate for an hour to set. Store in an airtight container.
This is a great recipe to use up left over Halloween candy.
A great cereal for those who need a low calorie meal replacement.

In a small bowl or jar, combine all of the ingredients, except the lemon juice. Cover and shake vigorously until the mixture is thoroughly combined. Let the salad dressing stand for 5 minutes to blend the flavors. Add the lemon juice. Shake again.
Cook on the stove top for 30-40 minutes. Let cool. Stir in powdered sugar and almond extract. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a bowl combine the raisins, the ground flax seeds, the rolled oats, the almond butter, the ground cinnamon, the salt, the water and the maple syrup. Mix the batter until it is combined. Drop spoonfuls of the dough on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes. The cookies will be lightly browned. Remove from the oven. The cookies will be sticky. Allow to cool for about an hour. When cooled, the cookies will be crunchy. You may want to add more water if the dough is too dry.

Beat together butter, brown sugar, peanut butter, egg, powdered sweetener, flour, protein powder, soda, salt & baking powder. Roll into 1" balls & flatten with fork. Bake 5-7 minutes on ungreased cookie sheet at 350 degrees.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook green beans 2 minutes. Drain. In a small bowl, combine tomatoes, garlic and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. In another bowl combine cheese and basil. In a small saucepan combine vinegar and 2 tablespoons water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Drizzle over green beans. Toss to coat. Serve warm or at room temperature. To serve, spoon onto salad plates. Divide tomato mixture evenly among 6 plates. Top with 1/3 cup cheese mixture. Makes 6 servings, 1 cup each.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown hot dogs in oil. Sprinkle with onion, garlic salt and pepper. Stir in potatoes and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese just before serving.

Cut 4 jalapenos open lengthwise and remove seeds and ribs. In a small bowl combine cream cheese and avocado. Add 1/4 cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Mix well. Stuff each jalapeno with the mixture. Combine chopped bell pepper and 1/2 tsp. of the garlic powder. Place each stuffed jalapeno on a large baking tray. Top each with the bell pepper mixture. Bake 20 minutes. Mix 1/2 cup of the yellow onion and the remaining 2 tsp. of the garlic powder. Brush the onion mixture over the top of each jalapeno. Broil 3 minutes or until onion is golden brown. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 2 inches of water to a boil in a large stockpot. Add the broccoli and boil for about 5 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the remaining ingredients except for dressing. Add the broccoli, tossing gently until combined. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. Stir just before serving.
Boil sweet potatoes peel. Cool mash. Add remaining ingredients mix well. Make into balls. Roll in crumbs or nuts. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 400°. Cook penne as directed on package. Drain pasta. Add ricotta cheese and stir. Add lemon juice and butter. Toss well. Add olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add basil and toss again. Spread out evenly onto baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes.
name: mike s penne a la vodkaingredients: heavy cream, garlic, crushed red pepper flakes, vodka, diced tomatoes, parmesan cheese, pennepreparation:Add ingredients in order listed to medium saucepan over medium heat. Gradually increase heat as needed, and stir constantly. Once sauce is warm, add parmesan. Cook penne according to package directions. Continue stirring until hot. Pour over warm penne. Add more parmesan if wanted.
name: ricotta and tomato fettuccineingredients: fettuccine, butter, ricotta cheese, asiago cheese, garlic powder, tomatoes, fresh basil leaves

Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan or wok over a medium heat. Add the onion and sauté for 5 minutes until softened. Add the chorizo sausage and fry for 3 minutes until browned. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook over a low heat for 5 minutes. Add the tomato puree, chili flakes and season well. Add the green chili peppers and stir well. Add the cooked pasta and mix well. Transfer the mixture into a large ovenproof dish. Top with the grated Parmesan. Bake for 15–20 minutes until the top is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a blender or food processor puree all the sauce ingredients. Melt butter with oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the sauce to the hot pan. Stirring constantly, allow the sauce to simmer about 10 minutes. Add more butter or olive oil if you would like a richer sauce. Add the scallops. Saute until they are cooked. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve with the lemon wedges.

Cook rice according to directions. In saute pan over medium heat, saute red onion and scallions in oil until tender. Add cumin and garlic and cook about 30 seconds. Add rotel. Cook about 2 minutes. Add rice. Add water and black beans. Stir and let simmer about 5 minutes. Stuff poblano peppers with rice mixture. Cover with cheese and bake at 375 for about 20 minutes. Serve hot.
Name: 15 Minute Chili
Ingredients: Ground turkey, onion, pinto beans, kidney beans, stewed tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, salsa
Preparation: In a large pot, brown meat with chopped onion. Drain grease, if necessary. Add beans, tomatoes, garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt and salsa to meat mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve with cornbread, cooked pasta, cooked rice, or on top of a baked potato. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.
Name:

Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker. Add the red peppers and teriyaki. Stir. Add the rice wine vinegar and crushed red pepper flakes. Add the garlic and green onions. Add the creamy peanut butter and stir. Pour in the water and stir again. Add the roasted peanuts and limes. Cook on high for 4 hours. When the meat is done, add the lime juice and stir. Serve over rice and top with the green onions.

In a small saucepan heat oil, sugar, and vinegar. Add the onions, stirring frequently until onions are translucent. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook for 3 minutes stirring constantly. Pour into a jar or plastic container. Let cool. Cover and refrigerate. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

Cut off top half of each artichoke. Peel away leaves with a small paring knife, leaving only the base. Cut in half lengthwise. Cut base into wedges. Heat olive oil in small saucepan. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add dill, parsley, and basil. Remove from heat. Add lemon juice and mix well. Add artichokes and capiscum. Marinate 3 hours. Drain. Serve at room temperature.
Heat oil in large skillet. Season steak with salt and pepper. Sear steak in skillet for 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Slice steak and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease 2 - 8 inch round pans with 1 teaspoon of butter. Whisk together dry ingredients in a medium bowl. Beat together sugar and eggs in a large bowl until thick. Add extract. Gradually add dry ingredients. Beat on low speed until well mixed. Pour into pans. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 2-inch squares. Makes 10-12 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl combine hazelnuts, butter and hot pepper flakes. Using a mortar and pestle pound nuts until they are almost liquefied. Taste and add more pepper flakes if needed. Using a pastry brush or your fingers rub the mixture all over the lamb racks and sprinkle with coarse salt. Roast in preheated oven until desired degree of doneness.

Heat butter in large soup pot over medium heat. Cook turnips until browned on all sides. Add water or chicken broth. Cook until tender. Stir in long-grain rice and cook for 5 minutes or until rice is soft. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Stir in fresh parsley and parmesan cheese. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 1/2 cup of water to boiling and add frozen corn. Cook for a minute or two until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan and add the bread crumbs and cook for a minute or two over medium heat until crumbs are browned. Cream the remaining water and the cream cheese together and add the cooked bread crumbs and cook for a minute or two until combined. Add the corn and cook until combined. Spread evenly in a small baking dish and top with the remaining bread crumbs. Bake in a 350 degree oven until browned on top.
What are the nutritional facts on a serving of this recipe?
The nutrition facts are listed in each recipe card under the "Nutrition" tab on the right side of the card.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix all dry ingredients together. Add egg substitute. Stir in zucchini and oil. Fold in applesauce. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Drizzle with lemon glaze.

Poke holes in potatoes with the tip of a sharp knife. Bake at 425 f for 1 hour or until the potatoes are soft to the touch. Cool for 10 minutes. Add the sour cream, cream cheese, and 1 tsp of the butter to the potatoes. Beat for 2-3 minutes on medium speed until smooth. Add the onion flakes and beat again for 1-2 minutes more. Season to taste with salt and paprika. Spread the mixture in an 8 x 8 glass dish or casserole dish. Cover tightly with foil and refrigerate for 24 hours. Uncover the potatoes at least 30 minutes before baking. Preheat oven to 350 f. In a separate bowl combine the remaining 1 TB butter, the flour, and the parmesan cheese. Melt the butter mixture over low heat in a saucepan. Add the sour cream and whisk to combine. Add the Parmesan cheese and whisk until the mixture is smooth. Spoon the mixture over the top of

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c). Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Toss the potatoes with the oil, italian seasoning, black pepper and tabasco sauce in a large bowl. Spread the potatoes in a single layer over the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, or until tender. Serve hot.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Taste and add more oil or mustard to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate to marinade for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Dice shallots and jalapeno. Mix with cilantro. In separate bowl combine crabmeat, shallots, and jalapeno. In bowl combine egg, mayonnaise, mustard and Old Bay. Gently fold into crab mixture. Form into patties. Scoop out white bread and combine with remaining bread. Sprinkle crumbs on plate. Dip each cake into crumbs and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 170C/325F/Gas 3. Slice the tomatoes in half, scoop out the seeds and place in a baking dish. Add the peppers to the same dish. Drizzle with olive oil and season well. Cook for 30 minutes until the tomatoes are soft. Remove from the oven. Stir in the pine nuts and half the basil. Pile the rocket on to each plate. Spoon over the tomatoes and sprinkle the rocket with the remaining basil. Crumble the goats' cheese over the top of each salad. Drizzle with the remaining olive oil. Serves 2.

Pour the water into a medium sized pan and bring to boil. Add the sugar and soy sauce. Simmer for about 10 minutes, until the mixture is reduced and thickened. Add the bay leaf and the steaks. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Turn the steaks and simmer for another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the salt and the pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Drain well, then pat dry with paper towels. In a large bowl, combine potatoes, olive oil and salttoss to coat evenly. Place in a single layer on 2 baking sheets and bake at 400 until golden brown and crisp, 15 to 20 minutes, tossing once or twice during cooking. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix together mayonnaise, mustard and worcestershire sauce. Dip halibut in mixture then roll in parmesan cheese. Arrange on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until flaky. Serve immediately on a bed of rice or noodles.

Beat eggs and sugar. Add vanilla and milk. Add flour, salt, and baking powder. Beat well. Pour into greased pan. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown on top. Makes 9-10 small or 6-8 large servings.

Place clam juice, tomatoes, lime juice, hot pepper sauce, tomato paste, mussels, butter and cilantro in a 10 quart stock pot. Heat to boilingcover and steam for 2 minutes or until shells open. Serve with sour cream.

Boil water in a large saucepan with a little olive oil. Add a pinch of salt. When boiling add the couscous. Stir well with a fork and cover with a lid. Cook for 10 minutes until water has been absorbed by the couscous. Add garlic, spring onion, currants and coriander leaves. Stir well with a fork. Remove from heat. Serve in a large bowl garnished with slices of almonds.
Mix all ingredients well in a bowl. Form into patties. Fry in a nonstick skillet. Turn once. Drain fat. Serve on whole grain buns with your favorite toppings. Serve with a side salad.

In a food processor or blender, process the fresh cranberries and sugar until smooth. Stir in the mini marshmallows. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Spread the crushed pineapple evenly on top. Freeze for a few hours. Serve cold. To make the garnish, use a spoon to scoop the mixture out of the pan and roll into balls. Place onto a greased cookie sheet. Freeze until firm and then coat with powdered sugar. Serve on top of the cold cranberry salad.

Heat oven to 350. Coat a 3 quart baking dish with butter. Cook the chicken in a large skillet until no longer pink in the center. Remove from pan and cool to room temp. Shred the chicken with your hands or 2 forks. In a large bowl combine the soups, sour cream, ritz crackers and butter. Stir in the shredded chicken and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spread evenly in the prepared dish. Bake uncovered for 1 hour or until golden brown and bubbly. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Marinate chicken breasts in oil for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice onions and green bell peppers and combine with the marinated chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes. Top with mozzarella cheese and bake for another 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and browned. Serve on hoagie rolls.

Place a piece of bread in a bowl. Break one egg over the piece of bread. Beat the egg with a fork so that the egg is covered in the milk. Make sure you have a medium heat on the stove. Once the stove is on medium heat, put the bread in the pan with the butter so that the bread cooks evenly and is not too oily. Cook until the egg is golden brown in color.

In a bowl mix together the flour, the baking powder and the salt. Add the oil and mix with a fork until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add the water a little at a time until the dough pulls together to form a soft ball that is still slightly sticky. Place the dough on a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes, or until the dough is smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a greased bowl and cover with a damp cloth or place in a plastic bag in the refrigerator overnight to rise. To prepare the dough, place it on a lightly floured surface and roll out to a thickness of about 0.5 cm (1/4 inch). Use a sharp knife to cut out rounds of dough and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for about 25 minutes at 200 degrees Celsius (390 degrees Fahrenheit), or until the bread is golden brown on top.

Cook beans as directed on package. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook garlic and sage, stirring constantly until garlic is golden. Add tomatoes and cook until mixture is thick. Add beans and heat through. Add sausages and cook until heated through, turning links several times. Season with salt and pepper.

Cut beef into 2 inch cubes. In a bowl combine the soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, lime juice, crushed garlic, crushed ginger and crushed chilies. Stir well. Cut green onions into 2 inch pieces. Heat oil in a skillet. Fry green onions until crisp. Add meat. Stir for 2 minutes. Add the marinade. Cook until the meat is tender. Sprinkle with coriander. Serve hot.

In large saucepan combine fruit with 3 cups water. Heat to boiling over high heatreduce heat. Simmer 30 minutes or until fruit is tender. Stir occasionally. Add syrup and cinnamon stickheat through. Serve hot in bowls. Garnish with lemon slices and sprinkle with wine. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a baking pan with butter and set aside. Unroll a can of crescent roll dough and press each triangle into a wedge shape. Place in the prepared baking pan and brush with melted butter and sprinkle with garlic powder and mozzarella cheese. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Serve warm.

In a bowl, mix together the sugar, salt and cornstarchset aside. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks lightlypour in the milk gradually while beating until smoothadd the mixture to the dry ingredientsstir over low heat until thick. Add the butter, beat until smooth. Remove from heatstir in the vanilla extractrefrigerate until cold. Beat egg whites until stifffold into the cold mixturerefrigerate until serving time.
name: old fashioned chocolate puddingingredients: white sugar, cornstarch, cocoa, milk, margarine, vanillapreparation:In a sauce pan combine sugar, cornstarch and cocoa. Slowly add milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat and continue. Stirring until thick. Remove from heat and add margarine and vanilla.
name: vanilla sauce for bread puddingingredients: water, sugar, cornstarch, butter, vanilla extract, saltpreparation:Bring water to a boil, in a small saucepan. Combine sugar and

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms and saute until tender. Add broth, stirring to combine. Heat to a boil, add remaining ingredients stirring to combine. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in chopped parsley and serve over hot cooked rice.

Bring water to boil and pour over green tea and sugar in teapot. Cover and steep for 10 minutes. Strain and add fresh mint and let sit for 10 minutes. Serve over ice cubes with slice of lemon and sprigs of mint to garnish.
Saute onion in butter. Add hash browns. Stir. Add chicken soup. Stir. Add cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 F for 20 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
Boil lobsters in water until done. Cut lobsters into small pieces. Crush ritz crackers. Add to lobster. Add butter. Stir. Add lemon to taste. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 325. Cream butter& nuts. Add flour& baking powder. Stir until dough forms. Press into ungreased 9x13 pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool. Beat together remaining ingredients. Spread over cooled crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool.

To each pound of corn add one-half cup sugar and one-fourth teaspoon salt. Add enough boiling water to cover corn one-half inch above kernels. Cook over low heat until tender, about ten minutes or more. Cool slightly and place in ziploc bags or containers. Use within one year.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together 2/3 cup of sugar with 1/2 cup of softened butter, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Mix dry ingredients together. Add 2 eggs beaten together with 1/4 cup of milk and 1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract to dry mix. Mix until smooth. Pour batter into a greased 10-inch square pan. In a small bowl combine 1/3 cup of sugar with 1 tablespoon of cinnamon. Sprinkle over batter. Bake 35 minutes. Remove from oven and arrange 2 cups of fresh blueberries over batter. Bake for 15 more minutes until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Place fish fillets in a shallow dish, sprinkle with mirin, sugar, salt, sesame oil and lemon zest. Cover with plastic wrap or foil and refrigerate overnight or at least two hours before cooking. Preheat broiler or oven to 450. Arrange fish fillets in a single layer in a small roasting pan or baking dish (one that is large enough for the fish to fit in one layer without crowding). Broil or bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through and opaque in the center, basting once halfway through cooking time with the juices from the pan. Garnish with lemon wedges and chopped cilantro or green onions.

Drain green peas. Crumble bacon. In a large bowl combine lettuce, sugar, salt and pepper. Add eggs and bacon. Sprinkle with peas. Add cheddar cheese and mayonnaise. Top with green onion. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 24 hours. Remove plastic wrap. Let stand 30 minutes. Toss.

Dissolve yeast in warm water, stir in warm water, flour, baking soda, baking powder & salt. Mix well & set aside for 1 hour. Add shortening & buttermilkmix well. Turn dough on a floured board & knead 4 or 5 minutes. Roll 1/2 inch thick & cut with a 1 1/2 inch cookie cutter or drinking glass. Place 1/2 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 5 dozen cookies.

Cook the kielbasa and drain the grease. In a saucepan, combine the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat. Put the cooked kielbasa into the boiling mixture and let it cool. Then put the mixture into a slow cooker and cook on low heat for about eight hours or until the meat is tender.

Cook celery and onion in butter. Add broccoli. Stir in soups. Add rice. Add seasonings. Bake 15 minutes in a greased 2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 6.
