1 cup toasted hazelnuts (use a toaster oven or toast them on a baking sheet at 350 degrees for 10 minutes)1/4 cup vegetable oil1/4 cup powdered sugar1/4 cup cocoa powder1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract1/4 cup milk chocolate chipsPulse toasted hazelnuts and oil in a food processor until finely ground. Add powdered sugar and cocoa powder and pulse until mixture is a smooth paste. With the processor running, add vanilla extract and gradually add chocolate chips until blended and spreadable. Store in refrigerator.
name: hazelnuttosommeletteningredients: mehl, milk, ei, sukker, hazelnotter, salt, smørpreparation:kombinere mehl og milk. Styr inn eggyolken. Stryk inn sukker, hazelnotter og stivt beinert ei. Tilsettsalt til tast. Smelt smør og stek omgangsoppbrøt til gylden

Mix wine, onions and garlic in large bowl. Add 1/2 the chicken breasts and turn to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator 4 hours. Mix pasta sauce with remaining chicken breasts. Place in 8x8x2 baking dish. Top with mozzarella. Bake 350 degrees uncovered 1 hour.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, add ro-tel tomatoes and green onions. Cook until onions are translucent and tomatoes are warm. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and swirl until butter is melted. Place one tortilla in the skillet and add about 1/3 cup of the tomato mixture. Top with one-quarter of the chicken and one-quarter of the cheese. Top with another tortilla and continue to layer until you have used up the tomatoes and all the chicken and cheese. Cook until the bottom is brown. Carefully flip and cook until the other side is brown. Cut into wedges and serve.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and reserve. Add carrots and cook until crisp-tender. Add beans. Cook until tender crisp. Stir in bacon pieces. Meanwhile, melt butter. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add vegetables and bacon and toss lightly. Sprinkle with black pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare cake mix according to directions on box. Add pudding mix. Pour into 13x9 pan. Bake 40 minutes. Cool. Beat sour cream. Spread over top of cooled cake. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Melt chocolate bars in top of double boiler. Add oil and water. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over top. Sprinkle with pecans and coconut. Chill.

Brown sausage and cook until no longer pink. Drain. In large stock pot, combine sausage, broth, water, and hash browns. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add celery and chicken soups and heat through. Stir in milk. Top with cheese. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat butter or margarine in a non-stick pan. Sauté garlic for 1 minute. Add prawns and sauté till the prawns turn pink and curled. Add avocado and sun dried tomatoes. Cook till the avocado is soft. Remove from heat. Cut chicken breasts open and divide filling among them. Stuff the filling evenly. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over and grill till brown on the outside and the cheese is bubbling. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a serving dish combine plain yogurt, cucumber, sweet onion and mint. Beat well and refrigerate for 2 hours to blend flavors. Season steak with lemon-pepper seasoning and cook 8-10 minutes per side on a medium grill or broil until cooked through to desired doneness. Cut steak crosswise into 1-inch slices and place on serving plates. Top steak slices with cucumber raita. Garnish with fresh mint leaves. Makes 6 servings.

In a skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink. Remove sausage to a plate. Add apples to skillet and cook until tender. Add water and brown sugar. Simmer until apples are tender. Serve over rice or noodles. Add sausage to the top.

Bring water to a boil. Add oatmeal and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in bananas, pineapple and orange sections. Cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lemon extract. Cool and refrigerate for 2 hours. Add shredded coconut and stir. Store in the refrigerator.
Mandarin oranges and pineapple are the main ingredients in this fruity salad.
In large bowl, combine mandarin oranges, pineapple, orange sections, and sliced apples.
In small bowl, whisk together 2 tbs. Juice reserved from mandarin oranges, yogurt, sugar, and salt.
Pour over fruit and gently toss to coat. Sprinkle with coconut and marshmallows.
Peel and section oranges over a bowl, reserving juice. Combine orange sections, juice and remaining ingredients. Gently toss. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Garnish, if desired.
Melt together sugar, butter and milk. Take off heat and mix in van

Soak overnight in 4 qt of cold water. In the morning, add 4 cups of cold water to the pot with beans. Add 3-4 strips of bacon or a tbsp of bacon grease. Cook on medium-low for 3-4 hours. When done cooking, add 1 tbsp of sugar. Serve with 2 tbsp of butter melted over top. Serve with cornbread or biscuits.

Butter outsides of french bread. Lay in pan buttered side down. On top of bread, spread 1/2 jarlsberg cheese and 1 tomato, thinly sliced. Top with more cheese and sprinkle with dried basil. Cook until bread is browned and cheese is melted. Top with cooked bacon.

Slice prosciutto into thin strips. Wrap around each cherry pepper. Cut strips into 1-inch pieces. Place on a plate and top with shredded provolone cheese. Drizzle with olive oil.
 cherry tomato and basil pizza with feta cheeseingredients: pizza dough, olive oil, fresh oregano leaves, tomatoes, basil leaves, feta cheesepreparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Divide dough into two balls. Roll out each ball into a 10-inch circle. Place each circle on a baking sheet. Spread a thin layer of olive oil over each crust. Sprinkle with oregano and basil. Bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Top each crust with tomatoes and feta. Return to oven and bake 10 minutes.
Combine all the ingredients in an electric blender or food processor and process until smooth.

In a large frying pan over medium heat, combine pork and beans, olive oil, brown sugar, and the onion. Stir well to combine. Heat to boilingreduce heat to simmer. Simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with hotdogs cut into slices.

Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutesremove from pan to wire rack to finish cooling. Cut cake in halfspread with cream cheese. Spread with lemonaderefrigerate until ready to use. Drain marshmallow cremestir in yellow food coloring until well blended. Spread on top of lemonade layertop with sliced strawberries. Spread on top with cool whiprefrigerate until ready to use.

Sift together the first four ingredients. In another bowl beat the egg well and add milk. Add the sifted ingredients and mix well. Add the sour cream and butter. Blend well and let stand for 5 minutes. Bake on a hot griddle in small amounts of butter. Turn once. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or serve with syrup.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Sprinkle fish evenly with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper. Add to skillet and cook until golden brown. Add carrot and green onion. Stir-fry until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add broccoli. Stir-fry until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add ginger and cook 30 seconds. Add broth. Cook until bubbling. Stir in cornstarch mixture. Cook until thick. Stir in lemon peel. Serve.

Bring broth to a boil. Pour over the couscous. Stir well to mix. Remove from heat. Add the sun-dried tomato. Cover and let stand 3 to 5 minutes. Fluff the couscous with a fork. Stir in basil. Spoon into a shallow bowl or onto a flat serving dish. Garnish with pine nuts.

Combine the apples, splenda granular, butter, cinnamon and 1 cup of the water in a large bowltoss gently to combine. Let stand for 10 minutes. Drain any liquid from the apples. Combine the flour and 1/2 tsp of the cinnamonmix well. Spoon half of the apple mixture into an unbaked pastry shellsprinkle with 2 tbsp of the flour mixture. Top with remaining apple mixturesprinkle with 2 tbsp of the remaining flour mixture. Bake at 350 for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes.

Preheat a nonstick pan over medium heat. Lightly spray pan with cooking spray. Place one slice of bread into pan, buttered side down. Top with mushrooms, ham, and cheese. Top with remaining slice of bread, buttered side up. Cook for about 5 minutes per side or until golden brown and cheese is melted. Makes one sandwich.

In medium bowl combine margarine, worcestershire and mustard. Stir until blended. Dip chicken in mixture. Place in 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 45-60 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
Leftover chicken breast can be used for the recipe.
This page contains a single entry by admin published on November 16, 2009 6:13 PM.
Chicken Pot Pie was the previous entry in this blog.
Honey Glazed Chicken is the next entry in this blog.

Follow directions on the back of the box. Add 1 cup white wine. Bake as directed on the box.
 honey nut french toastingredients: bread, milk, honey, egg, butter, margarinepreparation:Cut bread in half lengthwise. Brush each side with melted butter or margarine. Combine honey, milk and egg. Dip bread in honey mixture. Cook in a skillet or griddle on both sides until golden brown.
 honey nut french toastingredients: bread, milk, honey, egg, butter, margarinepreparation:Cut bread in half lengthwise. Brush each side with melted butter or margarine. Combine honey, milk and egg. Dip bread in honey mixture. Cook in a skillet or griddle on both sides until golden brown.
In a large bowl mix beans with rice. Add lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, onion, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, cut the green beans into 1/2-inch pieces. In a saucepan over low heat, combine the tuna, lemon zest and juice, capers and chili. Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and stir well. Add the green beans. Increase the heat to medium-high and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain the pasta and add to the pan. Toss well. Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Garnish with the parsley.

Combine all of the ingredients except the chicken, canola oil and maple syrup in a food processor and pulse until the mixture is chunky. Heat the oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or Dutch oven. Add the chicken and cook for 6 minutes. Add the maple syrup and cook for another minute or two. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside. Add the cranberry mixture to the pan along with the stock and reduce the heat to low. Cook for about 30 minutes and then add the chicken back to the pan and cook for 1 minute more before serving.
name: cranberry pilaf
ingredients: butter, onion, fresh parsley, chicken bouillon cubes, boiling water, raw rice, cranberries
preparation:Melt butter in a covered saucepan. Saute onion until transparent. Add parsley. Combine bouillon cubes and boiling water. Add to onion and parsley. Stir in rice. Bring mixture to a boil. Add cranberries. Simmer, covered, for 25 minutes

Heat oil in wok or large frying pan over high heat until very hot. Add garlic and stir-fry until fragrant. Add spinach and stir-fry until wilted. Add spring onions. Set aside. Cut pork into bite-sized pieces. In same wok or frying pan over high heat, add 2 tbsp of oil and saute until browned and tender. Add soy sauce and sugar. Stir-fry until well blended and thickened. Add spinach mixture. Toss well. Sprinkle with white sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Place the pineapple pieces on the wooden skewers. In a small saucepan over low heat combine the brown sugar and rum. Stir until the sugar is dissolved and the rum is warm. Pour the sugar mixture over the pineapple. Broil the pineapples for 1-2 minutes or until the sugar is melted and the pineapples are warm. Serve immediately with a small cup of the warm hot chocolate.

Beat cream cheese with powdered sugar until smooth. Stir in lemon juice until well blended. Blend in whipping cream. In a large bowl, toss together fruit with a splash of lemon juice. Spoon fruit in a glass and top with cream cheese mixture. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boilcook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in water and cornstarch until well blended. Combine in a large zip lock bag with pork. Marinate in refrigerator for 4 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place pork in a shallow baking pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve with rice.

Boil the pasta in a pan with the green beans. Add the spring onions and garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add the safflower oil. Pour in the cream cheese. Stir and heat for 1 minute. Add the yogurt. Stir until smooth. Add the cooked chicken. Season to taste with salt. Add the citric acid. Mix well. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream the butter and sugar together until smooth. Add the zest and juice. Beat until fluffy. Mix the flour, soda, and salt together. Add to the creamed mixture. Divide the dough into two balls. Flatten each ball into a disk. Place the disks on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove from the oven. Cool for 1 minute before removing from the pan. Store in an air-tight container. Makes about 2 dozen.

Cook pasta as directed. Rinse with cold water and drain. Meanwhile prepare the vegetables. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Add the vegetables and the pasta to the bowl. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate til chilled. Serve at room temperature.
Shrimp and shell pasta salad carciofo.
Beat eggs with water. Add seasonings. Cook over medium heat until set. Turn over to brown. Spread with butter. Add asparagus and mushroom. Sprinkle with cheese. Let set. Cut in half to serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut sweet potatoes into strips about one half inch wide. Toss in a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil and sprinkle with kosher salt and fresh ground pepper. Lay on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes until tender but not falling apart. Cream together creme fraiche and sriracha sauce. Serve with sweet potato fries.
Sweet potato fries with sriaracha cream
This is a great recipe for sweet potato fries with sriaracha cream.
Honey fried chicken
This is a great recipe for honey fried chicken.
Kartoffelpuffer potato pancakes
This is a great recipe for kartoffelpuffer potato pancakes.
Potato fries with onion and chilli
This is a great recipe for potato fries with onion and chilli.
Roasted sweet potatoes potatoes and carrots
This is a great recipe for roasted sweet potatoes

In the work bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook combine 3 1/4 cups whole wheat and 1/2 cup all-purpose flour. Set aside. In a measuring cup combine 1/2 cup lukewarm tap water and 1/2 teaspoon active dry yeast. Let stand for 5 minutes until the mixture foams. In another measuring cup combine 2/3 cup lukewarm tap water and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. In the work bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook add the yeast mixture and slowly add the salted lukewarm water. Mix until all of the flour is incorporated and the dough is smooth and elastic. Turn the mixer on to medium and knead for 6 minutes until the dough is soft and elastic. Lightly oil a large mixing bowl and place the dough inside. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Divide the dough into 4 equal pieces and roll each piece out between 2 sheets of lightly floured

Heat the oven to 375 degrees f. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Cut the zucchini into 1/4 inch thick slices. Arrange the slices on the pan. Sprinkle the slices with the italian seasoning. Roast in the oven for 35 minutes. Cut the onion into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place in the pan with the roasted zucchini. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until the onions are softened. Serve.

In a large bowl combine olive oil, lime juice, white wine, dry mustard, chili powder, fresh ground black pepper and fresh cilantro. Blend well. Season both sides of fish with seasoning blend and refrigerate for about an hour or until ready to cook. Heat a grill or broil pan over high heat. Brush fish lightly with oil and place on hot surface. Cook about 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with fresh salsa.

In a medium saucepan, combine the nonfat milk, water, steel cut oats, brown sugar, kosher salt and flax seeds. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until desired doneness and consistency. Serve with nonfat milk on the side. Makes 3 cups.
Dietary fiber is an important part of any healthy diet. A diet high in fiber can help to relieve constipation and prevent other intestinal disorders. It also plays a role in helping to lower cholesterol levels and regulate blood sugar levels. Eating enough fiber may also help to reduce the risk of heart disease and certain types of cancer.
Fiber is found in foods such as whole grains, fruits, vegetables and beans. It is also present in some animal products. However, it is primarily found in plant based foods.
It is recommended that adults consume at least 25 grams of fiber per day. This amount can be achieved through eating a balanced diet that includes plenty of fruits and veget

Peel fruit and remove white pith. Shred fruit coarsely, saving some of the peel for decoration later on. Cook fruit in water until tender. Add sugar and cook over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture boils. Stir constantly until thick and clear. Remove from heat and skim off any foam that forms. Fill sterilized jars and cap tightly. Process in boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Makes approximately six pounds of marmalade.

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and garlic. Saute until garlic is golden. Add shallots and saute until tender. Add roma tomatoes and cook until tender. Add asparagus and cook until crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with basil leaves.
Combine all ingrediants in a large bowl. Mix well. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Preheat a cast-iron grill pan over medium heat. Spread one side of each slice of bread with balsamic vinaigrette. Top each slice with spinach. Sprinkle with salt. Layer 2 slices of ham on each spinach-topped slice. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the shredded cheese. Top with tomato slices. Place the other slice of toasted bread on top. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side or until the bottom slice is golden brown. Serve.

Drain pheasant meat and bones. Saute onion in canola oil until lightly browned. Add pheasant meat and saute until no longer pink. Add flour and stir until well blended. Add milk and stir until smooth. Stir in sour cream and parsley. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook and stir over low heat until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with parsley and paprika.

Cook corned beef hash according to package directions. Break into small pieces. In a skillet saute onions in butter until tender. Add tabasco sauce to taste. Add corned beef hash. Stir in cooked eggs. Spoon mixture onto a baking dish. Sprinkle with colby cheese. Bake at 350f for about 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Bring stock to a boil in a large saucepan. Add chicken and boil for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the chicken from stock. When cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the bones. Cut the chicken into small bite sized pieces. Heat the oven to 350F. In a bowl combine ricotta cheese, cottage cheese, parmesan cheese, spinach and salt. Mix well. Divide the mixture among the shells. Spoon a little sauce in the bottom of a large baking dish. Arrange the stuffed pasta shells on top. Spoon the remaining sauce over the top. Sprinkle with the basil leaves. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.

Combine sour cream and french dressing. Crumble caraway seeds into dressing. Shred cauliflower. Chop celery leaves. Chop green onion. Combine all vegetables with dressing. Toss lightly. Add salt to taste. Serve cold.

Drain marinated artichokes. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add onion, garlic, lemon juice, oregano and spinach. Cover and cook until tender. Add eggs and cook until just set. Cool slightly. Stir in artichokes. Stir in breadcrumbs and cheese. Press evenly into a lightly oiled 9 x 13 pan. Bake in 350 F oven 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into 15 squares. Makes 15 servings.
Beat together powdered sugar, light karo syrup, cocoa, vanilla wafer crumbs, pecans and bourbon. Form into ballsrefrigerate. Roll balls in chopped pecans or ground nuts.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine mint, olive oil, and garlic in a small bowl. Cut zucchini into 1 inch pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add mint mixture and toss well. Drain pasta. Toss in pasta. Serve.

Combine all the ingredients except the bread and ham. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in cheese and ham. Spread mixture on two slices of whole wheat bread. Broil until cheese is melted.

Trim excess fat from pork chop. Cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces. In a large skillet or wok heat oil. Add chops and stir-fry until browned on both sides. Add celery and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients except vegetable stock. Stir-fry until pork is cooked through. Add stock, stir and heat through. Serve with boiled or fried rice.

Cook hominy in boiling water 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and onioncook 2 minutes. Stir in hominy. Season with salt. Serve immediately.
This page contains recipes for squash recipes with pictures. This page is presented to you by Guitar Solo, a place where you can find the most wanted guitars on the internet.

Preheat the over to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour muffin tins. In a large bowl, combine the bananas, splenda, and lemon juice. Beat well. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir the flour mixture into the banana mixture. Stir in the milk and the egg until smooth. Fill each muffin cup 2/3 full with batter. Sprinkle each muffin with 1 teaspoon of the chopped walnuts. Bake for 18 to 22 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the muffins are golden and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Remove from the oven, and allow to cool in the tins for 10 minutes before removing.

In a medium bowl combine dry ingredientsset aside. In another bowl beat the egg until light and thick. Stir in the buttermilkmix in the melted canola oil. Stir in the dry ingredients to make a smooth batter. Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake. Brown on both sides. Serve with butter or margarine and real maple syrup.

Combine all ingredients except oil and milk to form a dough. Add oil and knead until mixture forms a ball. Add milk to form a soft dough. Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out with a 2 1/2-inch cutter. Bake 10 minutes at 450 degrees. Remove from oven. With a 2-inch cutter, cut a circle from the center of each cookie. Replace the circle on top of the cookie for a 3D effect. Bake 3 more minutes at 450 degrees. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Combine the flour, garlic powder, onion powder, dried oregano, salt, and pepper in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken breasts into the dish to coat with the flour mixture on both sides. Place the coated breasts into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, and sprinkle with the dried parsley.Pour the water over the mashed potatoes in a separate bowl until the potatoes are moistened. Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top of the chicken breasts to cover. Cover with aluminum foil, and bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Uncover, and continue to bake until the top of the mashed potatoes is lightly browned, about 20 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Wash the dried beans well. Add the beans, the ham hocks, the bay leaves, the cloves, the onion and the water to a 12-quart stockpot. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium low. Skim the surface of the liquid as needed. Cook for 3 hours. Season the soup with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve, ladle the soup into bowls. Garnish each serving with shredded cheddar cheese and slices of crispy bacon.
Beans are the one of the most important foods for healthy eating. They are high in fiber and protein. Beans are also low in fat and calories. They are also one of the best vegetarian sources of iron. Beans are also good for the heart. They may lower blood cholesterol. Beans can also help reduce the risk of cancer.
Beans can also help reduce the risk of cancer.

Cook ketchup and red wine in a skillet, over medium high heat. Add in the whole kielbasa. Cook covered until the cabbage is tender. Stir in the boiling potatoes. Cook uncovered over medium high heat for 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Season to taste with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Stir in the red pepper sauce. Serve.

Cream butter and vanilla essenceadd sugar gradually beating until mixedadd flour to mixturemix welladd nutsroll into ballsplace on greased traybake at 350f for 20 minutes or until golden brownremove from ovendip in chocolate sauce or leave plain.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In 2 1/2 quart ovenproof dutch oven melt butter over med. heat. Add onion and celerysaute 5 min., stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in flour. Stir in broth. Return to heatbring to boil. Stir in chicken, noodles, soup, lemon juice, mushrooms, pepperheat through. Bake uncovered 1 hour or until chicken is done.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add the potatoes. Cook until done. Drain the water. Mash the potatoes. Add the cream cheese. Beat until creamy. Add the sour cream. Beat until smooth. Add the butter. Mix well. Add onion powder and season with fresh ground black pepper to taste. Top with the shredded cheddar cheese. Serve hot.

Sift together dry ingredients. Make well in center of dry ingredients. Stir in milk and beaten egg and then add creamed corn and zucchini. Fill greased muffin tins 2/3 full. Bake in hot oven for 25 minutes or until light brown.
"We have learned to fly the air like birds and swim the sea like fishes, but we have not yet learned the simple art of living together as brothers."
"In this world you just can't trust a good feeling."
"I'm a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it."

"It's not what your country can do for you that countsit's what you can do for your country."
"Forgive your enemies--but never forget their names."
In large pan, combine butter, sugar, buttermilk and syrup. Cook over low heat until syrup thickens and forms a ball when dropped from spoon into a cup of cold water. Cool before using.

Brown mushrooms and onion in oil in saucepan until softened. Add tomato and jalapeno pepper. Add minced chicken and basmati rice. Cook for a few minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and cool for a few minutes. Combine egg with breadcrumbs and stir into chicken mixture. Spoon mixture into bell pepper halves and sprinkle with grated cheese. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Mix lemon jelly with 3 tablespoons evaporated low-fat milk until smooth. Add remaining evaporated low-fat milk. Add pineapple and stir until completely mixed. Spoon into a 1-quart serving bowl. Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. Arrange kiwi fruits in a circle around the perimeter of the bowl. Spoon chocolate mixture into the center of the bowl and swirl into the set mixture. Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Garnish with a mint leaf, if desired.
A variety of different dessert recipes which are made using the fruit Pineapple.

Place the dried yellow peas in a large bowl and cover them with plenty of cold water. Soak the peas for 4-8 hours or overnight. Drain the soaked peas and place them in a large pot with the cold water and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and add the salt and ginger. Cook until the peas are tender. Add the diced pork and continue cooking until the meat is done. Serve in bowls and top with the chopped parsley.

In a heavy medium sauce pan, saute shallots in butter until tender. Add in garlic cloves and continue to saute until shallots & garlic are golden in color. Add in flour and cook until browned. Add in white wine to deglaze the pan. Gradually whisk in cream until the sauce is smooth. Stir in Parmesan cheese, season with salt & pepper. Place cooked tortellini in a serving dish. Pour sauce over the top of pasta. Sprinkle with fresh basil.

In a large soup kettle or dutch oven, place chicken, potatoes, carrots, garlic, onion, beans, tomatoes, green peas, tomato ketchup, and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until chicken is done and veggies are tender. Serve over white rice in a shallow soup bowl. Pass soy sauce.

In a heavy saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Add milk. Bring to a boil and cook until thickened. Stir in cheese. Continue to heat and stir until melted. Add the poblano and salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Stir in cilantro leaves. Serve warm with tortilla chips.
Name: White Cheese Dip Tex Mex Style Queso Blanco
Name: White Cheese Dip
Name: Queso Dip
Name: Chunky Cheese Dip
Name: Queso Dip With Tequila By Rick Bayless
Name: Quesadilla
Name: Citrus Salsa
Name: Queso Poblano Or Jalapeno Dipping Sauce

Grease a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder and salt. Beat together egg and milk until well combined and frothy. Beat in applesauce and cheese. Add dry ingredients and beat well. Spoon into prepared pan and smooth top. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until done (toothpick inserted into center should come out clean). Cool completely on wire rack. Drizzle with melted butter if desired. Makes 1 loaf. Serve as a side dish or snack bread.

I like to buy my pork loin in the butcher shop where it is much cheaper than in the supermarket. The butcher slices it thin for me so I can layer it in the slow cooker. I use a whole Granny Smith apple, core removed, for every pound of meat. I put a little honey on top of each layer of meat & then add 2 or 3 thinly sliced apples on top of the last layer of meat. I don't add the cinnamon until the end because I don't like it as much as the hubby. When it is done I pull it out & put it on a platter. Then I put the sauce into the blender & pour it over the meat. It looks nice that way & the blender makes it nice & smooth. Makes a lot of gravy!
Place the fresh ginger in boiling water. Add the black tea leaves and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and milk to taste. Strain and drink hot or cold.

Cut pancetta into small cubes. Cook in large skillet over medium-low heat until fat is rendered and pancetta is crisp. Drain. Add butter to pan and add zucchini. Cook over medium heat until softened. Sprinkle with pancetta and top with Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper.
Blend dressing with cream cheese till smooth. Spread on 4 bread slices. Sprinkle with raisins and olives, add remaining bread and press firmly together. Cut into wedges.

Coat each banana slice with flour. Whisk the egg, milk, and salt together in one bowl. Put the flour into another bowl. Dip each piece of fruit into the flour mixture to coat lightly. Next dip into the egg mixture, then back into the flour mixture to coat again. Heat the oil over high heat to 375 F or until very hot. Fry 5 or 6 pieces of fruit at once until golden brown on both sides, about 1-1 1/2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels

In sauce pan combine the first five ingredients. Cook over low heat until smooth and boiling. Remove from heatadd the nuts. Mix lightly. Pour mixture into a buttered 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on wire rack. In small saucepan combine the chocolate chips and cream until melted. Spread over bars. Cool completely. Cut into 2-inch squares. Store in covered container.

Slash each side of chicken breasts. Stuff with cream cheese mixture. Wrap with 1/2 slice of bacon per breast and secure with toothpicks. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Unwrap chicken before serving.

Lightly toast bread slices. Spread with dressing. Arrange zucchini slices on top. Sprinkle with onion. Season with garlic and pepper. Top with tomato slices. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees f 190 degrees c for 10 minutes or until crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl toss together chicken, olive oil, thyme, and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Place in a large shallow baking pan and arrange lemon slices around the edges. Roast for 1 hour or until an instant-read thermometer inserted in thickest portion of a thigh reads 160 degrees f.
I love to cook and i love to cook with lemon and i love to cook with garlic so this was a great recipe for me. I had some lemon pepper seasoning which i used in place of the lemon pepper salt and i didnt use all of the lemon juice so i used a little less olive oil. I also used a bone-in chicken breast cut into pieces and it came out great.
I made this today and it was delicious! I didnt have lemon pepper salt so i just used a little less lemon juice and a little less salt. I used a bone-in chicken breast cut into pieces and it came out great!

Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir to dissolve sugar. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and strain mixture into a container with a tight-fitting lid. Cool completely. Refrigerate until ready to use. Makes approximately 2 cups of dressing or sauce.

In a shallow bowl whisk together eggnog, eggs, cinnamon and nutmeg. Dip the bread into the mixture and coat on both sides. Wrap the slices in plastic wrap or place in a zip-top bag and refrigerate. The next morning, heat a small skillet over medium-high heat and melt the butter. Place a few slices of the bread in the skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides. Repeat with the remaining slices. Serve with maple syrup or a drizzle of honey.

Core and halve the apples, leaving the stems intact. Place the apples cut side down in a shallow baking dish. Pour the liquid mixture over the top of the apples. Bake for 40 minutes or until tender and bubbly. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream or ice cream on top.
Heat milk in double boiler. Add flour, stirring constantly until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add tuna and stir until thoroughly heated through. Add more milk if necessary. Serve over toast.

Combine sugar and evaporated milk in a saucepan and heat over medium heat until mixture comes to a rolling boil. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon and salt until well mixed. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish and spread evenly. Dot with miniature marshmallows and sprinkle with chocolate chips and remaining cinnamon and salt. Let stand for at least 3 hours before cutting into squares.

In a large skillet cook the beef and onion until browned. Add green pepper and mushrooms. Stir in soup, cream cheese, pepper and worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil. Stir in the noodles. Reduce heat and cook until the noodles are tender, stirring occasionally. Serve immediately.
I think I am going to try the German Skillet one this weekend for my family. They love anything with sauerkraut in it! Thanks for sharing!
I'm going to try that German Skillet one. I'm sure the kids will love it.

Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius. Grease an oven proof dish with olive oil. Beat eggs with a fork in a bowl until thick and creamy. Sift in flour and add in grated zucchini and chopped mint leaves and mix well. Season with pepper and salt and sprinkle in cheese and garlic powder. Pour into dish and bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve with warm bread.

In a skillet, brown tenderloin on all sides. Remove from skillet. In the same skillet add onion and garlic. Saute for 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce. Heat through. Place meat on top of pasta. Top with crumb mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until crumbs are brown. Serve with vegetable.

In a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, saute the onion in the oil until soft. Add the broccoli florets and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sweet red and yellow peppers. Sprinkle the ginger root over the vegetables. Add the stock and soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

In a large pot, combine water with astragalus root, tomatoes and broccoli. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add shiitake mushrooms. Season with salt to taste.

Prepare brownies according to package directions. Cool completely. In a small bowl, cream eggs and oil. Beat in morsels and nuts. Drop by teaspoonful onto waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container. Yield: 3 dozen.

Soak the beans overnight and drain them. Put the ham hock into a large heavy pot and cover with water by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat and skim off any foam that forms on the surface of the water. Add the beans and cook, skimming regularly, until the beans are just tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Add the onion, garlic, cumin, and chili powder and cook for 5 minutes more, until the onion is tender but not brown. Add the tomatoes and the ham hock (with the meat) and continue to simmer until the beans are very tender but not breaking up, about 45 minutes more. Remove the ham hock and let cool slightlystrain the beans, discarding the ham hock and vegetables. Stir the beans into the chipotle puree and cook just until heated through. Taste for seasoningadd salt and pepper as needed. Serve with the reserved ham hock meat chopped over the top.
Cook onions in oil until very soft. Drain and cool. Mix with remaining ingredients. Put in baking dish and bake at 350 degrees until cheese is melted and onions are bubbly. Serve with crackers.

Heat vegetable oil in a skillet. Cook lamb rib chops over medium high heat for 4-5 minutes per side, until desired doneness. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Combine yogurt, rosemary and dill in a small bowl. Add lemon juice and mix until combined. Serve the yogurt sauce drizzled over the top of the lamb chops.
Mix all the ingredients above in a bowl. Add your desired cut of lamb. Cover in the fridge for at least 24 hours. Cook your lamb in your preferred way. Enjoy a nice new taste to your meat.
Mix all the ingredients above in a bowl. Add your desired cut of lamb. Cover in the fridge for at least 24 hours. Cook your lamb in your preferred way. Enjoy a nice new taste to your meat.
Combine garlic rosemary lemon zest and juice and olive oil pour over the racks and marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hrs. Place the lamb on the rack of a shallow roast

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large skillet, brown the sausage links. In a large bowl, combine the tomato paste, Italian herbs and garlic powder. Add the sausage links to the bowl and mix together. Spread mixture into a 9×13 inch baking dish. Arrange pepper slices over mixture. Spread onions over peppers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with salad dressing. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven.

In a large pot add the olive oil and saute the garlic and vermicelli until golden. Add the rice and saute until lightly browned. Add the water and bring the pot to a boil. Reduce the heat and cover the pot. Cook for 20 minutes until the rice is tender. Remove from the heat and let it sit for 5 minutes. Add the herbs and season with salt and pepper. Fluff with a fork.

Peel and trim asparagus stems and cut into 2-inch pieces. Combine lemon juice and olive oil and place in a large glass bowl or 1-gallon plastic bag. Add asparagus pieces and toss to coatchill 1 hour to overnight. Remove from refrigerator and drain excess liquiddiscard liquid. Combine dijon mustard and dill weed and whisk until smooth. Add garlic and whisk until smooth. Pour mixture over asparagustoss gently to coat evenly. Add salt and pepper to tastechill 1 hour to overnight. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish, if desired.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 10-inch tube or Bundt pan. Roll the dough into a 10-inch square and place it into the bottom of the pan. Brush the dough with the melted butter and sprinkle the dough with the pepperoni and mozzarella cheese. Repeat until all the dough is covered with the toppings. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes, then invert onto a large serving plate. Cut into wedges and serve immediately. Makes 10 servings (2 slices per serving).
Cream butter and sugars. Add in almonds. Mix in cake mix. Add eggs one at a time. Add eggnog. Add rum. Fold in pineapple chunks. Pour into greased spring form pan. Bake at 325F for one hour.

Cook vegetables and tofu in oil in a wok or frying pan until tender. Drain and set aside in a bowl. In a small bowl, combine sesame oil and vinegar and set aside. Combine all filling ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in sesame oil mixture. Spread filling evenly onto each bun. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days. Serve at room temperature or reheat in microwave or oven.

Cut off and discard wing tips. Combine flour and spices. Dip wings in flour mixture. In large skillet over medium heat, add margarine and saut chicken wings until browned. Pour hot sauce and vinegar into the pan. Stir and cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken is tender. Sprinkle with additional hot sauce and pepper before serving. Serve with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing.

Slice vegetable thinly using a vegetable peeler. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crispy on one side. Turn over and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the other side is also crispy. Drain on paper towel to absorb excess oil. Serve with sweet chilli sauce or tomato sauce or dip.

Mix together the eggs, milk, butter and sugar until smooth and well mixed. In another bowl combine the all-purpose flour, salt, vanilla and cinnamon. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture while stirring until the batter is smooth. Let stand for about 30 minutes before using. Pour into a heated electric skillet or frying pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Cook until bubbles appear on the surface of the batter. Flip over and cook on the other side for about two minutes or until golden brown. Serve with whipped topping or ice cream.
The crepe is the French version of the pancake. Crepe batter is very thin, requiring very little liquid to make it pliable enough to spread out on the hot griddle or in the waffle iron. The most important ingredient is the type of flour you use. You may use all-purpose flour or pastry flour. Pastry flour will give you the lightest and crispiest crepe or waffle.
Crepe batter is also very forgivingyou don't need to

Slice the potatoes thinly. Soak in cold water for 5 minutes. Dry them on a kitchen towel or paper towel. Heat a heavy frying pan (cast iron or heavy aluminum) with a little oil in the pan and turn the heat to medium high. Place a couple slices in the pan (don t crowd them) and fry for 2 to 3 minutes until they start to brown. Turn them over and fry for another 3 or 4 minutes until the other side is brown. Remove the potato slices from the frying pan with a slotted spoon and place them in a paper towel lined plate to remove the excess oil. Salt them to taste and place them in a serving bowl. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the potatoes and serve them hot or at room temperature. They re very good warm or at room temperature and they can be served as a side dish or as an appetizer.

Soften gelatin in water. Heat lemon pie filling in saucepan. Stir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Chill. Slice angel food cake into 3/4 inch cubes. Puree strawberries. Combine cake cubes, strawberry puree, and gelatin mixture in large bowl. Refrigerate. In another bowl beat cream until thick. Add sugar, vanilla and lemon zest. Beat until stiff peaks form. Spread half of the mixture over the cubes of cake. Top with remaining cake cubes. Spoon remaining cream mixture over top of the cake. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Garnish with liqueur.

Cook onion & green pepper in butter until soft. Add corn & water to a boil. Lower heat & add corn meal & cracker crumbs & continue cooking 5 minutes or until thick. Beat together the eggs & milk. Add to hot mixture. Stir in remaining ingredients & pour into a well greased 13x9 baking dish. Bake in a 350f oven for 1 hour or until brown on top & bubbly all around sides of dish. Serve hot. Serves 4 or more.
Mix all together and form into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Serve with crackers.

Combine eggs and milk in small bowl. Let stand 15 minutes. Combine flour, sugar, salt, yeast and cardamom in large bowl. Add butter. Mix at low speed for 30 seconds. Mix at medium speed for 1 minute. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let rise in warm, draft-free area for 1 hour. Stir down. Spray bread pan with cooking spray. Pour in batter and let rise in warm, draft-free area for 40 minutes. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove from pancool on rack. Makes one loaf.
Boil water and add peanut oil, dried thai chiles and scallions. Add potatoes and salt. Stir and cook until done.

Cook sausage and peppers and onion in a large skillet over medium heat until sausage is browned. Add zucchini. Stir in tomatoes and corn. Cover and simmer until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.
Brown sausage in skillet. Drain. Add the rest of the ingredients to crockpot. Cook on low 4 hours. Serve with tortilla chips or bake in cooked wonton wrappers till set.

Cook ground beef and onion together. Add broth and worcestershire sauce. Cook until tender. Mix flour and seasonings. Add to meat mixture. Add mixed vegetables. Top with mashed potatoes. Bake in 9 x 13 pan. 350 degrees for about 35 minutes.

Combine cornstarch& splenda in small saucepan. Add water& stir over low heat until blended. Stir in cinnamon. Add lemon juice& rum. Boil 1 min., stirring constantly. Cool slightly. Stir in coffee& syrup. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Remove from heat& stir in milk until smooth. Serve over ice in tall glasses. Garnish with cinnamon sticks.

Oh I love drinks! I'll have to try some of those out!

My husband is not a fan of drinks but I am! I like to try new things so I am definitely going to try some of these! Thanks!
Oh my god! You can't go wrong with all of these reci

To a blender or food processor add the hot water and the cooked rice and puree until smooth. Transfer to a small saucepan and bring the mixture back to a boil. Add the sugar and the vanilla and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and serve warm.

Soak the breadcrumbs in the hot milk and allow to cool to room temperature. Beat the eggs into the mixture and add the grated cheese and nutmeg. Whisk well. Heat the oil in a large pan and saut the lemon zest and onion until translucent. Add the mixture and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and reaches a porridge consistency. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add a little bit of broth and allow to simmer for a few minutes. Serve hot.

Saute onion in skillet until tender. Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned. Add the broth and mustard and cook until thickened. Stir in the honey and pepper sauce. Pour over the rice. Serve hot.

Cream the butter and sugar. Add the eggs and beat well. Combine the dry ingredients then add alternately with the milk to the creamed mixture. Drop by the spoonful onto a greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Prepare eggplant for eggplant parmesan, following package instructions and layer in a 13x9 inch pan. Bake in oven for about an hour and cool. Drain eggplant and reserve juices. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute diced eggplant in 2 tablespoons olive oil with crushed red pepper flakes for 3 minutes. Add tomato sauce and red wine. Simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in diced tomatoes and eggplant juices. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in parsley and heat through. Toss hot eggplant mixture with prepared angel hair pasta.
Place ricotta in a serving dish. Top with lemon zest and espresso coffee. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cocoa powder. Garnish with berries.

Cut up the potatoes into cubes. Add them to the bottom of the dish. Add the kielbasa and the sauerkraut. Drizzle with the olive oil. Season with pepper and salt. Bake for 20-30 minutes until the potatoes are fork tender. Serve with rye bread.

In a large pot over medium heat, combine cayenne pepper, allspice, and turmeric with 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add cabbage and cook for 20 minutes. Add butter and tomato pastestir well. Add remaining water to pot and cook for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small bowl, combine the garlic, lemon pepper and lime zest. Rub the fish steaks with the mixture and let stand for 15 minutes at room temperature. In a small saucepan, combine the chicken stock powder and 1/4 cup water and bring to a boil. Stir in the cream and reduce until thick and bubbly. Remove from the heat and stir in the capers and onion. Season with salt and pepper. In a large non-stick skillet or on a broiler pan coated with cooking spray, place the fish steaks and cook for 3 minutes per side or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove the fish from the pan. Add the mustard and cream mixture to the pan and stir until hot. Pour over the fish steaks. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the chicken, onion, feta cheese and seasonings. Toss. Add grapes and toss lightly. Dressing may be prepared several days in advance. To serve, combine the dressing just before serving. Toss with the chicken mixture. Serve in pita bread or on lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook ravioli in boiling water 3 minutes. Drainreturn to saucepan. Add marinara sauce. Bring to boilingheat through 2 minutes. Transfer to shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbsdrizzle with oil. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix stuffing mix, broth, and butter. Stir in spinach, mushrooms, onion, and parmesan cheese. Lightly moisten with more broth or milk if mixture seems dry. Add eggsmix well. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls, using about 1-1/2 tsp per ball. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn once. Bake for 10-15 minutes longer or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Combine brown sugar, soy sauce, and minced ginger in small bowl. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet. Add 1 minced garlic clove and cook for about 30 seconds. Add boneless skinless breasts and cook until browned. Transfer the meat to a plate. Add 1 minced garlic clove and cook for about 30 seconds. Add boneless skinless breasts and cook until browned. Transfer the meat to a plate. Add the remaining ginger, cooked meat and 1/4 cup soy sauce mixture. Stir until combined. Spoon mixture into lettuce wraps. Garnish with parsley and sesame seeds.

Cut spam in 1-inch cubesplace in bowl. Add pineapplestir to blend well. In separate bowl mix together cornflakes and brown sugar. Sprinkle over spam mixture and mix well. Press firmly into 9x13-inch pan coated with cooking spray or butter and parchment paper. Bake in 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 5 minutes. Mix mustard and clovesspread evenly over top of spam mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 servings.
Combine and mix first 5 ingredients. Add eggs and milk and mix thoroughly. Roll in breadcrumbs. Bake in 400 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve in spaghetti sauce or with pasta or over rice.

Cook potatoes in a large amount of water until tender. Drain water and put through a sieve to remove all liquid. Mix in the rest of the ingredients to make a firm dough. Roll into small balls and flatten each one with a fork or the heel of your hand. Put into a greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.

Peel and slice cucumbers lengthwise. Sprinkle them with salt and black pepper. Place in colander over sink and let drain for 5 minutes. In bowl combine yogurt, onion and cilantro. Place cucumber slices on top and sprinkle with cumin seeds and fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to blend flavors. Serve with tortilla chips.
Mix all ingredients together in a sauce pan. Bring to a boil and simmer for a few minutes. Pour over French fries. Bake at 350 degrees F. for about 30 minutes.

Mix together dry ingredients. Add buttermilk and eggs. Add butter. Stir in boiling water and butter. Spoon into well greased muffin pans. Bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Makes 6 muffins.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions. Cook until tender. Add potatoes. Add white pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in broth and bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Stir in cooked bacon. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Stir in milk and fat-free half-and-half. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until hot. Serve sprinkled with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease muffin tins. Sift together the dry ingredients and set aside. Cut the vegetables into small pieces. Blend together the cream cheese and milk until smooth. Beat the egg and add to the cream cheese mixture along with the vegetables. Fold in the dry ingredients. Spoon into muffin tins and bake for 18-20 minutes until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Place ham in baking dish and add jelly and mustard. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 20 minutes in preheated oven. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the mustard and pepper. Pour over the cooked ham and turn to coat well. Continue baking uncovered for an additional 20 minutes or until heated through.

In a large skillet, saute the green pepper in oil until crisp-tender. Remove from the skillet. In the same skillet, saute the garlic powder, dried basil leaves and the black pepper in the oil until fragrant. Remove from the heat. In a large saucepan, combine the broth, veg-all, green peppers, rice, seasoning mix and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer covered for 5 minutes. Add the garlic mixturesimmer covered for an additional 5 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Serve immediately.

Wash and cut up the potatoes and carrots. Toss in olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Cook in the oven until tender. Meanwhile, brown the chops. In a saucepan, combine the remaining ingredients except for the ketchup. Simmer over low heat until thickened. Pour over the chops and bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Serve with the vegetables.

Wash oranges well. Cut orange in half. Scoop out orange flesh and discard shell. Cut beetroot into cubes and place in a bowl. Add orange flesh to bowl. Chop bocconcini into small pieces. Add to bowl. Add lettuce leaves to bowl. Add dressing. Mix well.

Boil noodles till done. Drain and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients and add to the noodles. Mix well. Pour into a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour or until top is a light brown color. Sprinkle with corn flakes before serving.

Remove seeds from mangoes and cut into small pieces. Combine mangoes with scotch bonnet peppers and lime juice in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until mangoes are soft. Mash mangoes with a potato masher or with an immersion blender. Stir in remaining ingredients and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened and syrupy. Store in sterilized jars.

Rinse the pork under running waterpat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with the black pepper, parmesan cheese, basil, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, and saltset aside for 1 hour at room temperature. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd the porkcook 10 to 12 minutes on each side, or until the pork is golden brown and cooked through. Remove pork from the skilletkeep warm. In the same skillet, heat the butter over medium heatadd the onionsaute until translucent, about 2 minutesstir in the flourcook 1 minute more, stirring frequently. Gradually stir in the winebring to a boilcook until slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Stir in the brothseason with salt and pepperreturn the pork to the skillet. Covercook over low heat for 20 minutes more or until the pork is tenderuncoverheat to a boil. Add the creambring to a simmercook 5 minutes or until
Combine lemon juice, honey, and cayenne in pitcher. Stir in 4 cups hot water. Cut one slice of fresh ginger into thin slices and add them to the pitcher. Serve over ice cubes, if desired.

In a small bowl mash together the yolk mixture and the mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in the cayenne, salt and pepper. Fold in the capers and carrots and celery. Spoon or pipe the mixture into the hollow of the egg halves. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 220 c. Line muffin tray with paper cases and grease tray. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in eggs and add the yogurt and milk and beat again. Sift over the dry ingredients and stir together. Stir through the coconut and chocolate chips. Spoon into muffin cases and bake for 20 minutes in a preheated 220 c oven. Leave muffins in the tin for a few minutes before removing to cool on a wire rack.
Beat together peanut butter and cream cheese until smooth. Stir in sugar, and mix in milk. Add coolwhip and stir until blended. Spread in crust. Top with chopped peanuts. Chill.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place chops in a baking dish, pour over the Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice. Sprinkle evenly with 2 tablespoons butter. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until desired doneness. Remove from the oven and sprinkle evenly with remaining butter and chopped parsley. Serve warm.

Heat oil in nonstick skillet over med hi heat. Add onion, cook 2 minutes or until golden. Reduce heat to med. Beat eggs, milk, peas, salt and pepper together until smooth. Pour mixture into skillet. Cook until eggs are set. Cut into wedges and serve immediately.
Drain fruit and set aside. Combine pudding mix & juice in a medium bowl. Stir in yogurt. Add fruit. Fold in Cool Whip Free until blended. Garnish with additional chopped nuts if desired.

Slice French bread lengthwise. Spread butter on both sides and sprinkle with salt and paprika, then sprinkle with celery seed and cayenne pepper. Bake on a greased baking sheet in a 350 oven until crisp and golden brown and serve hot.

Place beans in a large bowl. Cut the butter into small pieces and add to the bowl. Mince garlic cloves and add them to the bowl as well. Add the rosemary sprigs. Zest lemon and squeeze a wedge to add to the bowl. Add a pinch of kosher salt and some freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir to combine the flavors. Refrigerate for a couple hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix together sausage and potatoes. In large bowl, whisk together the eggs. Add the sausage mixture to the eggs. Add the cheese. Spray an 8 x 8-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray. Pour in the mixture. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve warm.
Mix first seven ingredients in a large bowl until well-blended. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie pan and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour or until firm. Cool on wire rack and frost if desired.

Combine mayonnaise and hoisin sauce. Add green onion and ginger. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Coat fillets with sesame oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill or broil until fish flakes easily. Spread bottom bun with sauce. Top with fish and lettuce. Finish with top bun and serve.

Place pinto beans in a large bowl and add enough water to cover the beans by 3 inches. Soak the beans for 1 hour. Drain the beans and set aside in a large pot. In a Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat, saute onions in oil until tender about 5 minutes. Add garlic and stir 1 minute longer. Stir in remaining ingredients except cilantro. Simmer covered for 1 hour or until the beans are tender. Sprinkle with cilantro before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silpat. In a medium bowl whisk together egg yolk, lemon juice and olive oil. Add hazelnuts and toss to coat evenly. Spread hazelnuts in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly toasted. Remove from oven and let cool. In a small bowl whisk together maple syrup and lemon juice. Add salt to taste. Add hazelnuts to lemon juice mixture. Stir to coat hazelnuts. Spread onto a baking sheet lined with a silpat or parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven and let cool. In a large bowl toss lettuce with prosciutto. Add crisps to salad. Add dressing to taste.

Heat oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Remove from heat and mix in the garlic, oregano, chilies and chili powder. Remove from heat. Mix in the breadcrumbs and allow to cool slightly. In a food processor add the cooled mixture along with the chickpeas and the cilantro. Pulse until just mixed together. Form the mixture into burgers and coat with flour. In a heavy frying pan heat the oil over medium heat and fry the burgers until golden.
name: 15 minute chiliingredients: ground turkey, onion, pinto beans, kidney beans, stewed tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, salsapreparation:In a large pot, brown meat with chopped onion. Drain grease, if necessary. Add beans, tomatoes, garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt and salsa to meat mixture. Cook until heated through. Serve with cornbread, cooked pasta, cooked rice, or on top of a b

Cut cabbage in half crosswiseremove core from each half. Cut each half into wedges. Place in a resealable bag or dishadd onion powder, season salt, worcestershire sauce and hot pepper saucemix well to coat. Let stand at room temperature for about 30 minutes. Place wedges, cut sides down, on grill rack coated with cooking spraygrill 10 minutes or until tender. Turngrill 3 minutes or until heated through. Yield: 4 servings.

Place chicken in a medium bowl. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, mustard, honey, vinegar, salt and peppermix well. Add to chickentoss to coat. Add remaining ingredientstoss gently to combine. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown beans in a pan with a little oil or cook them in a crockpot with a little water. Mix soup, sour cream, and picante sauce in a bowl. Sprinkle chili powder in and mix well. Spread about 2 Tablespoons in the bottom of a 13 x 9 baking dish. Add the beans. Sprinkle with cheese. Roll up tortillas and place in dish with seam sides down. Top with salsa and cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Cook hotdogs and slice onion into thin rings. Place the onion rings in the bottom of the hotdog bun. Top with the cooked hotdog. Spoon the chili sauce over the top of the hotdog and sprinkle with the cheese.

Combine the xylitol and the sweetener in a large bowlset aside. Melt the chocolate in a double-boiler over medium-low heat, or in a heatproof bowl over a pan of barely simmering wateror in the microwave. Stir occasionally until smoothcool slightly. Beat the peanut butter into the cooled chocolate mixture until thoroughly blendedadd the half-and-half, and the xylitol mixture, beating until smoothpour into an ungreased 8-inch square panrefrigerate until set. Cut into 16 pieces.

Place rice in a medium saucepan with 2-1/2 cups water. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer covered until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Drain ricetransfer to a large bowl. Stir together 1/4 cup water with vinegar, sugar, oil, and pepper. Pour over rice mixturetoss until coated. Add tomatoes and basiltoss well. Serve at room temperature. Makes 6 servings.

Cook bacon in a frying pan over medium heat for 5 minutes. Drain on paper towel and chop. Saute onion in same pan over medium heat until tender. Add garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add green beans and saute 1 minute. Add bacon, honey mustard, lemon juice and season with salt and black pepper. Toss lightly. Serve hot.

Bring spaghetti to a boil in salted water and boil 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and return to pot. Add olive oil and lime juice and zest and garlic and red chili pepper. Cook 1 minute longer. Add capers and sausage and chicken and cook 5 minutes longer or until chicken is done. Stir in spinach and feta and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer or until spinach is wilted. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Spread pizza sauce to within 1/2 inch of the edges of the crust. Top with onions and ham. Sprinkle with Tasty Cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 to 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with Parmesan Cheese. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water according to package directions. Drain pasta and return to the pot. Add the pancetta and cook until fat is rendered and pancetta is crisp. Remove the pancetta and set aside. In a separate bowl whisk together the heavy cream, the parmesan and asiago cheeses, and 1/2 cup of the monterey jack cheese. Add the pasta and the pancetta. Stir to combine. Transfer the pasta mixture to a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining monterey jack cheese and asiago cheese over the pasta. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in a preheated oven until the mac & cheese is hot and bubbly about 30 minutes. Serves 4-6.

Pulse pine nuts in a food processor until finely ground. Combine pine nut mixture with flour through lemon juice. Heat butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Dip fish in egg mixture and then in pine nut mixture. Place in skillet. Cook 4 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Yum!!!!

I'm not much of a fish eater. I'll eat some fish sticks but that's about it.

We love to fish. We usually have it for supper at least once a week.

I do not like fish.
Steam or boil beans until tender. Saute onion in butter until golden. Add beans and pickle juice. Cook until tender. Stir in dill. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, cream margarine until smooth. Blend in softened cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add flour until it forms a smooth dough. Press dough into 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes. Mix brown sugar, butter and vanilla until smooth. Spread over baked crust. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake 10 minutes more or until set. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into 2-inch squares.

Season chicken breast halves with salt and pepper. In a slow cooker combine the water, cream of chicken soup and butter. Place the seasoned chicken breast halves into the slow cooker. Cover. Cook on low for 5-6 hours. Stir in the cornbread stuffing mix. Cook an additional 15 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
Make tea according to package directions. Stir in lemonade until tea is cold. Stir in sugar and almond extract. Serve over ice.

In a bowl combine coconut, sugar, salt and eggs. Mix well. In a saucepan combine milk and rum. Stir mixture into coconut mixture. Bring to a boil over medium heat and stirring constantly. Continue cooking 5 to 10 minutes or until mixture is thick and bubbles form on the edges of the pan. Remove from heat and stir in the raisins. Allow to cool. Spoon into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Refrigerate overnight and cut into 12 bars. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 casserole dish. In medium bowl combine the cottage cheese and sour cream and mix well. In a small bowl combine the onion, garlic, worcestershire sauce, and tabasco sauce and mix well. Add the noodles to the cottage cheese mixture and stir until well coated. Spread the noodle mixture in the prepared pan. In a small bowl combine the cheddar cheese and bread crumbs and mix well. Sprinkle evenly over the noodles. Lay the salmon filets over the top of the noodles and sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top of the fish. Bake for 20 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. Serve with toasted garlic bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Season the chicken lightly. Place on baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes. In small bowl combine sour cream and mayonnaise. When the chicken has been baked 20 minutes, pour the mixture over it. Top with mushrooms and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 minutes longer.

Remove and discard any woody ends of the green beanstrim off the ends of the shallot bulbs as well. Place the green beans and shallot bulbs in a large pot and cover them with cold water by about an inch. Bring the water to a boil and cook until the green beans are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Drain the green beans and place them in a large bowl. Add the olive oil and a generous amount of kosher salt, toss well.

Place honey in a small saucepan over medium heat until the honey begins to simmer. Add ginger, garlic and red chile paste and cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in vinegar and soy sauce. Stir until well blended. Remove from heat and stir in sesame oil. Add green onions. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix together all dry ingredients in bowl. Mix yogurt in a bowl until smooth, then add eggs, oil, and vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients until just moistened. Spoon into two greased loaf pans. Bake 60-70 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of loaf comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes in pans then remove from pans to cool completely on wire racks. Drizzle with icing or sprinkle with sliced almonds before serving.
Drain tuna. Add red onion and green olives. Mix well. Spread onto one side of Italian bread. Top with provolone cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until cheese is bubbly. Enjoy.

In a bowl, stir together the 1 1/2 cups of the flour, the sugar, the baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Stir in the butter with your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in the egg and the 1/2 cup milk. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup flour and the nutmeg. Stir in the blueberries. Bake at 375 for 35 to 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 8 servings.

In olive oil, cook onions until soft. Add garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add spices and cook for 1 minute. Add roasting chickens. Add salt. Pour in broth and add carrots. Add tomato paste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and let simmer. Serve over rice.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add asparagus and cook 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook 3 to 4 minutes, or until pink and curled. Remove with a slotted spoon. In a small bowl, combine gingerroot and next 4 ingredients. Whisk. Add to the pan with the shrimp and heat through. Serve over rice. Garnish with parsley.
In a blender, combine ice cream, vodka, baileys and kahlua. Blend well. Pour into a glass. Add ice cream topping or whipped cream to the top of the glass. Garnish with chocolate sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Butter 12 muffin cups or use paper liners. Add chives to the softened butter. Cream the garlic into the softened butter. Sift together the baking mix, cheddar cheese, parsley and salt. Stir into the garlic-chive mixture. Add the buttermilk and mix until smooth. Fill the prepared cups with the batter 3/4 full. Bake until golden brown. Cool before removing from cups. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 muffins.

Mix ground beef with mayonnaise, milk, cornstarch, mustard and garlic powder in a large bowlshape into a ball and place in center of pie shellsprinkle evenly with the cheese. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, eggs and green pepperspread over top of beefsprinkle with mushrooms, green onions, olivesbake in a preheated 375 degree F. oven for 30-35 minutes or until set. Cut into wedgesserve warm.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring often until softened. Add the vegetable stock, frozen peas and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 30 minutes until the peas are tender. Melt the remaining butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the skim milk and pine nuts. Cook until the nuts are golden and the sauce is thickened. Add the frozen spinach to the cooking liquid and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 10 minutes until the spinach is tender. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls and drizzle with the sauce. Serve with a sprinkling of pine nuts and a swirl of sour cream if desired.

Combine 1/2 cup of water and 1/4 cup of flour in crockpot and stir well. Add in the milk slowly stirring as you add each cup of milk. Serve with your favorite bread or croutons.

Cut each wing into 4 pieces. In a large bowl, toss together the wings, oil, paprika, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, curry powder, lime rind and garlic. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Preheat the oven to 200C. Remove the wings from the marinade. Arrange the wings in a single layer on a baking tray. Roast for 30 minutes. Turn the wings over and roast for a further 10 minutes, or until the wings are browned and cooked through. Serve with rice or noodles and a crisp green salad.

Dissolve gelatin in hot waterstir in yogurt until smooth. Chill until thickened. Fold in raspberries. Pour into a dessert dish. Chill until set. Garnish with additional raspberries if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line with paper muffin cups. In a large bowl combine the oat bran, baking powder, and cinnamon. In a medium bowl, combine the egg whites and sugar. Add the oil and milk. Stir in the egg mixture and combine well. Fold in the raisins. Spoon into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Makes 18 muffins.

Peel and dice the potatoes into a large saucepan of cold salted water and cook over high heat until tender. While the potatoes are cooking, heat the milk and cream together in a small saucepan over medium heat with the garlic and butter, and bring to a simmer. Strain the cooking liquid from the potatoes and return them to the saucepan. Add the cream mixture and the cheeses and mash with a handheld mixer or a potato ricer. Season with scallions and salt and pepper to taste. Place the potato mixture into a casserole dish and sprinkle with the scallions and more cheese. Bake the gratin for approximately 30 minutes, or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve hot.
Au Gratin is a popular French dish that is usually served as a side dish with meat or poultry. The dish is made by baking a layer of vegetables or cheese on top of a mixture of breadcrumbs and milk or cream. The dish is then baked until the top is golden brown and the vegetables are soft.

Whisk together wine, oil, vinegar and seasonings. Pour over roast. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roast uncovered for 2 hours. Remove from oven. Brush roast with vegetable oil. Continue roasting uncovered for 1 hour or until desired doneness. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Mix shortening, sugar, egg and syrup until well blended. Stir in flour and baking powder. Form into balls. Roll in coconut. Bake in a moderate (350 degree) over until lightly browned (about 10 to 12 minutes). Cool and serve.

In large bowl, cream together the butter and chocolate until smooth and shiny. Add the vanilla and eggs and blend well. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour and salt and stir into the chocolate mixture. Mix well and fold in the nuts. Drop by teaspoonful onto wax paper and refrigerate until firm. Makes 100 bites.
Pack apples in jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Combine first 5 ingredients. Add water and lemon juice. Process in water bath canner for 35 minutes.

Put all the dry ingredients in a mortar and pound with the pestle to a fine powder. Transfer to an airtight jar and store in a cool dry place. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion in butter until soft and lightly browned. Stir in celery soup and milk. Bring to a simmer over low heat. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in swiss cheese and 2 cups sauerkraut. Bring back to simmer. Cook 2-3 minutes or until sauerkraut is heated through. Serve hot with turkey polish sausage and remaining sauerkraut sprinkled on top. Serves 8-10.

Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Saute garlic and scallops till just cooked through. Add remaining ingredients. Cook till heated through. Drain pasta and place in pan. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with Parmasean and serve.
