While egg is frying, put red onion and green bell pepper on the griddle. Add velveeta. When eggs are done, put them on the top and bottom of the tortilla. Then put the top on the griddle. Flip it after 3 minutes. Let the other side brown. Put on plate and cut into wedges. Serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease muffin cups.Sift together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and baking soda. In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar and margarinebeat until creamy. Beat in the nonfat sour cream and egg substitute. Stir in the skim milk and the sifted dry ingredients just until moistened. Fill each cup three-fourths full. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes before removing to cool completely. Yield: Makes 12 servings. Serving Size: 1 Muffin

Cut Pastrami into strips about 1/2 inch thick and place over sauerkraut in a baking dish. Sprinkle with dressing. Cover with Shredded Hash Browns and top with cheese. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares and serve with mustard or a side salad.

In a large bowl beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the sugar and beat until smooth. Add the peanut butter and beat until smooth. Fold in the cool whip. Pour into the pie crust. Top with chopped peanut butter cups. Refrigerate. Cut into wedges. Serve cold.

In a small bowl mix soy sauce, cumin, brown sugar and cayenne. Lay tuna on a plate and top with the mixture. Put the plate under the broiler until the tuna is cooked. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and scallion.

Prepare english peas according to directions on package. Chop onion. Drain pimiento. In large bowl, combine all ingredients except paprika. Mix well. Sprinkle with paprika. Chill. Serve over lettuce. Makes 6 servings.

Beat eggs in bowl until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Cook over medium-low heat until mixture thickens. Add milk and coco lopez. Cook until mixture thickens. Add cinnamon sticks and white rum. Beat until frothy. Transfer to bottles. Store in refrigerator.

Boil 3 cups of water in medium saucepan. Add salt to water and boil the cauliflower for 8 minutes. Drain and rinse the cauliflower in cold water. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter until foamy. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes while stirring constantly with a wire whisk to make a roux. Stir in the milk and bring to a boil while stirring constantly. Add the sour cream and continue to stir for 1 minute until mixture is smooth and thickened. Stir in the cauliflower and black pepper to taste. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle the top with the cheddar cheese and bake for 30 minutes until golden brown on top. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all filling ingredients in an 8x8 dish. Mix all topping ingredients in another bowl. Pour topping over fruit filling. Bake 45 minutes. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until softened, about 4 minutes. Add ginger and saute 1 minute more. Add zucchini and saute 2 to 3 minutes more until crisp-tender. Add chicken stock, orange juice, orange zest and orange juice concentrate, if using. Bring to boil, reduce heat. Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in yogurtseason to taste with salt and white pepper. Refrigerate several hours or overnight before serving.

In a small saucepan over medium low heat, melt baking chips with condensed milk. Stir until smooth and remove from heat. Stir in peppermint. Drop in red food coloring and stir. Spread into a wax paper lined 8x8 pan and sprinkle with crushed candy canes. Chill.

Spread mustard on the bottom half of the bun. Layer greens and Fuji apple slices. Top with brie cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the second half of the bun. Wrap in parchment paper and refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove from parchment paper. Cut into wedges and serve.

Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil and season with black pepper and sea salt. Wrap in aluminium foil and bake in the oven for 1 hour at 180 degrees celsius. Slice the chicken breasts into thin strips. Heat olive oil in a pan and fry the chicken strips until cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Heat another pan with olive oil and saute the onion for a couple of minutes until soft. Add the chicken and fry for a minute or so. Add the garlic and dried rosemary and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add the sweet potatoes and stir-fry for a further 3 minutes. Add the lemon juice and season with black pepper and sea salt. Serve immediately.

Place cauliflower in a large saucepan. Add 3 cups water. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain cauliflower and transfer to a large bowl. Add 2 cups milk and 1/4 teaspoon saltmash until smooth. Stir in shallot, curry powder, heavy cream, ground pepper, and butter. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in skillet. Cook onions and pepper over low heat until softened, about 10 minutes. Add ground beefcook and stir until no longer pink. Drain fat. Add remaining ingredients except bunscook and stir 5 minutes. Top each bun half with 2/3 of the beef mixturetop with bun half. Makes 6 servings.
Mix together first 7 ingredients. Form into patties. Brown in skillet with oil. Drain. Pour tomato sauce over patties. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve over toast.

Drain tuna and flake it. Add cereal and stir. Add egg substitute and green onions. Mix thoroughly. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Form into patties and place on a cookie sheet. Dip patties into dijonnaise and bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Melt butter and lemon juice. Dip patties in butter and lemon juice mixture and bake for 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

In a medium pot, cook onions and garlic for 2 minutes. Add rice. Stir for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir often. Remove from heat. Stir in corn and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper. Allow to sit for 2 minutes.

Boil the potatoes in their skins until cooked - about 30 minutes. What you are aiming for in this recipe is starchy mashed potato. As soon as the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel them and either mash them or put them through a potato ricer. Peel the garlic cloves and pound them in a pestle with the lemon juice or use a hand-blender for this step. Mix the potato, garlic and ground almonds together thoroughly in a bowl, and then beat in the olive oil gradually with a wooden spoon. Beat in the whole egg and season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut the ends off of the zucchini. With a small knife, hollow out the center and save for filling. Slice the zucchini into rounds 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. Mix together the cottage cheese and the corn. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Divide the cottage cheese mixture evenly among the zucchini rounds. Roll up the zucchini rounds and place in a buttered casserole dish. Sprinkle the top with the chopped green onions. Bake 20 minutes until the tops are brown and bubbly. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet fry potatoes in oil until almost tender. Sprinkle with salt. Spread potatoes in a single layer in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake until potatoes are done, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with green onion tops and bacon bits. Return to oven until bacon is crisp. Serve with sour cream.

Heat oil in a saucepan and saute the shallots until softened. Then add the ginger and saute for 1-2 minutes. Next add the sweet potato and carrots and saute for 1-2 more minutes. Then add the broth and the curry powder and cook over medium heat for 20-30 minutes or until the veggies are very soft and tender. Turn off heat and blend with a hand held blender until smooth and season with more curry if you like or with some fresh lime juice and cilantro. Serve with some warm bread of your choice.

Wash and stem berries. Mix with lemon juice and rind of lemon and cinnamon stick. Simmer 15 minutes. Strain and measure liquid. Measure 1 cup of liquid for every 1 cup of sugar and bring to boiling point and boil 5 minutes. Skim foam. Pour into sterilized glasses and seal.

Rinse and trim broccoli. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add broccoli. Cook for about 6 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from water and drain. Meanwhile, in a large bowl mix together shallots, garlic, oil, mustard, and vinegar. Add cooked broccoli. Toss well. Serve warm or cold.

Cut open the chipotle peppers and scrape out the seeds and pulp with a spoon. Place the peppers and the adobo sauce into a blender or food processor with the mayonnaise, sour cream, and cream cheese. Blend until smooth. Stir in the lime juice and season with salt to taste. Add the green onions if desired. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large skillet brown the chicken breast in butter. Place the chicken in a crock pot. In a small bowl combine the rest of the ingredients. Pour over the chicken. Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 8.
Wash and dry all vegetables. Cut up all vegetables. Wash iceberg lettuce. Tear up lettuce. Put all vegetables in a bowl. Pour dressing over vegetables. Chill before serving.

Place 1 slice of cream cheese in center of one slice of bread, spreading out to edges. Top with 1 slice of pickle. Place 2 slices of ham on top, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon mustard over top of ham. Top with 1 slice swiss cheese. Cover with other slice of bread. Heat in panini maker or skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides and cheese is melted.

Mix pudding with milk according to directions on box. Chill until set. Fold in whipped topping and fruit. Serve immediately or chill until serving time.
 chocolate cranberry shakeingredients: cranberries, fresh or frozen banana, fat-free vanilla frozen yogurt, chocolate saucepreparation:Place 1/4 cup cranberries and the frozen banana into a blender container and process until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of yogurt and process until smooth. Divide into 2 glasses and top each with 2 tablespoons of chocolate sauce. Serve immediately.

In a large pot saute the garlic in the oil until fragrant. Add the bay leaves and sage and let cook for 2 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add the broth, bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Add the egg yolks and the cumin. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Ladle the soup into 4 bowls and place a slice of Gruyere cheese in each bowl. Bake the cheese until melted. Sprinkle with sage.

Mix cranberry sauce with ketchup. Add brown sugar, broth, and a little water. Bring to a boil. Pour over meatballs in a crockpot. Cook on low for 1 hour. Serve with rolls.
These are easy and delicious. I always get compliments when I serve them.
Mix together all ingredients except for the meat. Form into balls. Brown the balls in a large skillet. Remove the browned balls and put them into a crockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the crockpot. Cook on low for 8 hours.
I have made these for years. Everyone loves them.
These are delicious! You can use the left over gravy to pour over rice.
Great taste. I put them in the crockpot.
Delicious! I use the leftover sauce to pour over rice.
A great tasting meal in just 20 minutes!
I have made these several times. The kids love them.
I made this for my family, they loved it.
This recipe is a great one for the crockpot.

Cook orzo according to package directions. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add red pepper flakes. Stirring constantly, add spinach. Add balsamic vinegar. Stir until spinach is wilted. In a small bowl, beat cream and egg. Stir cream mixture into spinach. Stir in cooked orzo. Add cheese. Toss until cheese melts.

Combine sugar and egg, add vanilla and beat well. Add milk and beat again. Add flour and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake at 375F for 1 hour. Makes 1 pie (9 inch).
In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients. Divide into four portions and shape into patties. Brown in a skillet or oven. Serve over rice.
Place green beans and olives in a large mixing bowl. Stir together vinegar and butterpour over beans. Cover and chill. Sprinkle with dill and pimiento before serving. Serve at room temperature.

In a large pot, saut onions and mushrooms in olive oil. Add carrots, potatoes, black beans, tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-30 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with low-fat sour cream.

Slice ice cream sandwiches into 1-inch strips. Fold ice cream into Cool Whip. Spoon mixture onto waxed paper-lined trays. Sprinkle with toffee bitsdrizzle with caramel topping. Store in freezer until firm.

Tear pineapple into bite-sized pieces. Sprinkle with seasoning. Arrange pineapple and shrimp in a single layer in the center of a square of foil. Add bell pepper and top with butter and brown sugar. Fold foil edges up and over top of mixture to form a packet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until pineapple is tender and shrimp is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Put all but the vegetables in a pan over high heat and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute then turn off the heat. Add vegetables and let them sit in the brine for at least 24 hours in the fridge (or 48 hours at room temperature). Serve within a week or store in the fridge for up to 3 months.

Mix butter with flour, vinegar and cold water. Wrap in plastic wrap and freeze. Beat egg yolks with marmalade and lemon juice. Add to dough. Roll into small balls and place on non-stick baking tray. Bake at 175C for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter 2 8x8x2-inch pans. Line the bottoms with waxed paperthis will make it easier to remove the cakes from the pans. Combine sugar and butter in a saucepan. Stir over medium heat until the mixture boils. Remove from heat. Beat in the eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the boiling mixture and blend well. Spoon batter into pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. When the edges are lightly browned, turn out onto wire racks. Cool thoroughly. Peel off the waxed paper. Spread with frosting. Makes two 8x8x2-inch pans.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Mix the peanut butter into the honey with a spatula until smooth. Add the brown sugar. Pour the mixture over the dry ingredients and mix thoroughly. Pour the mixture into a lightly-buttered 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until the mixture has hardened. Let cool. Cut into squares.

Peel daikon and carrot and slice into matchsticks. Place in a large mixing bowl. Combine water and salt in a small pot and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, pour the hot brine over the vegetables. Let stand for 30 minutes. Drain well and place into clean jars or plastic bags with 1 teaspoon sugar. Pour in enough white wine vinegar to cover vegetables. Seal jars and store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan or two 8-ounce ramekins. In a bowl combine bananas and eggsadd butter, beating well. Combine sour cream, sugar, flour, baking powder, and baking sodaadd to banana mixture. Fold in vanilla and pecans. Pour into pan. Bake 1 hour for a loaf or 50-60 minutes for ramekins. Cool slightly on a wire rack before serving.

Season the fish generously on both sides with salt and pepper. In a small bowl mix the wasabi powder and soy sauce until smooth. In another bowl mix the sesame oil and the peanut oil together. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat and add the fish. Cook the fish until brown on both sides. Remove the fish from the pan and pour the soy sauce mixture into the pan. Heat the sauce until bubbly. Add the fish to the pan. Spoon the sauce over the fish and garnish with green onion and a lime wedge. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook sugar and water until bubbles form at the edges of the pan. Stir in the food coloring. Carefully pour over the nuts in the skillet. Cook until the mixture is bubbling and sugar is a deep amber color. Cool for 1 minute then stir until the nuts are coated. Spread the nuts in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and let cool. Store in airtight container.

Spritz a muffin tin with cooking spray. Combine ginger and curry powder. Add the onion and toss. Place a few shrimps in each mold. Top with cilantro and cracked black pepper. Bake 10 minutes. Serve with salad greens and a slice of bell pepper.
 chicken casseroleingredients: chicken breasts, tomato sauce, onion, celery, carrots, mushrooms, chicken broth, chicken bouillon, rice, parsley, salt & pepperpreparation:Preheat oven to 350°F. In a 13x9x2-inch baking dish, combine chicken breast with tomato sauce, onion, celery, carrots, mushrooms, chicken broth, bouillon cubes, rice and parsley. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake 25 to 35 minutes. Remove foil and cook another 5 to 10 minutes. Serve.

With an electric mixer cream the butter and splenda together. Blend in cream cheese and beat well. Fold in the vanilla extract with a spatula. Use immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Makes approximately 2 cups of frosting.

Brown beef in pan and add taco seasoning. Drain fat and add diced green chilies. Add cream of chicken soup and simmer until thick. Stir in salsa. Mix together flour tortillas and sour cream and spread in greased 9x13 baking dish. Spread cooked meat and chili mixture over tortillas. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until hot. Serve with salsa.

In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and powdered sugar. Add the egg yolks and almond and lemon extracts. Sift in the flour and mix well. Chill dough in the refrigerator for 2 hours. In a small saucepan over low heat, stir together the water and corn syrup. Add the lemon juice and glace cherries. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Stir in the gelatin. Set aside and let cool. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut into 1 1/4 inch circles. Place a spoonful of the cherry filling in the center of each circle. Fold in half and press edges together. Pinch the edges together to form a ball. Place balls on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. In a small saucepan over low heat, stir together the water and corn syrup. Add the lemon juice and glace cherries. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Stir in the gelatin. Set aside and let cool.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Combine the butter with the maple sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and walnutsstir into the butter mixture. Fold in the carrots, coconut, and yogurt until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 to 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for about 1 hour.
i am looking for a good recipe for chocolate chip cookies that doesnt call for softened butter?
i dont have that in my house right now!
i will be making cookies tomorrow to take to a potluck at church... i need a good chocolate chip cookie recipe that uses butter or margarine or whatever the heck else i can use instead of softened butter... i dont have that

Mix together basil and eggs. Add water and milk. Blend well and set aside. Heat margarine in skillet. Saute mushrooms and set aside. Combine egg mixture with mushrooms. Place mixture in a 9 inch pie shell. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
I want a recipe for a basic quiche that I can modify depending upon what I have in the house.
I'm going to be making a vegan quiche for a potluck. I'd like to try a quinoa base.
Can anyone suggest a vegan recipe for a quiche that doesn't taste like cardboard?
I'm going to be making a vegan quiche for a potluck. I'd like to try a quinoa base. Can anyone suggest a vegan recipe for a quiche that doesn't taste like cardboard?
I am trying to find a recipe for a "quinoa" quiche that doesn't taste like cardboard. I know some people are allergic to gluten or want to cut back on wheat

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients except chicken in a bowl. Add chicken to bowl, toss to coat. Bake on a baking sheet for 45 minutes. Serve hot or at room temp. Serve over rice or pasta.
Combine all ingredients except chicken in a bowl. Add chicken to bowl, toss to coat. Bake on a baking sheet for 45 minutes. Serve hot or at room temp. Serve over rice or pasta.

Core & halve the apples. Put the raisins in the center of the halves. Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the ginger, sugar & molasses. Bring the mixture to a boil. Pour into the halves & bake in a 350f oven for 1 hour. Add the orange juice & lemon juice. Cook for another hour. Serve warm.

Slice kiwi thinly and cut into small pieces. Combine water, lemon pepper, and fajita seasoning mix in a large bowl or zip-top baggie. Add steak slices and kiwi pieces. Gently massage meat to coat. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Grill on medium high heat until done to your preference (about 10-15 minutes).

Preheat oven to 350F. In a large saucepan, combine squash, butter and brown sugar. Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until squash is tender when pierced with a fork. Cool slightly. In a small bowl combine squash and applesauce and mash with a potato masher. In a large mixing bowl combine squash mixture and eggs, beating until blended. Add cream of tartar and beat until foamy. Spoon mixture into a buttered 9 by 13 inch baking dish and bake for one hour or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool slightly before serving. Serves six to eight.
What about a pumpkin/squash pie?

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil. Cook the pasta until al dentedrain well, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the pancettacook until crispy, about 8 minutes. Add the pasta, 1/2 cup reserved cooking liquid and the egg yolkscook, stirring occasionally until the sauce thickens slightly, 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cheesetoss well. Serve immediately.
Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss the bananas with butter, brown sugar and rum. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender and caramelized. Serve with vanilla ice cream and rum sauce.

Cream butter and sugar. Mix together flour and rice flour and add to creamed mixture. Shape into 2" balls and roll in shredded coconut and chill.
I have not made these in years, but I am making them again this year for my children. They are easy to make and the taste is great!!!!
I made these today for my class at the high school and they loved them!

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Layer the bottom of the pan with one layer of the tortilla chips. Spoon half the meat mixture over the chips. Sprinkle with half the cheddar cheese. Repeat layers with remaining meat mixture and cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with the shredded lettuce and diced tomatoes. In a small bowl, combine the salsa and green onions. Spoon over the top of the dip. Sprinkle with the green chilies. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with the sour cream.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large saucepanbring to a boil. Add chicken and turn to coatcover and simmer for 30 minutes. Uncover and cook until no longer pinkstir occasionally. Sprinkle with green onions to serve.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add the onion and pepper and saute for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the garlic and cook for another 30 seconds. Add the sirloin and cook until it is no longer pink. Add the sauce, broth and paste. Stir in the sugar and cook for another minute. Add the beans and cook for 4-5 minutes. Serve over hot spaghetti and sprinkle the top with cheese and sour cream.

Put frozen orange juice concentrate in small saucepan and add water and pepper. Heat and stir until thawed. Remove from heat and add dried basil. Let cool. Strain through sieve and chill. Add olive oil and garlic to saucepan and heat gently until garlic is fragrant. Add to the basil juice and stir. Cover and chill. Store in refrigerator for up to 1 month. Shake before using.

Steam the cauliflower until just barely crisp-tender. Set aside. In a small saucepan, saute garlic in olive oil until garlic is lightly browned. Add the paprika& stir well. Add the cauliflower to the pan& toss to coat with the paprika& garlic. Season with the salt& pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring vinegar to a boil. Add mustard seeds, celery seeds and bay leaf. Let cool to room temperature. Season pork with kosher salt and pepper. Add to vinegar mixture. Bring to a boil and then lower heat. Let simmer until meat is fork tender. Strain and chill. Serve as a sandwich topping or with crackers.

Sauté the onion in the oil over medium heat until it is very soft and golden brown. Add the lamb and cook until it is no longer pink and browned throughout. Drain the fat from the pan and return the meat to it. Add the mashed potatoes, eggs, parsley, salt and pepper to taste and garlic powder. Mix well and fill 4 pie shells evenly. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 45 minutes or until cooked through.

Sift flour into a large bowl and add cayenne pepper and butter. Rub in until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add cheeses and toss lightly to coat with flour. Stir in spring onion and parsley and season with salt and pepper. Make a well in the centre of the flour and add the egg and milk and stir well to mix to a soft dough. Knead for 5-10 minutes until smooth and elastic and place on a floured board. Roll out to 1/2cm thick and cut into triangles with a floured pastry cutter. Brush lightly with milk and sprinkle with sesame seeds and bake in a preheated oven at 190C/Gas 5 for 10 minutes until lightly browned and crisp. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Serve warm with any soup, chilli or dip of your choice.

In a saucepan bring the broth to a boil. Stir in the grits and cook over low heat. Stir in the milk and season with the salt and white pepper. Continue cooking over low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the butter and cheese. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Brown venison in a frying pan with butter. When browned, add mushrooms and stirfry a few minutes. Add cooking sherry, water, soup mix, garlic salt, curry powder and bouillon cube. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over hot cooked egg noodles. Sprinkle with parsley. Garnish with fresh mushrooms. Serves 4 to 6. High altitude no changes.

In 10-inch skillet, heat butter over medium heat until sizzling. Add garlic and parsleycook 1 minute or until tender. Stir in garlic powdercook 30 seconds longer. Dip each chicken breast into egg mixturecoat with bread crumb mixture. Place in skilletcook 1-1/2 to 2 minutes on each side or until chicken is no longer pink. Place 2 breaded chicken pieces on each of 4 dinner plates. Top each serving with 1/4 cup sauce. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until heated through and cheeses are melted. Makes 4 servings (serving size: about 1/2 chicken breast and about 1/4 cup sauce).
Brown beef. Drain grease. Add onions and cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for one hour. Serve in bowls. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Peel and chop the cucumbers into small pieces. Stir together with sugar, lime juice, and water in a blender until smooth. Add ice to glassespour in the mixture and serve immediately.
name: CUCUMBER LIME AGUA FRESCA
In a blender, combine cucumbers, lime juice, sugar, salt and 4 cups of cold water. Blend until smooth. Pour mixture into a mesh strainer placed over a pitcher, pressing pulp to release as much liquid as possible. Discard pulp. Add enough ice to fill pitcher. Garnish glasses with cucumber slices and lime wedges.
name: MANGO AGUA FRESCA
1 cup peeled, diced mango
In a blender, combine mango and water and blend until smooth. Pour through a strainer into ice-filled glasses. You should end up with about 1 cup of liquid. Stir in lime juice and agave. Garnish with lime and mint, and serve.
name: AGUA FRESCA DE PAPAYA
Pap
Dip lamb chops in eggs, then roll in breadcrumbs. Heat oil in skillet over high heat. Fry lamb chops until golden brown on both sides. Serve with your favorite pasta.

Slice french bread in half lengthwise. Butter the insides of the bread. Break an egg in the center of each piece of bread and sprinkle with salt. Place the sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny (about 15 minutes). Top with cheddar cheese & tabasco sauce.

Squeeze the garlic cloves from their skins then chop finely. Place in a bowl then add the chopped dill, the yogurt, a good grind of pepper and some salt. Chop the cucumber finely then add to the bowl along with 1 teaspoon of olive oil and a good grind of pepper. Mix well and chill until needed. For the salmon heat the olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat then place the fish in the pan, season then cook for 3-5 minutes on each side. The fish is done when it flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with the yoghurt dressing.
Cucumbers are one of nature's best low-calorie foods because they are more than 90% water! This cool crisp salad will help you reach your weight-loss goals while satisfying your appetite.
Place all the ingredients in a medium bowl. Toss well to combine and serve chilled or at room temperature.
Per serving (excluding optional): 19 calories, 1 g protein, 3

Soak the idli rava for 15 minutes. Drain and grind to a coarse batter in mixer grinder. Mix pistachios and roasted cashew nuts in the batter. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in pan and fry carrot and green bell pepper in it until golden brown and keep aside. Take 2 idli moulds and place one at a time on a tray and pour in 3 tablespoons of batter in each mould. Arrange carrot and green bell pepper in each mould and stuff it. Pour in 1/2 tablespoon of batter in each mould and cover it with a plate and steam it for 2 minutes or until the batter is set. Serve hot garnished with red bell pepper strips and coriander.

Cook spaghetti as directed. Drain & rinse with cold water. In a small bowl whisk together honey and soy sauce. In a small bowl mix together the vegetable oil and sesame oil. Mix together the honey mixture & sesame/vegetable oil mixture. Pour over the pasta & stir. Sprinkle with the coriander. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Garnish with the sliced green onion & the peanuts.
Mix together the cabbages, onions, and bean sprouts. In another bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the vegetables and toss to coat. Serve chilled.

In a large bowl, blend together the butter, flour, powdered sugar & rind. Press into a 9 x 13-inch pan & bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees F or until lightly browned. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining ingredients except for the chocolate chips. When the crust is done, pour the filling over it & return to the oven for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips if desired. Refrigerate for several hours. Cut into squares. Makes 16 servings.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan on low heat. Add the onion and pepper and cook for a couple of minutes until softened. Add the meat to the pan and break up with a wooden spoon. Cook until the meat is browned all over. Stir in the salt and cayenne pepper to taste. Pour in the beer. Stir until the liquid has evaporated. Sprinkle on the cheese. Cook for a further few minutes until the cheese has melted and the rarebit has thickened slightly. Serve on top of an English muffin.

In a saucepan, combine soup, sherry, peas and water chestnuts. Heat until very hot. In a greased baking dish, layer half the soup mixture, then layer half the stuffing mix. Repeat layers. Crumble bacon on top. Bake at 350 degrees F for one hour or until heated through. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Preheat grill. Combine all ingredients except beef in a bowl. Add beef and turn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator 3 to 4 hours. Turn over once while marinating. Remove meat from marinade and discard marinade. Grill beef 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium-rare doneness. Cut across the grain into thin strips. Serve with sliced tomatoes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Mix the mustard and garlic. Place the pork in a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish. Cover the tenderloin with the mustard mixture and sprinkle with the rosemary, pepper, and ginger. Bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile in a small saucepan, heat the marmalade over low heat for 2 minutes. Add the stock and soy sauce. Cook for 10 more minutes. Add the cornstarch to the sauce and stir. Stir in the juice of 1 orange. Spoon the marmalade over the roasted pork. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot and saute until softened. Add the brandy and flame to burn off the alcohol. Add the broth. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add the tarragon. Whisk in the heavy cream. Add the dijon. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve the sauce over the chicken breasts.

Beat together first five ingredients until well blended. Add dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Drop by spoonfuls about 2 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 12-14 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen.

Blend 2 mangoes until smooth. Add coconut extract and lemon juice. Blend until smooth again. In a saucepan combine skim milk, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Cook over low heat until thickened (about 10 minutes). Add blended mango mixture to the saucepan and cook until mixture thickens (about 10 minutes). Serve warm over a sponge cake. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the first 6 ingredients and rub all over the meat. Brown in hot olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 2 to 3 hours, or until the meat is very tender. Remove and keep warm. Stir the flour and water together to form a paste and stir this paste into the gravy. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened and smooth. Serve the meat with the gravy spooned over it.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix together eggs and water. Add flour and stir till just moistened. Add sugar and salt. Stir in nuts. Add rosemary. Grease 2 8-inch round cake pans or 8-inch square cake pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool completely. Serve.

Cut chicken into bite sized pieces. In a medium bowl, combine the soup, green onion, sour cream, milk, salt, pepper, and ham. Spread 1/2 cup of this mixture over the bottom of a greased 1-1/2 quart casserole dish. Layer 1/2 the rice over this mixture. Top with 1/2 the remaining mixture. Repeat this layering once more. Top with 1/2 cup cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle the top with parsley. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Boil the egg and cut into half. Heat oil in a pan. Add the sliced onion, red chilies and fry till the onions are brown. Strain water from tamarind pulp and add to the pan. Boil the water with the maggi seasoning. Pour the water into the onion mixture. Put the egg pieces into the pan and cover with lid. Cook on low flame for 45 minutes. Sprinkle the rice on top and serve hot.

In a small bowl, combine yeast, flour and salt, pepper and yeast in a small bowl. Stir in beer and water. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Add Parmesan cheese and basil, stirring until well blended. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Turn onto a floured boardknead until smooth and elastic, 5-10 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, 1-2 hours. Punch down. Turn onto a floured boardshape into a ball. Place in a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake for 1 hour, or until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped. Remove from pan to cool on a wire rack.
I have a few recipes using basil which I will try to post soon. I love the herb and will always make sure to have it on hand in my garden and in
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Sift together the flour, brown sugar, baking powder and nutmeg. In a separate bowl combine the banana and honey. Add to the dry mixture and mix well. Pour into a greased 8 x 4 x 2 inch pan. Bake for 40 minutes at 325 degrees. Cool before cutting.

In a large bowl combine the paprika, sea salt, pepper and garlic powder. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Place the chicken on the grill and cook for 5 minutes per side. Brush the barbecue sauce on the chicken and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Baste the chicken with the tomato sauce and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Baste the chicken with the orange juice and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Baste the chicken with the soy sauce and cook until it is done. Serve hot.

Toss together the spinach, kiwi, carrots and onion. Sprinkle almonds over the salad. Drizzle dressing over the salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.
I don’t know how many of you have tried it but I found out the other day that I’m addicted to spinach. It’s so good for you and so easy to add to almost any meal. I’m sure I will be trying some of these recipes soon.

Boil florets for 3 minutes or until just tender. Mix beaten egg, milk, onion, mayonnaise, cheese, mushroom soup, salt and pepper. Lightly fold in florets into this mixture. Pour into a greased 3 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle crushed crackers on top and drizzle with melted butter. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Careful not to overbrown cracker crumbs.

Heat olive oil or butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Saute broccoli, bell pepper, spinach and onion until tender. Beat eggs with bacon, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Pour over vegetables. Cook until mixture is set. Cut into wedges. Serve hot.
Name: Onion Frittata Ingredients: Butter, Onions, Eggs, Garlic Cloves, Salt & Freshly Ground Black Pepper, Chili Preparation: Put The Butter, Garlic, Diced Chili And Onions In A Frying Pan And Fry Gently Until The Onions Are A Nice Golden Brown. Beat The Six Eggs Well With The Salt And Pepper. Scoop The Onions Out Of The Pan And Mix With The Eggs. Melt The Extra Butter In The Pan And Pour In The Egg Mixture. Cook On Both Sides Until Browned Slice In Wedges And Serve Hot. Name: Rice Fritta Ingredients: Rice, Eggs, Swiss Chard, Onion, Parsley, Rosemary

In a bowl, beat the eggs and flax seeds with a fork until well-blended. In a separate bowl, combine the wheat germ and banana with the milk and strawberriesstir. Pour the fruit mixture into the eggs and beat until smoothstir in the honey. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in microwave oven and pour over blue cheese in a medium bowl. Stir until well blended and smooth. Add Tabasco Sauce and onion and stir well. Refrigerate 15 minutes or until firm enough to shape into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in almonds and store in refrigerator. Serve with crackers or celery sticks.

Place popped corn in a large bowl. Add nuts and dried apples. In a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, vanilla extract, butter, cinnamon and nutmeg. Cook over low heat until melted. Stir in pecans and dried apples. Spread over popcorn. Store in an airtight container.

In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the leeks and cook for 3 minutes. Add the broth, salt, pepper and lemon juice to taste and continue to simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Transfer the leeks to a bowl, keeping the liquid for later. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Heat the butter with the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken to the pan, browning well on all sides, about 5 minutes per side. Pour in the reserved leek liquid, cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid or foil and cook over low heat for 12 to 15 minutes per side or until the chicken is no longer pink. Serve with the leeks on the side or mixed into the chicken and drizzled with lemon juice if desired.
Combine water and hot sauce. Boil shrimp for 2 minutes. Drain and add ketchup and hot sauce. Serve over lettuce with sweet onion and cilantro.

Combine wine vinegar and soy sauce in a large bowl. Add the chicken and stir. Cover and let stand in refrigerator for 30 minutes. In another bowl combine the mayonnaise, ginger, pepper and onion. Drain chicken from liquid. Add to bowl with mayonnaise mixture. Stir in sour cream. Add salt to taste. Chill. Just before serving sprinkle with pecans and chives. Serves 8-10.
name: mashed potato casseroleingredients: russet potatoes, butter, milk, salt & fresh ground pepper, parmesan cheesepreparation:Cook potatoes in boiling water until tenderdrain and return to panadd butter, milk and salt and pepper. Mash potatoes with potato masher or electric mixer. Stir in parmesan cheese. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.
name: potatoes au gratin

Drain okrarinse well under cold running water. Dice okra and set aside. Peel, core and dice the sweet onionset aside. Peel and dice the tomatoset aside. Squeeze lemon juice over vegetablestoss to coat. Stir in hot sauce to taste. Serve immediately.

Heat oven 180c. Grease 2 pans 19cm x 29cm. Line trays with baking paper. Combine butter, sugar and vanilla in large bowl. Add egg and beat till light and fluffy. Sift dry ingredients into bowl and beat well. Divide mix into 3 equal portions. Press 1 portion over base of one tray. Repeat with 2nd portion over base of 2nd tray. Heat jam and spread over the 2 bases. Crumble remaining mix over jam in both trays. Bake 30 minutes or till browned, cool in pans.

In a medium bowl combine flour, powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons Splenda. Mix with a fork until crumbly. Reserve 1 cup for the topping. In a large bowl combine the remaining Splenda, butter and 1 cup flour. Cream with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in egg whites and vanilla and mix thoroughly. Spread into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 375° for 10 minutes and reduce heat to 350° and continue to bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until just set. In a small bowl combine rhubarb, 1/3 cup Splenda and 1/3 cup flour. Mix thoroughly and spread over hot crust. Sprinkle with the reserved crumbs and return to oven for 5 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Cool on a rack and cut into bars. Makes 16 servings. On Splenda Granular. Splenda is a low calorie sweetener that is used as a substitute for regular sugar. It is available at most groc

In saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add flour and stir until mixture is smooth. Add ale and bring to boil. Add cheese a little at a time. Stir until smooth. Add mustard, worcestershire, tabasco and parsley. Serve over english muffins. Top with bacon.

Place pork shoulder in crock pot. In small bowl combine remaining ingredients except bok choy. Pour over pork. Cook 6-8 hours on low. Remove and shred. Heat 1 cup water in skillet over high heat until boiling. Add bok choy and cook 30 seconds. Serve over pork.

In bowl of a food processor, combine flour, oatmeal and nutmeg. Add butter and process until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Reserve one-fourth of crumbs for topping. In a separate bowl, combine raspberries and cornstarch and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine brown sugar and granulated sugar. Add peaches and cook until tender and sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in raspberries and vanilla extract. Transfer to 8-inch square baking dish or individual baking dishes. Top with crumbs and serve with ice cream.
Combine all of the ingredients in a 2-quart saucepan and simmer for about 20 minutes until the cranberries are tender. Cool completely. Add the nuts and chill. Yields about 4 cups.

Combine broth with lime juice, mint, basil, gingerroot, jalapeno, and soy sauce in small bowl. Prepare grill. Cut squash in half lengthwiseremove seeds with spoon. Brush each half with broth mixture. Place squash, cut side down, on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Cover grillcook 6 minutes. Turn and brush with remaining broth mixture. Grill 6 minutes more or until tender. Serve with lime wedges.

Mix together seasoning. Place in large resealable bag. Add pork chops. Close bag. Shake to coat. Heat olive oil in skillet. Cook pork chops until done. Remove to plate. Add pineapple rings. Pour teriyaki sauce over. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt.In a medium bowl, cream the butter with the cream until light and fluffy. Beat in the flour mixture, the egg and vanilla extract until well combined.Divide the dough in half and roll into a long log, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Wrap each log in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour.Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.Slice the log into 1/2 inch thick rounds.Fry in the hot oil until golden brown and cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes per side.Transfer to paper towels to drain.Sprinkle with the powdered sugar while warm.Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.

Boil potatoes until tender. Mash. Stir in eggs, cracker meal, onion, salt, and dill. Let stand for about 30 minutes. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Form potato mixture into pancakes in pan. Fry pancakes about 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Serves 4-6.

In a 5 quart crockpot, combine all ingredients except the chicken and stir well. Place chicken in the crockpot. Cover and cook on high for 5 hours or low for 7 hours. Cook until potatoes are tender. Serve over white rice. Makes 4 main dish servings.

Combine first four ingredients in a small bowl. Mix in the poppy seeds and crumbs. Roll up the chicken breasts in the mixture and place them in a greased baking dish. Dot with butter and bake at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes. Serve over cooked rice.

Combine fruit cocktail, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and butter. Cook on stove until thickened. Spread into pie crust. Let cool. Add top crust. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove from oven and let cool. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with butter.In a large pot over high heat, bring the milk to a simmer. Stir in the rice. Cover the pot and cook for 40 minutes over low heat, stirring occasionally until the rice is tender. Stir in the butter until melted and the mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.In a large bowl, combine the eggs, sugar, almonds, cinnamon and salt. Pour over the cooled rice mixture and stir until evenly combined.Pour into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until the top is golden brown and the pudding has set up.Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.Serve hot or cold with whipped cream if desired.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar and corn syrup. Bring to a boil over high heat. Stirring frequently, boil to 260 degrees f on a candy thermometer without stirring. Stirring constantly add the macadamia nuts and bring to a boil again to 260 degrees f. Remove from heat. Stir in the vanilla and the coconut. Spread the mixture on a greased cookie sheet and let cool. Break into pieces. Store in airtight container.

Place roast in crockpot. Add water. Cover. Cook for 12-14 hours at 180 degrees. Remove roast and reserve liquid. Chop meat into bite sized pieces. Add liquid to meat and add liquid smoke to taste. Serve.

Dissolve yeast and 1/4 cup milk in a small bowl. Stir together 2 cups of flour and salt. Combine with milk mixture and add 2 cups milk. Stir until smooth. Add currants and enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. Knead until smooth and elastic. Let stand for 10 minutes. Divide dough into 16 pieces. Shape each piece into an oblong and place on greased baking sheets. Cover and let rise until doubled in volume. Heat oil in a deep pan to 375 degrees F. Fry doughnuts until golden on both sides. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Roll doughnuts in confectioners' sugar while still warm. Serve warm or cold.

Rinse the rice and set aside. Cut the onion into 1/2-inch dice. Cut the bell peppers into strips. Prepare the dressing by whisking together the vinegar and oil. Add the chili powder, cilantro and onion. Mix well. Cook the rice in water and chicken broth. Add the beans and corn. Drain the liquid off. Add the onions. Toss the dressing with the rice mixture. Sprinkle on the chili powder and cilantro. Add the bell peppers. Serve at once. You may substitute cooked chicken or turkey for the beans.

Saute the rice, the bell pepper, the asparagus and the carrot in 1/4 cup olive oil. Add the minced garlic clove and salt & pepper. Add the soy sauce and the tabasco sauce to taste. Stir and add the rice mixture to the shrimp. Cook for 3-4 minutes. Serve immediately over rice.
Place meat in slow cooker. Mix together other ingredients. Pour over meat. Cook for 5 hours on high. Serve on sandwich buns.
Prepare tea. Strain and chill. Combine tea with remaining ingredients. Serve over crushed ice in tall glasses. Garnish with berries.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook favas until just tender. Drain and rinse well under cold running water. Drain again. In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender. Add garlic and cook until lightly brown. Add favas and tomato sauce. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
Cook rice as directed but do not add butter or salt. Drain well and refrigerate until cooled. Toss together rice and remaining ingredients and chill for at least 2 hours.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In an ungreased 2-quart baking dish, combine the first four ingredientscut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the fruitspread over the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

In a bowl, mix butter, sugar, eggs, cottage cheese and flour until well blended. Pour into 9X13 glass baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35 minutes. Pour milk over hot dumplings. Sprinkle fruit over top.

Combine apple juice and cornstarch in saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon and walnuts. Pour into greased and floured 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with raisins and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until done.
Cut cantaloupe in pieces and blend with sugar in a blender. Add milk, cardamom powder and ice cubes and blend again. Serve immediately.

Mix together cream cheese and granulated sugar. Add 1 cup of Cool Whip. Fold in crushed pineapple. Spread onto graham cracker pie crust. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Let cool. Meanwhile make lemon pudding mix according to package directions. Add 1 cup of Cool Whip and spread over pineapple layer. Refrigerate until serving. Sprinkle with a small amount of Cool Whip and garnish with lemon slices.
Brush mushroom caps with cooking spray. In small bowl, combine margarine, garlic salt and paprika. Spoon into mushroom caps and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake 20 minutes.

Combine sugar substitute, molasses, vanilla and salt in saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat until the mixture reaches 230 f on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in egg white until it is well blended. Stir in popcorn and peanuts. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto lightly greased baking sheets. Bake at 250 f for 45 minutes or until popcorn is crisp. Yield 12 servings (1/3 cup per serving)

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Season both sides of each fish with salt and black pepper. Place each piece of fish skin-side up in a large baking dish. Slice potato into thin rounds. Place a small slice of potato on each fish fillet. Sprinkle with rosemary. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until potato is crispy.

In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Mix well and pour into greased and floured 10-inch bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool for 20 minutes in pan before removing to cool on wire rack. Serve warm or cool. Delicious with vanilla ice cream.
